      k a August Highlights and 2024 AoPS Online Class Information
      jlacosta   0
      Aug 1, 2024
      CONGRATULATIONS Team USA for their stellar performance at this years IMO (International Mathematical Olympiad) earning 5 Gold Medals and 1 Silver Medal and taking first place! We are proud to say that each member of the 2024 IMO team has participated in an AoPS WOOT (Worldwide Online Olympiad Training) class! Interested to learn more about our WOOT programs? Check out the course page here or join a Free Scheduled Info Session. Early bird pricing ends August 19th!

      [list][*]ChemWOOT Chemistry Jam - August 6th (Tuesday)
      [*]CodeWOOT Code Jam - August 8th (Thursday)
      [*]PhysicsWOOT Physics Jam - August 12th (Monday)
      [*]MathWOOT Math Jam - August 15th (Thursday)[/list]
      There is still time to enroll in our last wave of summer camps that start in August at the Virtual Campus, our video-based platform, for math and language arts! From Math Beasts Camp 6 (Prealgebra Prep) to AMC 10/12 Prep, you can find an informative 2-week camp before school starts. Plus, our math camps dont have homework and cover cool enrichment topics like graph theory. Our language arts courses will build the foundation for next years challenges, such as Language Arts Triathlon for levels 5-6 and Academic Essay Writing for high school students.

      Be on the lookout for our new Introduction to Counting and Probability Self-Paced course, which will be available at the beginning of this month! For students who have finished Introduction to Algebra A, they now have a new option available to work through the material at their own pace.

      Lastly, Fall is right around the corner! You can plan your Fall schedule now with classes at either AoPS Online, AoPS Academy Virtual Campus, or one of our AoPS Academies around the US. Weve opened new Academy locations in Mountain View, CA, Millburn, NJ, and Redmond, WA.

      Our full course list for upcoming classes is below:
      All classes run 7:30pm-8:45pm ET/4:30pm - 5:45pm PT unless otherwise noted.

      i Mafia Players Sign-ups
      smallpeoples343   27028
      N 5 hours ago by Socoobo
      Welcome to the Mafia Forum! Please read the Mafia FAQ before signing up for a game. Thanks!

      To join a Regular or Mini Mafia Game, please wait for the sign ups of such a game to open. Generally, the moderator of that game will make a post announcing their game with instructions regarding how to join. There is no Regular/Mini Queue; you'll have to watch the thread for updates on upcoming games.

      To join a Newbie Mafia Game as a Newbie, join the Newbie Queue. Please post "/join" if you are a Newbie (see FAQ above). Before each Newbie Mafia Game, the top nine or so people on the queue, with 1st timers and others in an approximate 2:1 ratio, will be PM'd. If you would like to remain on the queue (though you were too late for the game, or otherwise cannot play in this game but would like to play in a future one), respond to this PM. In addition, the first six responders within 48 hours will be able to participate in the game. This process will be repeated, going down the list until the six Newbie participants have been selected. If you receive such a PM on two separate occasions and do not respond to either of them, your name will be removed from the Newbie Queue.
      Please do not sign up again if you are already on the queue, or your original queue position will be forfeited in place of the later position.

      To join a Newbie Mafia game as an SE or IC, make sure your name is on the Active SEs/ICs list at the bottom of this post. If your name is on the list, you will be collectively notified by PM whenever a Newbie game is available to join. If your name is not on the list, please PM summitwei to get your name added.

      (PSA: Make sure you have receiving PM's turned on, if you want to play. Otherwise, we can't PM you to ask you if you want to join a game.)
      [quote="Newbie Queue (1st timers) * = PM missed at least once"]
      *ethanbaron.kim
      *BananaPenguin

      i Replacements Thread
      Klebian   3982
      N Aug 3, 2024 by NDMath
      This thread is where moderators post to notify others that they need a replacement for a player in their games. Players can either respond when a moderator posts here, or can sign up for replacing before a moderator requests.

      You can replace in any game in which you have had no prior involvement. This obviously means you should not have played (if it is absolutely necessary, mods may ask players to replace who died early and were the equivalent of a vanilla [flavorless] townie), and you should not know about the setup or anything like that aside from what is posted in the thread.
      3982 replies
      Klebian
      Aug 5, 2008

      i Mafia FAQ
      smallpeoples343   1743
      N Aug 3, 2024 by aayr
      Being filled with information.

      In the City, all was well. The villagers lived peacefully with their police officers strolling around to ensure that no one suspicious was walking around. All were oblivious of the underground threat just waiting for the right moment, the right time to strike. As it happened, that time... was now.

      Welcome to Mafia, a psychological game focused on the outcome of a scenario where the informed minority (mafia) is pitted against the oblivious majority (town).

      The goal of the town is to eliminate the mafia using any means possible to assure the safety of their civilians.
      The goal of the mafia is to slowly eliminate town members until the mafia can outnumber the town.

      Gameplay (and Roles)
      Mafia is played as a game of stages. There are two main stages in Mafia:

      Day
      Daytime is a time when everyone comes out and discuss with each other about who they think is the mafia. As discussion goes by, people can place a vote on who they suspect is the mafia. If that person is voted to a majority of the players, then that player is hanged and dies. The moderator will then reveal the player's role and alignment (town or scum). After that, the players go back to their beds and night begins.

      Night
      Nighttime is the time for the mafia to premiere from their houses. They leave from secret passageways from their houses to get to a pre-destined meeting spot. There, they discuss on a player that they want to kill. Then, they issue a whisper to the mod, who kills the targeted player. Then, the mafia go back to their houses and pretend to sleep. Day then begins.

      Other than Day and Night, there is also a small sub-stage known as Twilight, which is simply the time between a majority of votes is reached and when the mod posts the hang post. This isn't really a phase, but you are still permitted to speak.


      In a "normal" game of Mafia, there would be a set number of citizens and a set number of mafia members, or mafia goons. However, that's boring. Therefore:
      The Roles

      Vanilla Townie: The Vanilla Townie is a classical role, and is simply a citizen of the City. He/She does not have any special powers other than his/her vote, which he/she can use to suggest who appears to be suspicious. Town-Aligned

      Cop: The Cop is another common role, and is a police officer of the City. He/She is given a flashlight, which he/she can use to inspect one person a night. The cop will then be given a result of "Innocent" or "Guilty". (Innocent refers to a Town-Aligned role and Guilty refers to a Mafia-Aligned role) Town-Aligned

      Doctor: The Doctor is another common role, and is a doctor in the City. He/She is given a medkit, which he/she can use to protect one person a night. That night, if the protected player is targeted by the mafia, the doctor will be able to heal him so that he won't die. Town-Aligned

      Mafia Goon: The Mafia Goon is a common Mafia role. He/She is a simple goon in the mafia and does not have any special powers. Every night, the mafia comes together and targets one player to kill. Mafia-Aligned

      Some Other Common Roles
      [list][*]Roleblocker: Can target one player each night who cannot perform a night action during that night. Town
      [*]Vigilante: Can kill one person each night. Town
      [*]Jailkeeper: A player who can target one player each night who will be protected, but will not be able to perform a role that night. Town
      [*]Mafia Rolecop: A player who can target one player each night, who will receive the player's role. Mafia
      [*]Mafia Roleblocker: Can target one player each night who cannot perform a night action during that night. Mafia[/list]

      More Roles
      Town
      [list][*]Watcher: Can target one player in the night, and will receive a report of who targeted that player during the night.
      [*]Tracker: Can target one player in the night, and will receive a report of who the player targeted during the night.
      [*]Mason: A group of Town-Aligned people who are confirmed town to each other and can talk to each other in the night.
      [list][*]Recruiting Mason: A mason member who can choose one person to appoint into the mason each night. If that player is Town-Aligned, then the player is appointed. If that player is Mafia-Aligned, the Recruiting Mason is killed.[/list]
      [*]Role Cop: A cop who receives the role of the targeted player.
      [*]Bodyguard: A player who can protect one player from being killed each night, but if the protected player is targeted by the Mafia, the Bodyguard dies.
      [*]Vengeful: A vengeful is a townie in every way except if hanged, he can immediately kill one player.
      [*]SINP Cops: Cops of Differing Sanity. If you are a Cop, which Sanity you are might not be disclosed.
      [list][*]Sane Cop: A normal cop. Will receive honest results.
      [*]Insane Cop: An insane cop will have opposite results. Town will look "Guilty" and Mafia will look "Innocent"
      [*]Naive Cop: Always receives a result of "Innocent"
      [*]Paranoid Cop: Always receives a result of "Guilty"[/list][/list]

      Mafia
      [list][*]Mafia Godfather: A Mafia leader. If inspected by a Cop, the result will be "Innocent".[/list]

      Third-Party
      Sometimes, there will be other third-parties:

      Serial Killer: One-person scum. One kill every night. Wins if everyone else is dead.

      Cult: A separate kind of scum faction. Can talk during the night. Does not have a night kill.
      [list][*]Cult Recruiter: Can recruit one person every night to the Cult. If recruited is Town, the person is turned into a Cult Member. If recruited is Mafia, Cult Recruiter dies.
      [*]Cult Member: A town-aligned player who was recruited to the Cult. Wins if Cult overpowers all.[/list]

      Survivor: Wins if he/she is alive by the endgame.


      For a complete listing, visit http://mikeburnfire.sitesled.com/mscumB.swf

      Commonly used Mafia Terms
      Bandwagon - To follow the general thinking, or to "sheep" off others (going with the flow)
      BM - Short for "Bastard Mod", who can lie to players (including in role pm), uses a relatively screwed up setup where players might change roles, alliances, and sometimes with messed up, new roles. Generally not good for a newb game.
      Breadcrumbing - A post which hides certain clues in a very subtle manner
      Cult - A third-party mafia with no night kill.
      EBWON - Edit by way of Ninja'd - when you click "Submit" and someone beat you to posting, which requires you to change your post
      EBWOP - Edit by way of Post - because you are not allowed to edit posts in Mafia.
      FoS - Finger of Suspicion
      Hammer - The last vote on a certain person before he/she is hanged
      IC - Inexperience Challenged, basically an experienced player chosen by the community or the mods to help newbies learn the game.
      JOAT - Jack of all Trades
      L-n - For a natural number , this means a person needs more votes in order to be hanged.
      LAL - Hang all Liars
      Lurking - When a certain person barely contributes to discussion, which is a big clue to scumminess
      LYLO - Hang or Lose, state where you must keep hanging mafia to win (one misstep = lose)
      MYLO - Mishang and Lose, state where you must keep hanging mafia OR vote No Hang to win (hang town = lose)
      Newb - Contrast to Noob. Someone who is a new player to Mafia. (Derived from the word "newbie")
      Newb Card - When a new player uses the excuse of simply being a newbie when a mistake is made. The alternate form is "Noob Card" and uses the fact that they are a noob, but this is much less believable.
      NK - Abbreviation for Night Kill.
      Noob - Contrast to Newb. Someone who acts like a new player to Mafia.
      OMGUS - OMG You Suck, I'm gonna vote you because you voted me. (Used in joking fashion)
      Power Roles - Roles with power (double vote for example)
      PR - Either "Power Role" or "Post Restriction".
      QT - QuickTopic, a secret discussion page for a small group (Mason, Mafia, Cult)
      Roleclaim (RC) - When someone asks another to claim what their role is
      RT(F)P - Read the (Freaking) Posts
      Scum - Synonymous to "mafia"
      SE - Semi-Experienced, a player who has completed two games and thus assist the ICs in teaching the newbies.
      SK - Serial Killer
      V/LA - Vacation/Limited Access. Scourge and destroyer of game activity, if you know you will be V/LA during a game, preferably don't join to play, and DON'T MOD! Seriously, this causes game abandoning.
      VI - village idiot, a person who consistently acts contrary to town interests as if he has no idea what he's doing
      Vig - Short for Vigilante. It is a role that is a town-aligned nightkiller.
      WIFOM - Wine in front of me. A subgame in which a player is given a set of apparently equal choices where one or more is completely wrong. (Related to Reverse Psychology)

      Joining a Game
      To join a mafia newbie game, navigate yourself to the Mafia Players Sign-ups and join the queue by typing "/join newbie queue" or "/join newbie". A mod will then come and add you to the queue.

      To join a mini/large game, it's suggested you play through a newbie first. In case you want to join a mini/large right away, just type "/join mg##", where ## is the number of the Mafia Game you want to join. A mod will add you to the queue.

      Modding a Game
      Modding a game is slightly more difficult than playing one. To help the players and you, all game mods must be approved by a forum mod to run a game.
      Long Process (by willwang123)
      Step 1: Decide that you want to mod and sign up in the Mafia Moderators thread. Be sure to also indicate which type of game you wish to mod (newbie, mini, or large). You will be added to the respective queue. This will put your game at Level 0 of 5.
      . Note: To mod a mini, you must be an SE, IC, or have 1 co-mod or modding experience. To mod a large or a newbie game, you must have 1 modding experience.
      Step 2: Create your game, which should include roles, role distribution, and flavor (optional). This will put your game at Level 3 of 5.
      Step 3: Once you have your setup complete, post on the Moderator thread that you need a reviewer for your setup. Once someone reviews your setup for balance, your game is at Level 4 of 5.
      Step 4: It is strongly suggested that you begin drafting/writing Role PMs and your first mod post. Once your setup is finalized and all ready to go, you are at Level 5 of 5.
      Step 5: Wait until a forum mod clears you and permits you to open signups.
      Step 6: In the Mafia Players thread, make a post about your game, including a basic flavor idea and the number of players needed. Wait for signups to finish.
      Step 7: Once signups finish, a forum mod should open a game thread for you.


      Game Examples
      Town Win: MG118
      Scum Win: MG111
      Closed setup: MG119
      Game with special mechanics: MG109
      Game that every player ought to read to make sure it never happens again: MG73
      Game that every mod ought to read to make sure it never happens again: MG88

      i Mafia SE/IC Application Thread
      Joe10112   6814
      N Jul 31, 2024 by tigeryong
      Hello!

      We are re-vamping the SE and IC method. Please post comments on what you think of our new idea. zmann27 came up with this way to find suitable members of the community to fit the role. This might be changed later.

      REQUIREMENTS:

      SE STATUS: Must have completed 3 Newbie or Regular Games.
      IC STATUS: Must have completed 5 Newbie or Regular Games AND must have modded or co-modded 1 game.

      If you are applying, please follow this template (please provide links for Mafia Games Played):
      Status Applying For:
      Mafia Games Played:

      The mods have discussed a system of qualifications that we will use in the process of deciding whether you qualify as an SE.

      1. The player must have played 3 completed games (games in which that player played at least one full day with a somewhat significant number of posts and wasn't replaced).
      2. The player must be active enough so that we don't have huge activity issues.
      3. The player must demonstrate that they know how mafia works and are fluent in mafia terminology and conventions.
      4. The player must prove that they know how to find scum and construct some sort of logic that points toward someone being scum.
      5. The player doesn't have any other big issues (like a tendency to swear, or being modkilled in a game) that would prevent us from making him/her SE.

      To qualify as an IC, you must be a role model in the current mafia community. Newbie players and SE's must look up to you and be able to ask you for help.

      Applicants

      [quote="Semi-Experienced"][list]
      [/list][/quote]

      [quote="Inexperience Challenged"][list]
      [/list][/quote]

      Accepted
      [quote="Semi-Experienced"][list]
      [*]basketballstar24
      [*]awesomeusername
      [*]fishnchips

      i Mafia Forum Rules
      apple.singer   724
      N May 25, 2024 by K124659
      Hello Mafia Players,
      Based on the recent discussion in many of the Mafia Forum stickies, I think we need a new set of rules that is clear to all and will be best for the interests of the forum, its players, and its quality of games. I have discussed these rules with some fellow moderators (others did not respond to my PM in the last few days; hence, why this list is "tentative") and modified the rules accordingly.

      These rules will be effective as soon as all players understand them and agree to them and we figure out exactly how many games each player has played in/playing in, etc. Note that if you are in violation of any rules at the moment (for example, playing in too many games), this is not a problem; just don't join any new games until these rules say you can.

      To preserve the integrity of the Mafia forum, do not create a topic within it unless you have been directly authorized to do so by PM by a moderator of the forum. Any violator of this rule will be warned, and any repeat violators will be suspended from participating in Mafia games indefinitely.

      Rules for SE/IC:
      1) Any player with 3 or more games completed can apply to be an SE. Success is decided upon by forum mods and, to a lesser degree, the Mafia community.
      2) Any SE with 5 or more games completed can apply to be an IC. Success is decided upon by forum mods, and to a lesser degree, the Mafia community. Note the success rate will be lower, as IC is much more meaningful of a title than SE.
      3) Anyone who is not an SE or an IC will be referred to as a newbie, regardless of how many games they have completed.
      Note: The terms "newbie", "SE", and "IC" should not be used in any manner for determining sign-up lists of non-newbie games (unlike the typical 6-2-1 arrangement in newbie games) but should be kept in mind due to the game limit: see Rules for Game Players below.

      Definition of a Completed Game:
      A game is considered "completed" by a player if:
      1) The player is not replaced until the end of the game.
      2) The player does not partake in activities/playstyles such as game-throwing, excessive fluff, etc.
      3) The game is not player-abandoned.
      Mod-abandoned games and replace-ins will be dealt with on a case-to-case basis. If you replace in early in a game, you will likely be considered as completing the game. (Example: me, in Mafia Game 57) If you replace late in the game, you will likely NOT be considered as completing the game. (No examples, but I'm sure you can find them) Mod-abandoned games in late-game states will likely be considered completed, mod-abandoned games in early-game states will likely NOT be considered completed BUT the game should be restarted with the same players and a better mod.

      Note: "games completed" do not necessarily have to be on AoPS. If you send us (the moderators) a link to a forum (NOT chat or chat-style) game you have completed (such as one on mafiascum), and we see that your play is up to standards, that will count as a game completed. However, we would like to see you play in AoPS before granting SE/IC status.

      Rules for Game Players:
      1) A newbie with 0 completed games can only play in 1 game. That game must be a newbie game. Exceptions may be made on a case-to-case basis.
      2) A newbie with 1 completed game can only play in 2 games.
      3) A newbie with 2 or more completed games can play in any number of games.
      4) A newbie cannot be in more than 1 newbie game at a time. This is designed to increase opportunities for newer players to play more often.
      5) Do not discuss ongoing games without the permission of the moderator of that game.
      6) Do not post in games you are not participating in.
      7) Do not spam.
      8) Obey all instructions given by the moderator of a game which you are participating in provided that the instructions are related to said game and do not violate any forum rules.

      Rules for Game Mods/Comods:
      1) All game mods must be SEs or ICs that have previously comodded a game.
      2) All game comods must have at least 2 completed games.
      3) If you mod-abandon a game or mod an unsuccessful game, you may not mod another game until you have successfully (actively, correctly, efficiently) comodded another game.

      These rules will be edited/updated/added to if necessary. Feel free to discuss in this thread (but please, only in this thread, so that the other stickies can become less congested).

      Also, 2500th post.
      724 replies
      apple.singer
      Apr 7, 2013
      K124659
      May 25, 2024

      Mafia Game 294: Genshin Impact Mafia
      fdas   529
      N 7 minutes ago by tigeryong
      Welcome to Mafia Game 294: Genshin Mafia
      Rules
      [list][*]Rules
      [list]
      [*]1.1: Read the rules. All of them. Read them multiple times if necessary.
      [*]1.2: Do not post at night.
      [*]1.3: You may PM me at any time and ask me anything, such as rule clarification.
      [*]1.4: Do not quote or pretend to quote any PMs from me, including role PMs. Do not refer to private conversations with the moderator in any way unless given permission.
      [*]1.5: Do not talk about this game outside of this topic to anyone other than the mods in charge, unless I specifically allow you to do so.
      [*]1.6: You may not use any formatting that has an effect of concealing text. This includes size=1, hide="", color=#FFFFFF, and color=white, among others. This does not include adding extra spaces.
      [*]1.7: Do not edit or delete posts you have already submitted; this includes editing right after you post (what goes in the thread stays in the thread). If you for any reason find the need to change your post, use EBWOP or EBWON as necessary.
      [*]1.8: If you are not a living participant of the game, do not post anything else about the game anywhere. You may still spectate the game, but you may no longer post in this thread.
      [*]1.9: Do not advocate for breaking the rules.
      [*]1.10: Do not use the colors red (#FF0000), blue (#0000FF), green (#00FF00), or anything that appears similar, as these colors are used for modding purposes.
      [*]1.11: Confirm by listening to a song from Genshin Impact and posting in your role pm your analysis of the musical quality of the song and your feelings when listening to it.[/list]

      [*] Voting/Hanging
      [list]
      [*] 2.1: Post votes in code tags in the format [code]Vote: <insert player here>[/code]
      Since AoPS does not distinguish between usernames with different capitalizations, the capitalization of the player name does not matter. A proper vote looks like [code]Vote: fdas[/code]
      [*] 2.2: Votes may not be placed in hide tags.
      [*] 2.3: Improperly made votes will not be counted under any circumstances. It does not matter if it is the end of the game hammer and everyone revealed their roles. Hint: dont reveal your roles and declare victory until I made the official end of the game post.
      [*] 2.4: You may vote for no hang to occur during a day. Vote this by including in your post [code]Vote: No Hang[/code]
      [*] 2.5: You do not have to unvote before making a new vote, though it is appreciated if you do so. Unvote in the format [code]Vote: Unvote[/code]
      An unvote will undo your previous vote, if any.
      [*] 2.6: Spell the username of the player you wish to vote for exactly. Do not use nicknames.
      [*] 2.7: If at any point in a day more than half of the votes are for a single player, that player will be hanged. It will then immediately be twilight.
      [*] 2.8: If at any point in a day at least half of the votes are for no hang, then there will be no hang. It will then be twilight.
      [*] 2.9: If the deadline is met and no person is hanged, it will be considered no hang and will proceed to be twilight.
      [*] 2.10: The moment the deadline passes, no more votes will be counted even if the mod has not made a post.
      [*] 2.11: During twilight, players may still post. However, no more votes and/or unvotes will be processed.
      [*] 2.12: Once I post a end-of-day scene, the person hanged (if any) is officially dead. Night then immediately begins. You may not post during night.[/list]

      [*] Activity
      [list]
      [*] 3.1: Each day will be 336 hours (2 weeks). The moderator may extend the deadline for the end of the day at his/her discretion. Note that this will be unlikely.
      [*] 3.2: The deadlines will follow the official time
      [*] 3.3: The deadline will occur the very second 336 hours has occurred.
      [*] 3.4: The night deadline will be 72 hours after night begins
      [*] 3.5: When the night deadline is met, if the moderator does not receive a night action from either a player or his/her partner(s) (if you have them), the player will lose the chance to perform an action during that night.
      [*] 3.6: Any night results will be sent after the night deadline
      [*] 3.7: Night will end at some time after the night deadline when the mod makes the post announcing the end of night.
      [*] 3.8: If a player does not post in a 48-hour period and he/she is not in V/LA, you will receive an in-game prod.
      [*] 3.9: If a player does not post in another 24-hour period after receiving an in-game prod and he/she is not in V/LA, he/she will receive a PM prod.
      [*] 3.10: If a player does not post in another 48-hour period after receiving a PM prod and he/she is not in V/LA, he/she will be replaced, unless you post before the moderator finds a replacement.
      [*] 3.11: If a player receives 5 PM Prods, he/she will be replaced
      [*] 3.12: If a player is going to be V/LA, he/she must post in bold in-thread or PM me. The moderator will not prod the player unless the V/LA is too long.[list]


      [*]Etiquette
      [list]
      [*] 4.1: Do not use inappropriate language.
      [*] 4.2: Do not make any personal attacks.
      [*] 4.3: Follow all of the rules.
      [*] 4.4: Be mature.
      [*] 4.5: For a minor rule infraction, players can receive up to two warnings. If a player commits an infraction after he/she has run out of warnings, or commits a modkill level infraction, he/she will be modkilled or force replaced. Please do not make me modkill you.[/list]


      [*] Moderators/Co-Moderators
      [list]
      [*] 5.1: I fdas am the moderator of Mafia Game 294
      [*] 5.2: The not voting section is to be ignored if it contradicts any other part of the votecount
      [*] 5.3: If an error to the votecount is not pointed out within 5 days, the incorrect votecount will become official.
      [*] 5.4: The moderator may change the rules at any time.
      [*] 5.5: The moderator has the last say in interpreting the rules. [/list]


      [*] Read all of the rules[/list]

      Alive (13)
      Scipio1
      mathjay
      WisteriaV
      K124659

      Dead(0)
       


      Events
      [/url]


      PM Prods
       


      Warnings
       


      Story
      Atop the snowy peaks of Dragonspine, a mysterious being escaped from where they had been trapped for so long. He observed the humans within in the city of Mondstadt, how they lived their carefree lives each day, smiling, laughing, and having fun. A life that he himself could not have. Yet his counterpart lived among the people as one of them, living an undeserved life which was stolen from him.

      Now, a group of adventurers were climbing the mountain, seeking treasure or whatever it was that humans sought. Soon, he would take his place among them, and they would be none the wiser. A gust of wind filled the air with a flurry of snow, filling the area with white. When the snow dissipated, the unknown figure was gone.


      Do not post until this line is crossed out.

      Day 1 begins at 01:00:00 EST 12 August 2024.

      Off Topic Discussion
      fdas   2887
      N 36 minutes ago by yaxuan
      This thread is for discussion about topics that do not belong in the other threads of this forum. Discussion of those topics outside of this thread is prohibited.

      Please note that this does not mean it is okay to spam here. Please keep spam to a minimum.

      All forum rules must still be followed in this thread.

      Mafia Game 293: A New Deck
      NDMath   1493
      N an hour ago by ostriches88
      Mafia Game 293
      A New Deck


      [list][*]Rules
      [list]
      [*]Read the rules. All of them. Read them multiple times if necessary.
      [*]Do not post at night.
      [*]You may PM me at any time and ask me anything, such as rule clarification.
      [*]Do not quote or pretend to quote any PMs from me, including role PMs.
      [*]Do not talk about this game outside of this topic to anyone other than the mods in charge, unless I specifically allow you to do so.
      [*]Day chat will be enabled via an AoPS private forum.
      [*]You may not use any formatting that has an effect of concealing text. This includes hide="", color=#FFFFFF, and color=white, among others.
      [*]Do not edit or delete posts you have already submitted; this includes editing right after you post (what goes in the thread stays in the thread). If you for any reason find the need to change your post, use EBWOP or EBWON as necessary.
      [*]If you are not a living participant of the game, do not post anything else about the game anywhere. You may still spectate the game, but you may no longer post in this thread.
      [*]Do not advocate for breaking the rules.
      [*]Do not imitate the mods.[/list]

      [*] Voting/Elimination
      [list]
      [*]This game will partially use the voting rules philosophy of "if it looks like a vote, it's a vote". So spelling/capitalization does not matter so long as the Vote: part is right, and the following two rules are met.
      [*]Post votes in bold font in the format "Vote: <insert player here>", or c or code text: [code]Vote: <insert player here>[/code].
      [*]Votes may not be placed in hide tags.
      [*]You may vote for no elimination to occur during a day. Vote this by including in your post "Vote: No Elimination" or: [code]Vote: No Elimination[/code].
      [*]You do not have to unvote before making a new vote, though you have the ability to do so. Unvote in the format "Unvote" or: [code]Unvote[/code]. An unvote will undo your previous vote, if any.
      [*]If the deadline is met the player with the most votes is eliminated. If there is a tie, the player who received the votes first is eliminated. If No Elimination is part of the tie, No Elimination occurs.
      [*]Starting day 2, If more than half of the votes are for a single player, that player will be eliminated. It will then immediately be twilight.
      [*]Starting day 2, If at least half of the votes are for no elimination, then there will be no elimination. It will then be twilight.
      [*]The moment the deadline passes, it will be twilight and no more votes will be counted even if the mod has not made a post.
      [*]During twilight, players may still post. However, no more votes and/or unvotes will be processed.
      [*]Once I (or the comod) post a end-of-day scene, the person eliminated (if any) is officially dead. Night then immediately begins. You may not post during night.[/list]


      [*] Activity
      [list]
      [*]Each day will be 240 hours (10 days). The moderator may extend the deadline for the end of the day at their discretion.
      [*]The deadline will occur the very second 240 hours has occurred.
      [*]The night deadline will be 48 hours after night begins.
      [*]When the night deadline is met, if the moderator does not receive a night action from either a player or his/her partner(s) (if you have them), the player will lose the chance to perform an action during that night.
      [*]Night will end at some time after the night deadline when the mod makes the post announcing the end of night.
      [*]If a player does not post in a 48-hour period and they are not in V/LA, you will receive a PM prod.
      [*]If a player does not post in another 24-hour period after receiving a PM prod and they are not in V/LA, they will be replaced, unless you post before the moderator finds a replacement.
      [*]If a player is going to be V/LA, they must PM me. The moderator will not prod the player unless the V/LA is too long.[list]


      [*]Etiquette
      [list]
      [*]Do not use inappropriate language or make personal attacks.
      [*]Be mature.
      [*]The game is to not be considered over until the mod declares it as such.
      [*]Don't intentionally/purposely gamethrow. If you believe you can no longer win talk to me in your role pm.
      [*]For a minor rule infraction, players can receive up to two warnings. If a player commits an infraction after they have run out of warnings, or commits a modkill level infraction, they may be modkilled or force replaced. Please do not make me modkill you.[/list]


      [*] Moderators
      [list]
      [*]I (NDMath) am the moderator of Mafia Game 293.
      [*]This brown (#974E03) is my mod color. Do not post in anything too similar.
      [*]The moderator may change the rules at any time.
      [*]The moderator has the last say in interpreting the rules.[/list]


      [*] Read all of the rules[/list]
      Story
      Seven new blank cards were picked to receive values today. To have the first chapter of their respective stories written. Each suit was requested to send a representative to the grand ceremony. However, the pesky Jokers caught wind of this, and decided to come ruin the ceremony.

      Not only this, but they were also able to convince one of the Suit Representatives to join them, for one reason or another. The blank cards were never going to be able to get their values now unless they can identify and put a stop to the Jokers.

      A first chapter to their stories, this would certainly be.


      Setup
      Mafia are multitasking by default.

      The action resolution for this game is Reasonable Action Resolution.
      Private Chats are via AoPS forum with daychat enabled.
      No action may self-target.

      The setup is Suited13 (below).
      There was one final change since the second draft of the setup, which is that the Mafia Joat performing an action will appear as the suit to the Flavor Follower that the action is from, instead of as the mafia.


      To generate the setup, a card will be drawn at random from a standard deck. The suit and # determine the column and row for the mafias role. The town will then receive one role from each of the other three columns, summing up to the same number of points.
      A-6 represent the six ways to have a 3/2/1 point split. Specifically
      After removing the scum role's column, there are three columns left. An Ace would indicate taking the 3 points role from the left of those, the 2 points from the middle and 1 point from the right. A 2 would still mean taking the 3 points role from the left, but the 2 points role from the right and 1 point from the middle. Etc through the six permutations.

      7 indicates all three two point roles.
      8-10 represents the three ways to have a 2/2/1 point split.
      J-K represent the three ways to have a 3/1/1 point split.

      Then 7 Vanilla Townies, 1 Mafia Joat (Flavor Follower, Roleblocker, Rolestopper) and 1 Mafia Goon will be added and roles will be distributed.


      Example Role PMs
      [quote=BLANK Card (Vanilla Townie)]
      Hello USERNAME,

      Welcome to Mafia Game 293, you are a BLANK Card (Vanilla Townie). After being told you would receive a value today, that no longer seems guaranteed to be true. It looks to be in your hands to ensure that the ceremony can go on and catch the Jokers. You have no abilities other than your voice and your vote.

      You win when all Mafia (Jokers and their ally) are dead.
      [/quote]
      [quote=King of Spades (Odd-Night Vigilante)]
      Hello USERNAME,

      Welcome to Mafia Game 293, you are a King of Spades (Town Odd-Night Vigilante). Instead of sending a representative, you felt the need to oversee the ceremony yourself. Unfortunately, that wasn't enough, and you need to take action. On each odd numbered night, you may attempt to kill a player.

      You win when all Mafia (Jokers and their ally) are dead.
      [/quote]
      [quote=Ten of Spades (Roleblocker)]
      Hello USERNAME,

      Welcome to Mafia Game 293, you are a Ten of Spades (Town Roleblocker). You were sent to the ceremony on behalf of the Spades to ensure nothing went wrong. After the ceremony's disruption, you have decided to act as a strong wall to prevent any further chaos. Each night, you may attempt to roleblock a player, preventing their action(s).

      You win when all Mafia (Jokers and their ally) are dead.
      [/quote]
      [quote=Ace of Spades (Universal Backup)]
      Hello USERNAME,

      Welcome to Mafia Game 293, you are an Ace of Spades (Town Universal Backup). You were sent to the ceremony on behalf of the Spades to ensure nothing went wrong. You aren't prepared to do anything yet, but it never hurts a team to have an Ace up their sleeves. Upon the death of the first Town aligned power role, you gain their abilities.

      You win when all Mafia (Jokers and their ally) are dead.
      [/quote]
      [quote=Queen of Clubs (Personal Watcher)]
      Hello USERNAME,

      Welcome to Mafia Game 293, you are a Queen of Clubs (Town Personal Watcher). It was a very personal matter to you that you specifically watched the ceremony. Unfortunately, now you need to watch for who did what to sort out this mess. Each night, you may attempt to watch a player, to learn who used an action on them, besides the mafia's factional kill. Possible results are a list of one or more names (including repeats), nobody, or 'No Result'.

      You win when all Mafia (Jokers and their ally) are dead.
      [/quote]
      [quote=Jack of Clubs (Flavor Follower)]
      Hello USERNAME,

      Welcome to Mafia Game 293, you are a Jack of Clubs (Town Flavor Follower). The Queen sent you personally to watch over the ceremony. You are familiar with all the suits, and use that to your advantage. Each night, you may attempt to follow a player, to learn the suit of any action they use that night. Possible results are a list of one or more of Spades, Clubs, Hearts, Diamonds, Jokers (specifically for the faction kill), none, or 'No Result'.

      You win when all Mafia (Jokers and their ally) are dead.
      [/quote]
      [quote=Two of Clubs (Motion Detector)]
      Hello USERNAME,

      Welcome to Mafia Game 293, you are a Two of Clubs (Town Motion Detector). The Queen sent you, the least of the Clubs, to watch over the ceremony. And now that things have gone wrong, you know you need to not disappoint. Each night, you may attempt to learn if there was motion around a player; defined as either them using an action or a player that isn't you using an action on them that night. Possible results are Motion, No Motion, or 'No Result'.

      You win when all Mafia (Jokers and their ally) are dead.
      [/quote]
      [quote=Five of Hearts (Neapolitan)]
      Hello USERNAME,

      Welcome to Mafia Game 293, you are a Five of Hearts (Town Neapolitan). You were sent by the King to witness the ceremony, and found a list of who was in to take detailed notes. That list is looking pretty useful now, but unfortunately, the blank cards that everyone is or is pretending to be aren't easy to distinguish so it takes some careful comparisons to determine who is on your list. Each night, you may attempt to learn if a player is a Blank Card. Possible results are Vanilla Townie, Not a Vanilla Townie, or 'No Result'.

      You win when all Mafia (Jokers and their ally) are dead.
      [/quote]
      [quote=Nine of Hearts (Doctors)]
      Hello USERNAME,

      Welcome to Mafia Game 293, you are a Nine of Hearts (Town Doctor). You were sent by the King to witness the ceremony, and always try to share your hearts. That list is looking pretty necessary right now, as who knows what tricks the Jokers will try. Each night, you may attempt to protect a player from up to one kill attempt.

      You win when all Mafia (Jokers and their ally) are dead.
      [/quote]
      [quote=King of Hearts (Compulsive Fruit Vendor)]
      Hello USERNAME,

      Welcome to Mafia Game 293, you are a King of Hearts (Town Compulsive Fruit Vendor). You decided to watch over the ceremony yourself, and naturally, brought enough fruit to share. This fruit must be handed out, as if you try to take it back to your kingdom it will go bad. Each night, you must select a player to attempt to give a piece of fruit to. Failure to do so will result in your target being randomized.

      You win when all Mafia (Jokers and their ally) are dead.
      [/quote]
      [quote=Fruit Message]You received a piece of fruit last night.[/quote]
      [quote=Eight of Diamonds (Lazy Jailkeeper)]
      Hello USERNAME,

      Welcome to Mafia Game 293, you are an Eight of Diamonds (Town Lazy Jailkeeper). You were sent to watch over the ceremony and keep everyone in line. However, this has not been happening, so you will need to step up at least until most of the troublemakers are taken care of. Each night where there is more than one mafia alive, you may select a player to attempt to both prevent their action and protect them from all kills that night.

      You win when all Mafia (Jokers and their ally) are dead.
      [/quote]
      [quote=Three of Diamonds (Indecisive Rolestopper)]
      Hello USERNAME,

      Welcome to Mafia Game 293, you are a Three of Diamonds (Town Indecisive Rolestopper). You were sent to watch over the ceremony and keep everyone in line, but are underconfident. However, now you will have to step up, even as you're questioning your decisions. Each night, you may select a player different to the one you selected the previous night (if any) to attempt to prevent all other actions targeting them that night.

      You win when all Mafia (Jokers and their ally) are dead.
      [/quote]
      [quote=Ace of Diamonds (1-Shot Bulletproof)]
      Hello USERNAME,

      Welcome to Mafia Game 293, you are an Ace of Diamonds (Town 1-Shot Bulletproof). You were sent to watch over the ceremony, but as a valuable card you keep yourself secured at all times. The first time you a kill at night would succeed on you, you instead survive.

      You win when all Mafia (Jokers and their ally) are dead.
      [/quote]
      [quote=Black Joker (Mafia Goon)]
      Hello USERNAME,

      Welcome to Mafia Game 293, you are a Black Joker (Mafia Goon). You and the Red Joker (USERNAME) have hatched a plan to disrupt the ceremony of seven new cards gaining their value. You were also able to convince one suited card (USERNAME) to help out your cause, or perhaps that's just a clone of you and you tied down the card you were trying to convince somewhere, it's hard to say for sure.

      You have a factional kill, and a factional private chat which the link to will be in the next message.

      You win when out of living players your faction reaches parity with the Town.
      [/quote]
      [quote=Red Joker (Mafia Joat)]
      Hello USERNAME,

      Welcome to Mafia Game 293, you are a Red Joker (Mafia Joat (Flavor Follower, Roleblocker, Rolestopper)). You and the Black Joker (USERNAME) have hatched a plan to disrupt the ceremony of seven new cards gaining their value. They convinced one suited card (USERNAME) to help out your cause, or perhaps that's just Black Joker's clone, it's hard to say for sure. You have access to some abilities which you have learned from intently studying other cards. Each night you may perform one of the following abilities that you haven't attempted to perform before:
      Flavor Follower - You may attempt to learn the suit(s) of actions performed by a target player. Possible results are a list of one or more of Spades, Clubs, Hearts, Diamonds, Jokers (specifically for the faction kill), none, or 'No Result'.
      Roleblocker - You may attempt to prevent a target player's action(s).
      Rolestopper - You may attempt to prevent all other actions targeting a selected player.

      You have a factional kill, and a factional private chat which the link to will be in the next message.

      You win when out of living players your faction reaches parity with the Town.
      [/quote]
      [quote=Six of Something (Mafia Informed)]
      Hello USERNAME,

      Welcome to Mafia Game 293, you are a Six of Something (Mafia Informed). You have decided to join forces with the Black Joker (USERNAME) and Red Joker (USERNAME) to put an end to this ceremony. After all, your ink has faded so badly, it's hard to tell what suit you even are; why should these new cards all get fresh ink when you're stuck like this? Additionally, you know that you are a {Spade/Club/Diamond} and as such there are no Town Power Roles from that suit. This information will be removed upon your flip.

      You have a factional kill, and a factional private chat which the link to will be in the next message.

      You win when out of living players your faction reaches parity with the Town.
      [/quote]
      [quote=Jack of Spades (Mafia 2-Shot Roleblocker)]
      Hello USERNAME,

      Welcome to Mafia Game 293, you are a Jack of Spades (Mafia 2-Shot Roleblocker). You were sent to the ceremony on behalf of the Spades to ensure nothing went wrong. However, you were feeling rebellious and decided to join forces with the Black Joker (USERNAME) and Red Joker (USERNAME) to put an end to this ceremony. During up to two nights in the game, you may attempt to roleblock a player, preventing their action(s).

      You have a factional kill, and a factional private chat which the link to will be in the next message.

      You win when out of living players your faction reaches parity with the Town.
      [/quote]
      [quote=Seven of Clubs (Mafia Tracker)]
      Hello USERNAME,

      Welcome to Mafia Game 293, you are a Seven of Clubs (Mafia Tracker). The queen sent you to watch over the ceremony. However, you were sick of just being a good luck charm and decided to join forces with the Black Joker (USERNAME) and Red Joker (USERNAME) to put an end to this ceremony. Each night, you may target a player to attempt to learn who they visited that night. Possible results are a list of one or more players, nobody, or 'No Result'.

      You have a factional kill, and a factional private chat which the link to will be in the next message.

      You win when out of living players your faction reaches parity with the Town.
      [/quote]
      [quote=Queen of Hearts (Mafia Combined Fruit Vendor Rolecop)]
      Hello USERNAME,

      Welcome to Mafia Game 293, you are a Queen of Hearts (Mafia Combined Fruit Vendor Rolecop). You decided to watch over the ceremony yourself, and naturally, when the opportunity provided itself joined evil to help the Black Joker (USERNAME) and Red Joker (USERNAME) to put an end to this ceremony. You are very clever, but also very careful to cover your tracks. Each night, you may target a player to attempt to both give them a piece of fruit and learn their rolename.

      You have a factional kill, and a factional private chat which the link to will be in the next message.

      You win when out of living players your faction reaches parity with the Town.
      [/quote]
      [quote=Four of Diamonds (Mafia Rolecop)]
      Hello USERNAME,

      Welcome to Mafia Game 293, you are a Four of Diamonds (Mafia Combined Rolecop). You were sent to watch over the ceremony and keep everyone in line, but when offered unthinkable riches, you quickly decided to help the Black Joker (USERNAME) and Red Joker (USERNAME) to put an end to this ceremony. You aim to use your insider knowledge to be of assistance. Each night, you may target a player to attempt to learn their rolename.

      You have a factional kill, and a factional private chat which the link to will be in the next message.

      You win when out of living players your faction reaches parity with the Town.
      [/quote]


      Alive (11)

      Mafia Game 292: TeeHee Mafia 2
      Socoobo   1326
      N 3 hours ago by tigeryong
      [center]Welcome to Mafia Game 292

      TeeHeeTM Mafia 2

      "I teeheeed for so long. My flesh was dull teehee... and my blood, teeheeed. TeeHee after teehee, left in my wake. As I awaited... his teehee. Heed my teehees. I am TeeHee. Blade of TEEHEE. And I have never known teehee."
      - Malenia, probably
      [/center]

      The Most Important Rule
      Any post in this game, whether in the game thread or in private chats, must not contain any content except the following:
      [list]
      [*]Variants Of TeeHee
      A word is a variant of 'TeeHee' if and only if it begins with a single occurrence of the letter 't', followed by at least two occurrences of the letter 'e', followed by a single occurrence of the letter 'h', followed by at least two occurrences of the letter 'e'. Capitalization does not matter; any letter in the word can be uppercase or lowercase.

      For example, the following are variants of the word "teehee":
      [list]
      [*]teehee
      [*]teeeeeeeeeheeeeeeeee
      [*]tEeEhEeE
      [*]TEEEEEEEEHEE
      [/list]

      The following are not variants of the word "teehee":
      [list]
      [*]tehee (only one 'e' between 't' and 'h')
      [*]teahee (misplaced 'a')
      [*]tee hee (space between 'tee' and 'hee')
      [*]TEEHHEE (two occurrences of 'h')
      [/list]

      [*]Valid Punctuation
      Punctuation is considered valid if they are placed in a way consistent to how they would be placed in a grammatically correct sentence.

      For example, the following are valid punctuation:
      [list]
      [*]Teehee!
      [*]teeHee.
      [*]TeeHee - teehee?
      [*](TEEEEEEHEEEEEE)
      [/list]

      The following are not considered valid punctuation:
      [list]
      [*]- . . .... . . (Morse code is not allowed)
      [*]:) (emojis are not allowed)
      [/list]

      [*]BBCode and Markdown
      For features such as numbered lists that are annoying to maintain via formatting code, you may recreate them manually. However, you must make sure that this manual version exactly resembles the formatted version, or you will receive a warning for it.

      A quote block must contain either
      [list]
      [*]one existing post in this thread in its entirety with its corresponding author in the author text field, or
      [*]author and quote text fields containing text that is entirely compliant with the TeeHee rule.
      [/list]

      [*]Valid Votes and Night Actions
      [/list]
      Any post that intentionally violates the spirit of this rule will receive a warning. Each post can only receive a maximum of one warning, regardless of how many times it breaks the rules.Three warnings result in a modkill.

      You do not have to obey this rule within your role PM. Feel free to ask any questions you like or just vent your frustration at me for taking away your freedom of speech.

      The Wish Wall
      A Wish For Incoherence
      Any attempt to encrypt a message in a post will receive a warning. This includes but is not limited to Morse code, hexadecimal, binary, ascii art, etc.

      All The Other Rules
      None of you are newbies. All the other rules are the exact same as every other game you've ever played. There is no confirm rule.

      Nothing to see here.

      Go away.


      Game Information
      [list]
      [*]Phase lengths are 48 | 24. The game is Day start. There is no Dawn.
      [*]Majority hang is always on.
      [*]If two or more player have the same number of votes at EoD, a random one among them will be selected for the hang.
      [*]Players must post at least once per Day phase, or they will be replaced. Due to the nature of the game, all posts are considered game-advancing; there is no such thing as an activity post.
      [*]Mafia have daychat.
      [*]Night actions are not compulsive unless otherwise specified.
      [*]All investigative results are sane.
      [*]Doctors and other healing actions may not consecutively self-target.
      [/list]

      Setup
      I make absolutely zero guarantees that this setup is balanced. Play this game at your own risk.

      The setup is closed. Out of 25 players, 16 players will be Town.


      Alive (3)
      15. Bob_the_Bob (Vanilla Townie)
      17. DXtreme (Uppercase Enthusiast)
      19. Kea13 (Vanilla Townie)

      Dead (22)
      16. EntropiaAwake (Modkilled D1, Vanilla Townie)
      20. AmberTiger79 (Modkilled D1, Town Fruit Vendor)
      18. tigeryong (Hanged D1, Town Fruit Vendor)
      25. sheepsaysmeep (Killed N1, Town Watcher)
      4. Mathletesv (Modkilled D2, Mafia Goon)
      12. dragonlouis Ruegerbyrd (Modkilled D2, Town Compulsive Firebrand)
      5. duke_of_wedgewood (Modkilled D2, Vanilla Townie)
      22. scannose candythecorgi (Hanged D2, Mafia Goon)
      8. RadioActive1729 (Killed N2, Vanilla Townie)
      11. nsd08 (Hanged D3, Vanilla Townie)
      2. snoozingnewt (Killed N3, Lowercase Enthusiast)
      7. NoSignOfTheta (Modkilled D4, Mafia Even-Night Roleblocked)
      24. SpeedCuber7 (Hanged D4, Town Bus Driver)
      23. justJen (Killed N4, Vanilla Townie)
      13. falliinqsnow- (Modkilled D5, Executioner)
      14. BananaBall00 (Modkilled D5, Town Roleblocker)
      3. ad333 (Hanged D5, 1-Shot Bulletproof Arsonist)
      1. Scipio1 (Killed N5, Town Lover)
      21. ostriches88 (Heartbroken N5, Town Lover)
      6. aayr (Hanged D6, Mafia Odd-Night Poisoner)
      9. saturnrocket (Killed N6, Town All-Purpose Doctor)
      10. mathjay (Hanged D7, Mafia Goon)


      The game is over.

      Congratulations to the Town, DXtreme, and falliinqsnow- on winning the game!

      k Mafia Game 290 (UIC Invitational XI)
      Scipio1   1724
      N Sunday at 10:49 PM by fdas
      [center]Welcome to Mafia Game 290
      UIC Invitational XI


      [/center]
      - Important Rules -
      This tab summarizes the most important rules for easy reference.

      For experienced players: everything you need is here, and in the setup tab.
      For new players: you may find it useful to familiarize yourself with the rest of the rules.

      Integrity
      [list][*]Do not edit or delete your posts, even for typos. Just post again.
      [*]Do not OOT (Out of Thread) and talk about this game outside this thread, your role PM, or approved private chats, even if you are dead. Access to spectator chats will be granted upon request.
      [*]Do not gamethrow or intentionally sabotage your wincondition.
      [*]Do not attach files or link to external documents concerning this game. Discussions must stay in this thread.
      [*]Do not use OGI (Out of Game Information). Publicly discussed reads should be made exclusively from information in this thread or past completed games.[/list]

      Activity
      [list][*]Each "Day" is 7 days while each "Night" is 2 days.
      [*]Do not post during night.
      [*]There is no confirm rule.
      [*]This game uses Night 0 Start.
      [*]All times will be in Eastern Standard Time (EST, UTC-5) or Eastern Daylight Time (EDT, UTC-4) as applicable.
      [*]Activity rules are 48 hours to first PM prod, 72 hours to second PM prod, and 96 hours to replacement status.[/list]

      Voting
      [list][*]You must format your votes correctly. Capitalization does not matter, and capital i/lowercase L are not differentiated.
      [*]Both bold vote and code vote formats are accepted, although bold is preferred. Refer to the Voting tab if you do not know what these are.
      [*]Majority hang is off for Day 1, but it is on starting Day 2.
      [*]Deadline hang is always on except for LYLO.
      [*]Votes are locked at LYLO.[/list]

      Etiquette and Warnings

      [list][*]Use common sense.
      [*]Do not use formatting that makes text hard to read.
      [*]You may attack a players opinion, but do not make personal attacks on players themselves.
      [*]Disagreements should be resolved in a way that does not affect gameplay.
      [*]Do not discuss rule violations by other players in the thread; contact the moderators privately.
      [*]First-timers can receive up to 3 warnings before their next offense results in a force replacement or modkill. All other players can receive up to 2.
      [*]Players may be replaced at the moderators' discretion for procedural difficulties.
      [*]All other rules are standard.[/list]

      Setup and Moderators

      [list][*]This game is based on the Pick Your Poison Setup.
      [*]Mafia have access to daychat.
      [*]All role mechanics and Night Action Resolutions are standard.
      [*]This game is moderated by Scipio1.
      [*]This game operates optional discord spectator and mafia private chats using the Unpaid Intern Central server. Contact the mod to request access.[/list]

      Resources and Support

      [list][*]For any issues, you may contact us through your role PM or through Discord.
      [*]For a list of basic resources, refer to the Resources tab below.
      [*]For a more extensive list of resources compiled by the UIMT, go here.
      [*]If this game is causing you significant stress or frustration, feel free to use your role PM to talk or vent. We may not be allowed to give you technical advice, but we can listen or help you find a better way to process events. You may also contact us via Discord if you prefer.[/list]


      [list][*]General
      Credits to Binomial-theorem, chaotic_iak, willwang123, and fdas, among others, as well as the Mafia Universe forum rules, for the rule template.

      The following are standard mafia game rules.


      [list][*]Do not post during the night phase.
      [*]Do not talk about this game's events outside of this thread unless you are specifically given permission to do so by the moderators. Details are in the Moderation Policies tab.
      [*]Do not talk about other ongoing games in this thread. Referring to anything that has happened in an ongoing game, even if you do not say which game it is, is OOT.
      [*]If you are dead, do not post, and do not talk about this game anywhere else. You may still spectate; access to spoiled and unspoiled spectator chats will be offered.
      [*]Do not use any formatting that obscures or conceals text. This includes [color=#FFFFFF], [color=white], and [color=transparent].
      [*]Do not edit or delete posts, even for typos: what goes in the thread stays in the thread. Instead, use EBWOP or EBWON as appropriate.
      [*]Do not quote or pretend to quote any PMs from the mod, including role PMs.
      [*]Do not impersonate the mod.
      [*]Do not lie to the mod.
      [*]Do not abuse loopholes in the rules. Intent will be considered during rule enforcement.
      [*]You may use your role PM to ask questions, such as rule clarifications.[/list]


      [*]Votes and Hangs
      This tab covers voting, unvoting, No Hangs, and hangs.


      [list][*]Votes must be in this format to be counted: Vote: [player username].
      [*]By default, votes should be made in [b] (bold) tags. However, votes made in [code] and [c] tags will also be accepted.
      [*]Usernames in votes must be spelled, but not necessarily capitalized, correctly. Do not use nicknames.
      [*]For the purposes of voting, I (capital i) and l (lowercase L) are considered identical.
      [*]For example, both Vote: mathjay and Vote: mAtHjAy are valid votes, but vote: mathjay, Vote: jay, Vote: mathjay., Vote:mathjay, Vote: mathjay, and Vote: mathjay are invalid.
      [*]Votes followed by extraneous punctuation that is similarly formatted, even with separate tags, are invalid.
      [*]Votes in hide, tip, or quote tags do not count.
      [*]Vote to hang no one by posting Vote: No Hang.
      [*]Unvote by posting Unvote. You do not have to unvote before voting again.
      [*]Votecounts will be posted periodically. Players may request a new VC in bold or in their role PM.
      [*]Invalid votes will not count under any circumstances. Consider notifying the mod in your role PM if you want to purposely fakevote.
      [*]Valid votes will always be counted unless they are clearly unintentional. There is no guarantee that an accidental vote will not be counted.
      [*]Votes will be carried over if a player is replaced.
      [*]The Not Voting section should be ignored if it contradicts another part of the votecount (VC).
      [*]If an error in the votecount is not pointed out within 2 days or by the next EOD, whichever is sooner, the incorrect VC will become official.
      [*]This game uses deadline hang: the player with the most votes at the EOD (End of Day) deadline will be hanged.
      [*]If two or more players have the same number of votes at the EOD deadline, the player who reached that number of votes first will be hanged. Details are in the Moderation Policies tab.
      [*]If no votes have been cast by the deadline, no one will be hanged.
      [*]Starting Day 1, if a player is voted by the majority of living players, then that player will be hanged immediately; and if No Hang is voted by half of living players, a No Hang will occur.
      [*]Upon reaching LYLO (Hang-or-Lose), votes will be locked, meaning that they cannot be changed.
      [*]Deadline hang is off at LYLO. If a majority hang is not reached by the deadline, the day will end without a hang, resulting in an automatic win for the mafia team.
      [*]The moment the deadline occurs, no further votes will be counted. Details are in the Moderation Policies tab.
      [*]If the deadline has passed or a hammer has occurred and the EOD has not been declared, the game will proceed into twilight. Players may still post, but no more votes or unvotes will be counted.
      [*]Once the moderators declare the EOD, the person hanged will be officially eliminated and their role revealed. Night will then immediately begin.[/list]

      [*]Activity
      This tab covers deadlines, activity rules, V/LAs, and replacements.


      [list][*]All times will be in Eastern Standard Time (EST, UTC-5) or Eastern Daylight Time (EDT, UTC-4) as applicable, unless otherwise noted.
      [*]Each day phase will be 168 hours (7 days), and each night phase will be 48 hours (2 days).
      [*]The moderators may extend deadlines at their discretion.
      [*]The current deadline can be found in the bottom of the OP (Original Post, or post #1).
      [*]If a player with an NA (Night Action) anticipates being unavailable during the night phase, they may submit any night actions to be performed in advance.
      [*]If a player with an NA has not submitted their action by 24 hours before the night deadline, a reminder will be sent.
      [*]If the moderators do not receive an NA submission from a player by the night deadline, the player will not perform an action that night.
      [*]Night results will be sent after the night deadline.
      [*]Night will end when the moderators make a post declaring the end of night (EON). You may not post in the thread until then, even if the night deadline has passed. Instead, PM the mod for updates if they miss a deadline.
      [*]Players who are temporarily unable to fulfill activity requirements can declare a V/LA (Vacation/Long Absence) by posting the V/LA dates in bold in-thread or in their role PM. Players on a V/LA will not be prodded.
      [*]V/LAs should be shorter than one week. For longer absences, contact the moderators for options.
      [*]Players who no longer wish to or are unable to play in this game can request replacement by posting Request Replacement in-thread or in their role PM.
      [*]Players who have replaced out generally will not be allowed to replace back in.
      [*]Players will receive their first PM prod if they have not made a game-advancing post for 48 hours and are not on V/LA. Details on "game-advancing post" are in the Moderation Policies tab.
      [*]Players will receive their second PM prod if they have not made a game-advancing post for 72 hours and are not on V/LA.
      [*]Players will be replaced if they have not made a game-advancing post for 96 hours and are not on V/LA, unless they post before the moderators find a replacement.
      [*]If a player receives 4 PM Prods, they will be replaced.
      [*]If a player reaches replacement status more than once, they will be replaced.
      [*]Activity Checks (ACs) will be posted periodically. Players may request a new AC in bold or in their role PM.
      [*]Activity will reset overnight. Players will not receive prods between twilight and daystart.
      [*]If you have access to a private topic, you may request that a partner be poked. The moderators will send a notification via PM to the specified player, but this will not count as an official prod.
      [*]If a player is postbanned by the AoPS Sheriff, they will be replaced. Details are in the Moderation Policies tab.[list]

      [*]Integrity and Etiquette
      This tab covers integrity recommendations, player etiquette, warning limits, and examples of inconsiderate gameplay.


      [list][*]Do not gamethrow.
      [*]Do not discuss player alignments based on V/LAs, replacements, warnings, force replacements, modkills, or other interactions with moderators.
      [*]Do not discuss rule violations, especially violations by other players in the thread. If you wish, contact the moderators privately through your role PM or Discord.
      [*]Any significant, game-related, and intentionally exclusive player-to-player communication outside of moderator-sanctioned channels is prohibited.
      [*]Do not publicly reference OGI (Out of Game Information) in reads or create situations outside the thread that players could reasonably consider alignment indicative.[/list]

      The above rules are attempts to preserve the spirit of the game and should not affect most players. For specific details and examples, click here.


      [list][*]Do not make personal attacks. You may attack a player's opinion, but do not demean the player themselves.
      [*]Do not spam.
      [*]Follow AoPS Community Guidelines and the AoPS Terms of Service.
      [*]Be mature and use common sense.
      [*]Behavior that disrupts the game for players and makes it unreasonably hard for them to read and play may result in a warning.
      Causing significant disruptions to gameplay may result in a force replacement at the moderators' discretion.
      [*]For minor rule infractions, first-timers can receive up to three warnings, while all other players can receive up to two. A player may receive multiple warnings for a single infraction.[/list]

      The above rules broadly address most etiquette issues. For specific details and examples of improper behavior, click here.


      [*]- Moderation Policies -

      [*]Moderator Information
      This tab provides technical information about this game.


      [list][*]Scipio1 is the moderator of Mafia Game 290.
      [*]Other Unpaid Interns have contributed to flavor, setup, OCRSTM, feedback, and management of the private chat discord system.
      [*]This game uses the Unpaid Intern Central consolidated private chat system. Participants of this game will be granted access as appropriate.
      [*]Red text is used for votecounts, warnings, and other announcements by the moderators. It is also used for mafia flavor-related text.
      [*]Blue text is used for activity checks, confirm counts, and other non-essential posts by the moderators.
      [*]Green text is used for town flavor-related text.
      [*]Purple text is used for third-party flavor-related text.
      [*]Custom shades of these colors may be used for aesthetic purposes.
      [*]Current custom shades are: Town flavor green v.2 (#2be368) and Activity Check blue (#005dff). For a full list of custom colors, click here.
      [*]The moderators may change the rules at any time. Major rule changes will be announced at the bottom of the OP. All changes will also be noted in the modlog and OCRSTM Version History.
      [*]Players will not be retroactively penalized for violating new rules.
      [*]Major changes to the OP may be made in between games. The most important changes will be noted in the OCRSTM Version History.
      [*]The moderators pledge to treat players fairly and keep moderator interventions to a minimum; however, we reserve the right to make the final judgement in the moderation of this game.[/list]

      MG290 OP is based on Overcomplicated RulesetTM (OCRSTM) 10.
      Current version: 10.8.7 (Minimum Deadlines Standard Non-newbie)
      Version History

      OCRSTM 10 is available for public use. If you are interested in using OCRSTM in your own games, click here.
      [/list]
      Setup
      This game is based on the Pick Your Poison Setup. This is an open setup.

      Roles

      [list]
      [*] 3 Mafia Goons
      [*] 0-1 Town Innocent Child
      [*] 0-1 Town Tracker
      [*] 0-1 Town 1-Shot Cop
      [*] 0-1 Town Jailkeeper
      [*] 0-1 Town 2-Shot Vigilante
      [*] 7 Vanilla Townies[/*]


      Mechanics (credits to Game 208)

      The game will begin during Night 0. Night 0 will last for 48 hours. Before then, each player will get their alignment. Once alignments have been randomized, Mafia will be able to talk to each other, and during this time and Night 0, they will determine which Power Roles will be in the game. They must select 3 distinct Power Roles for Town from this list: {Innocent Child, Tracker, 1-Shot Cop, Jailkeeper, 2-Shot Vigilante}. Note that there is no kill during Night 0. Once the roles have been selected, they will be randomized among town, players will get their new Role PM, and Day 1 will begin.

      Role PMs
      [quote=Town Role PM]Hello, [player]!

      You are Town. Who knows if you'll get some sort of special power? You will receive your full Role PM at the start of Day 1.

      You win when all Mafia are killed, so your goal is to find them. Play towards your win condition, and good luck.

      Click here to go to the game thread.[/quote]
      [quote=Vanilla Townie Role PM]Hello, [player]!

      You are a Vanilla Townie.

      Your power lies in your observation skills, your voice, and your vote.

      You win when all Mafia are killed, so your goal is to find them. Play towards your win condition, and good luck.

      Click here to go to the game thread.[/quote]
      [quote=Town Innocent Child Role PM]Hello, [player]!

      You are the Town Innocent Child.

      At any time during the game, you may PM the mod and they will announce you as an Innocent Child in their next post, confirming you as town.

      You win when all Mafia are killed, so your goal is to find them. Play towards your win condition, and good luck.

      Click here to go to the game thread.[/quote]
      [quote=Town Tracker Role PM]Hello, [player]!

      You are the Town Tracker.

      Once each night, you may PM the mod the name of a player. You will track them, finding out if they performed a night action and who their target was.

      You win when all Mafia are killed, so your goal is to find them. Play towards your win condition, and good luck.

      Click here to go to the game thread.[/quote]
      [quote=Town One-Shot Cop Role PM]Hello, [player]!

      You are the Town One-Shot Cop.

      Once per game at night, you may PM the mod the name of a player. You will check their alignment, finding out whether they are Town or Mafia.

      You win when all Mafia are killed, so your goal is to find them. Play towards your win condition, and good luck.

      Click here to go to the game thread.[/quote]
      [quote=Town Jailkeeper Role PM]Hello, [player]!

      You are the Town Jailkeeper.

      Once each night, you may PM the mod the name of a player. You will jailkeep them, protecting them from a night kill that night, but roleblocking any actions they may attempt. You cannot target yourself with this ability.

      You win when all Mafia are killed, so your goal is to find them. Play towards your win condition, and good luck.

      Click here to go to the game thread.[/quote]
      [quote=Town 2-Shot Vigilante Role PM]Hello, [player]!

      You are the Town 2-Shot Vigilante.

      Twice per game at night, you may PM the mod the name of a player. You will nightkill them.

      You win when all Mafia are killed, so your goal is to find them. Play towards your win condition, and good luck.

      Click here to go to the game thread.[/quote]
      [quote=Mafia Goon Role PM]Hello, [player]!

      You are a Mafia Goon.

      Your partners are [player] (Mafia Goon) and [player] (Mafia Goon), and you may discuss with them in this private forum while you are alive. The three of you will be able to choose a player to kill each night, as well as decide who makes the kill.

      You win when the Mafia are the only ones left, or if nothing can prevent this, so your goal is to stay hidden and kill Town. Play towards your win condition, and good luck.

      Click here to go to the game thread.[/quote]


      Alive (7)
      2. Avanae - Mafia Goon
      3. BobDBuilder321 - Town Innocent Child
      4. candythecorgi - Vanilla Townie
