      k Mafia Game 289: Sleep Token Mafia
      candythecorgi   2609
      N Sunday at 10:48 PM by fdas
      [center] :

      IMAGE

      Nothing lasts forever.[/center]

      Rules
      [list][*]Rules
      [list]
      [*]1.1: Read the rules. All of them. Read them multiple times if necessary.
      [*]1.2: Do not post at night.
      [*]1.3: You may PM me at any time and ask me anything, such as rule clarification.
      [*]1.4: Do not talk about this game outside of this topic or the mafia chat to anyone other than the mods in charge, unless I specifically allow you to do so.
      [*]1.5: You may not use any formatting that has an effect of concealing text. This includes size=1, hide="", color=#FFFFFF, and color=white, among others. This does not include adding extra spaces.
      [*]1.6: Do not edit or delete posts you have already submitted; this includes editing right after you post (what goes in the thread stays in the thread). If you for any reason find the need to change your post, use EBWOP or EBWON as necessary.
      [*]1.7: If you are not a living participant of the game, do not post anything else about the game anywhere. You may still spectate the game, but you may no longer post in this thread.
      [*]1.8: Do not advocate for breaking the rules.
      [*]1.10: Do not quote or pretend to quote any PMs from the moderator, including role PMs. To verify your existence, name a song from the album This Place Will Become Your Tomb.
      [*]1.9: Out of game information and angleshooting are extremely banned. If you are unsure whether something breaks this rule, ask me in your role PM or just don't do it.
      [*]1.10: Do not claim or otherwise discuss your flavorname.[/list]

      [*] Voting/Hanging
      [list]
      [*] 2.1: Post votes in bold or code tags in the format [code]Vote: <insert player here>[/code] or [code][code]Vote: <insert player here>[/code][/code]
      Since AoPS does not distinguish between usernames with different capitalizations, the capitalization of the player name does not matter. A proper vote looks like Vote: fdas or [code]Vote: fdas[/code]
      [*] 2.2: Votes may not be placed in hide tags.
      [*] 2.3: Improperly made votes will not be counted under any circumstances. It does not matter if it is the end of the game hammer and everyone revealed their roles. Hint: dont reveal your roles and declare victory until I made the official end of the game post.
      [*] 2.4: You may vote for no hang to occur during a day. Vote this by including in your post: Vote: No Hang or [code]Vote: No Hang[/code]
      [*] 2.5: Unvote in the format Vote: Unvote or [code]Vote: Unvote[/code]
      An unvote will undo your previous vote, if any. You are not required to unvote before making a new vote.
      [*] 2.6: Spell the username of the player you wish to vote for exactly. Do not use nicknames.
      [*] 2.7: If at any point in a day more than half of the votes are for a single player, that player will be hanged. It will then immediately be twilight.
      [*] 2.8: If at any point in a day at least half of the votes are for no hang, then there will be no hang. It will then be twilight.
      [*] 2.9: If the deadline is met, the player with the highest number of votes will be hanged. If two or more players have the same amount of votes, the hang will be randomized between these players. If no hang is tied with a player or players, there will be no hang.
      [*] 2.10: The moment the deadline passes, no more votes will be counted even if the mod has not made a post.
      [*] 2.11: During twilight, players may still post. However, no more votes and/or unvotes will be processed.
      [*] 2.12: Once I post an end-of-day scene, the person hanged (if any) is officially dead. Night then immediately begins. You may not post during night.
      [*] 2.13: People are hanged, not hung. While this wording entertains me, it is also slightly painful to see.[/list]

      [*] Activity
      [list]
      [*] 3.1: Each day will be 192 hours (8 days). The moderator may extend the deadline for the end of the day at their discretion. Note that this will be unlikely.
      [*] 3.2: The deadline will occur the very second 192 hours has occurred.
      [*] 3.3: The night deadline will be 48 hours after night begins.
      [*] 3.4: When the night deadline is met, if the moderator does not receive a night action from either a player or their partner(s) (if applicable), the player will lose the chance to perform an action during that night.
      [*] 3.5: Any night results will be sent after the night deadline.
      [*] 3.6: Night will end at some time after the night deadline when the mod makes the post announcing the end of night.
      [*] 3.7: If a player does not post in a 48-hour period and they are not in V/LA, they will receive an in-game prod.
      [*] 3.8: If a player does not post in another 24-hour period after receiving an in-game prod and they are not in V/LA, they will receive a PM prod.
      [*] 3.9: If a player does not post in another 24-hour period after receiving a PM prod and they are not in V/LA, they will be replaced unless they post before the moderator finds a replacement.
      [*] 3.10: If a player receives 5 PM Prods, they will be replaced.
      [*] 3.11: To request a V/LA, post in bold in-thread or PM me. The moderator will not prod the player during their V/LA as long as it is within reason. If you need to take an excessively long V/LA, you may be encouraged to replace out of the game.
      [*]3.12: If a player does not reach a minimum of 15 posts by the end of a complete day cycle, they will be replaced. I will warn you in PMs if you have not reached this minimum 72 hours before the end of the day. This does not count towards your PM prod total.[list]


      [*]Etiquette
      [list]
      [*] 4.1: Do not use inappropriate language.
      [*] 4.2: Do not make any personal attacks.
      [*] 4.3: Follow all of the rules.
      [*] 4.4: Be mature.
      [*] 4.5: For a minor rule infraction, players can receive up to 2 warnings. All players can receive up to 3 warnings without further punishment. If a player commits an infraction after they have run out of warnings, or commits a modkill level infraction, they will be modkilled or force replaced. Please do not make me modkill you.[/list]


      [*] Moderators/Co-Moderators
      [list]
      [*] 5.1: I, candythecorgi, am the moderator of Mafia Game 289.
      [*] 5.2: My mod colors will be #3D85C6 and #0B5394. Do not attempt to emulate a moderator message.
      [*] 5.7: The moderator may change the rules at any time.
      [*] 5.8: The moderator has the last say in interpreting the rules.[/list]


      [*] Read all of the rules.[/list]

      Setup
      This game will use the Matrix15, or Matrix Mayhem 5x5, setup.

      IMAGE

      The setup is determined by randomly selecting one row or column from the above matrix, and then adding 9 Vanilla Townies and 1 Mafia Goon. This will always result in 12 Town members (3 of which are Power Roles) and 3 Mafia members (1 or 2 of which are Power Roles).

      [LIST]
      [*]For example, if Column A was randomly selected, the setup would be a Town 3-shot Tracker, Town JOAT, Town Odd Night Doctor, 9 Vanilla Townies, Mafia 2-shot Watcher, Mafia Roleblocker, and Mafia Goon.
      [/LIST]

      Mafia flips will only reveal the alignment of the Mafia player, whereas Town flips will reveal the full role of the Town player.
      The following roles are non-consecutive (cannot target the same player 2 nights in a row): Town 3-shot Roleblocker and Town Inventor (1x Track, 1x Roleblock.
      The following roles are disabled in endgame (deactivated when only one Mafia is alive): Town 3-shot Roleblocker and Town 3-shot Tracker.

      Each of the Town JOAT's abilities may only be used once throughout the game.


      Role PMs
      Refer here for descriptions of all possible roles. If you have further questions, ask me in your role PM.

      Each player has a unique flavorname and role PM. Do not claim or otherwise discuss your flavorname in this game thread or any other public threads. This may result in a modkill based on my discretion.

      Mafia will receive fakeclaims upon request.

      k Mafia Game 288 (Newbie Game 107): Gemstone Mafia
      fdas   699
      N Sunday at 10:47 PM by fdas
      Welcome to Mafia Game 288: Gemstone Mafia

      Important Rules:
      Do not edit or delete posts
      Do not post during night
      Do not post if you are dead or if you are not in the game
      Do not talk about anything related to this game outside this thread
      Read all the rules!


      Rules
      [list][*]Rules
      [list]
      [*]1.1: Read the rules. All of them. Read them multiple times if necessary.
      [*]1.2: Do not post at night.
      [*]1.3: You may PM me at any time and ask me anything, such as rule clarification.
      [*]1.4: Do not talk about this game outside of this topic to anyone other than the mods in charge, unless I specifically allow you to do so.
      [*]1.5: You may not use any formatting that has an effect of concealing text. This includes size=1, hide="", color=#FFFFFF, and color=white, among others. This does not include adding extra spaces.
      [*]1.6: Do not edit or delete posts you have already submitted; this includes editing right after you post (what goes in the thread stays in the thread). If you for any reason find the need to change your post, use EBWOP or EBWON as necessary.
      [*]1.7: If you are not a living participant of the game, do not post anything else about the game anywhere. You may still spectate the game, but you may no longer post in this thread.
      [*]1.8: Do not advocate for breaking the rules.
      [*]1.9: Do not use the colors red (#FF0000), blue (#0000FF), green (#00FF00), or anything that appears similar, as these colors are used for modding purposes.
      [*]1.10: Confirm your participation in the game by making a post stating the important rules[/list]

      [*] Voting/Hanging
      [list]
      [*] 2.1: Post votes in code tags in the format [code][code]Vote: <insert player here>[/code][/code]
      Since AoPS does not distinguish between usernames with different capitalizations, the capitalization of the player name does not matter. A proper vote looks like [code]Vote: fdas[/code]
      [*] 2.2: Votes may not be placed in hide tags.
      [*] 2.3: Improperly made votes will not be counted under any circumstances. It does not matter if it is the end of the game hammer and everyone revealed their roles. Hint: dont reveal your roles and declare victory until I made the official end of the game post.
      [*] 2.4: You may vote for no hang to occur during a day. Vote this by including in your post [code]Vote: No Hang[/code]
      [*] 2.5: You do not have to unvote before making a new vote, though it is appreciated if you do so. Unvote in the format [code]Vote: Unvote[/code]
      An unvote will undo your previous vote, if any.
      [*] 2.6: Spell the username of the player you wish to vote for exactly. Do not use nicknames.
      [*] 2.7: If at any point in a day more than half of the votes are for a single player, that player will be hanged. It will then immediately be twilight.
      [*] 2.8: If at any point in a day at least half of the votes are for no hang, then there will be no hang. It will then be twilight.
      [*] 2.9: If the deadline is met and no person is hanged, it will be considered no hang and will proceed to be twilight.
      [*] 2.10: The moment the deadline passes, no more votes will be counted even if the mod has not made a post.
      [*] 2.11: During twilight, players may still post. However, no more votes and/or unvotes will be processed.
      [*] 2.12: Once I post a end-of-day scene, the person hanged (if any) is officially dead. Night then immediately begins. You may not post during night.[/list]

      [*] Activity
      [list]
      [*] 3.1: Each day will be 336 hours (2 weeks). The moderator may extend the deadline for the end of the day at his/her discretion. Note that this will be unlikely.
      [*] 3.2: The deadlines will follow the official time
      [*] 3.3: The deadline will occur the very second 336 hours has occurred.
      [*] 3.4: The night deadline will be 72 hours after night begins.
      [*] 3.5: When the night deadline is met, if the moderator does not receive a night action from either a player or his/her partner(s) (if you have them), the player will lose the chance to perform an action during that night.
      [*] 3.6: Any night results will be sent after the night deadline
      [*] 3.7: Night will end at some time after the night deadline when the mod makes the post announcing the end of night.
      [*] 3.8: If a player does not post in a 48-hour period and he/she is not in V/LA, you will receive an in-game prod.
      [*] 3.9: If a player does not post in another 24-hour period after receiving an in-game prod and he/she is not in V/LA, he/she will receive a PM prod.
      [*] 3.10: If a player does not post in another 48-hour period after receiving a PM prod and he/she is not in V/LA, he/she will be replaced, unless you post before the moderator finds a replacement.
      [*] 3.11: If a player receives 5 PM Prods, he/she will be replaced
      [*] 3.12: If a player is going to be V/LA, he/she must post in bold in-thread or PM me. The moderator will not prod the player unless the V/LA is too long.[list]


      [*]Etiquette
      [list]
      [*] 4.1: Do not use inappropriate language.
      [*] 4.2: Do not make any personal attacks.
      [*] 4.3: Follow all of the rules.
      [*] 4.4: Be mature.
      [*] 4.5: For a minor rule infraction, players can receive up to two warnings. If a player commits an infraction after he/she has run out of warnings, or commits a modkill level infraction, he/she will be modkilled or force replaced. Please do not make me modkill you.[/list]


      [*] Moderators/Co-Moderators
      [list]
      [*] 5.1: I fdas am the moderator of Mafia Game 288 and BananaBall00 is the co mod
      [*] 5.2: Red-colored text (#FF0000) is used for official votecounts and activity checks by the moderators. It is also used for mafia flavor-related posts.
      [*] 5.3: Blue-colored text (#0000FF) is used for the moderator and co-mod's posts other than votecounts and activity checks.
      [*] 5.4: Green-colored text (#00FF00) is used for town flavor-related posts.
      [*] 5.5: The not voting section is to be ignored if it contradicts any other part of the votecount
      [*] 5.6: If an error to the votecount is not pointed out within 5 days, the incorrect votecount will become official.
      [*] 5.7: The moderator may change the rules at any time.
      [*] 5.8: The moderator has the last say in interpreting the rules. [/list]


      [*] Read all of the rules[/list]

      Setup
      This game will use the Matrix6 setup. This is a semi-open setup.

      In this setup, there are 9 players. Three of the roles will be generated randomly by picking a row or column from the matrix. Then one Mafia Goon and 5 Vanilla Townies are added to maintain a 2:7 mafia:town ratio. The six possible setups are:
      1. 5 Vanilla Townies, 1 Town Jailkeeper, 1 1-Shot Bulletproof Townie, 1 Mafia Roleblocker, 1 Mafia Goon
      2. 6 Vanilla Townies, 1 Town Cop, 2 Mafia Goons
      3. 5 Vanilla Townies, 1 Town Doctor, 1 Town Tracker, 2 Mafia Goons
      4. 6 Vanilla Townies, 1 Town Jailkeeper, 2 Mafia Goons
      5. 5 Vanilla Townies, 1 Town Cop, 1 Town Doctor, 1 Mafia Goon, 1 Mafia Roleblocker
      6. 5 Vanilla Townies, 1 1-Shot Bulletproof Townie, 1 Town Tracker, 2 Mafia Goons


      Role PMs
      [quote]You are A Polished Gemstone (Vanilla Townie).

      You live in the Box of Treasure and you are proud of being a gemstone and not a mineral. You cannot wait to let the gemstones completely populate the Box of Treasure again, and you believe that minerals do not have a place there.

      You have no other power besides your vote and your voice.

      You win when all the minerals are eliminated from the Box of Treasure.[/quote]

      [quote]You are Sapphire (Town Cop).

      You love living in the Box of Treasure, so you were devastated to hear that there were possible minerals living among you. Determined to find out who were the imposters, you took the initiative to become the cop of the Box of Treasure. You lurk around at night to see who is a mineral.

      Every night, you may target one player to find out their alignment.

      You win when all the minerals are eliminated from the Box of Treasure.[/quote]

      [quote]You are Emerald (Town Doctor).

      After hearing the news about possible minerals living amongst you, you quickly realized that it meant some innocent gemstones dying and being kicked out of the Box of Treasure. You decided to take on the role of a doctor, healing gemstones and protecting them from dying. You decide that it is not worth it to kill gemstones who clearly have not done anything wrong.

      Every night, you may target someone to prevent them from dying that night. You may not heal yourself two nights in a row.

      You win when all the minerals are eliminated from the Box of Treasure.[/quote]

      [quote]You are Aquamarine (Town Tracker).

      You started being suspicious of some of your fellow "gemstones" in the Box of Treasure when the news came out about possible mineral infiltrators. Every night, you decided, you would sneak around and stalk people to see what they do at night. You think this is the best way to sniff out those mineral imposters.

      Every night, you may target one player to find out who they visited that night.

      You win when all the minerals are eliminated from the Box of Treasure.[/quote]

      [quote]You are Ruby (Town Jailkeeper).

      You were given the job of jailkeeper in the Box of Treasure. You love your job, and you feel that it is your responsibility to help keep the minerals away. You guard a small jail cell in the corner of the Box of Treasure, and you make sure to always do your job as a responsible gemstone.

      Every night, you may target one player to jailkeep. Your target will not be able to perform any action that night, and all nightkill attempts against your target that night will be blocked.

      You win when all the minerals are eliminated from the Box of Treasure.[/quote]

      [quote]You are Diamond (1-Shot Bulletproof Townie).

      As one of the strongest gemstones that exist, you have a one-time-use protective layer around you that blocks any mineral from trying to throw you out of the Box of Treasures at night. You are proud of being a strong gemstones and sometimes wish that others can be as strong as you.

      The first time that a mineral tries to kill you at night, that kill will be negated.

      You win when all the minerals are eliminated from the Box of Treasure.[/quote]

      [quote]You are Amethyst (Mafia Goon).

      You once really wanted to join the gemstones in the Box of Treasure, but they rejected you, calling you nothing but "purple quartz". Now that you have snuck into the Box of Treasure, you are ready to get rid of all the gemstones and let the true rulers - minerals, rule.

      Every night, you may target one player to eliminate them from the Box of Treasure. You may also talk to your fellow mineral partner here.

      You win when all of the gemstones have been eliminated or nothing can prevent this.[/quote]

      [quote]You are Calcite (Mafia Roleblocker).

      You were disappointed when you were rejected from entering the Box of Treasure, but you were okay with it. However, you agreed to help your good mineral friend in bringing the gemstones down when you heard that they were going to sneak into the Box of Treasure. Now you are waiting for your moment for you and you friend to strike.

      Every night, you may target one player to roleblock. Your target will not be able to perform any action that night. This action takes precedence over the Jailkeeper. You may also talk to your fellow mineral partner here.

      You win when all of the gemstones have been eliminated or nothing can prevent this.[/quote]


      Alive (6)
      +pandabear10
      +mathjay
      MathBeast77
      Black-cappedChickadee tigeryong
      EntropiaAwake
      connorcc

      Events

      Night 1: candythecorgi died
      Day 2: AmberTiger79 hanged

      k Mafia Game 287: Dune Mafia
      saturnrocket   4445
      N Sunday at 10:46 PM by fdas
      [center]Welcome to Mafia Game 287: Dune Mafia

      Based on the "Dune" book by Frank Herbert

      [/center]

      - Important Rules -
      This tab summarizes the most important rules for easy reference.

      For experienced players: everything you need is here, and in the setup tab.
      For new players: you may find it useful to familiarize yourself with the rest of the rules.

      Integrity
      [list][*]Do not edit or delete your posts, even for typos. Just post again.
      [*]Do not OOT (Out of Thread) and talk about this game outside this thread, your role PM, or approved private chats, even if you are dead. Access to spectator chats will be granted upon request.
      [*]Do not gamethrow or intentionally sabotage your wincondition.
      [*]Do not attach files or link to external documents concerning this game. Discussions must stay in this thread.
      [*]Do not use OGI (Out of Game Information). Publicly discussed reads should be made exclusively from information in this thread or past completed games.[/list]

      Activity
      [list][*]Each "Day" is 12 days while each "Night" is 2 days.
      [*]Do not post during night.
      [*]This game uses Dawn start: Day 1 will not start until everyone shows that they have read the rules by completing the confirm task.
      [*]All times will be in Eastern Standard Time (EST, UTC-5) or Eastern Daylight Time (EDT, UTC-4) as applicable.
      [*]Activity rules are 48 hours to first PM prod, 72 hours to second PM prod, and 96 hours to replacement status.[/list]

      Voting
      [list][*]You must format your votes correctly. Capitalization does not matter, and capital i/lowercase L are not differentiated.
      [*]Both bold vote and code vote formats are accepted, although bold is preferred. Refer to the Voting tab if you do not know what these are.
      [*]Majority hang is on starting Day 1.
      [*]Deadline hang is on from Day 1 but it is off for LYLO.
      [*]Votes are locked at LYLO.[/list]

      Etiquette and Warnings

      [list][*]Use common sense.
      [*]Do not use formatting that makes text hard to read.
      [*]You may attack a players opinion, but do not make personal attacks on players themselves.
      [*]Disagreements should be resolved in a way that does not affect gameplay.
      [*]Do not discuss rule violations by other players in the thread; contact the moderators privately.
      [*]First-timers can receive up to 3 warnings before their next offense results in a force replacement or modkill. All other players can receive up to 2.
      [*]Players may be replaced at the moderators' discretion for procedural difficulties.
      [*]All other rules are standard.[/list]

      Setup and Moderators

      [list][*]This game is based on a closed setup. Refer to the setup tab for more information      .
      [*]Mafia have access to daychat.
      [*]All role mechanics and Night Action Resolutions are standard.
      [*]This game is moderated by ostriches88 and saturnrocket.[/list]

      Resources and Support

      [list][*]For any issues, you may contact us through your role PM.
      [*]For a list of basic resources, refer to the Resources tab below.
      [*]For a more extensive list of resources compiled by the UIMT, go here.
      [*]If this game is causing you significant stress or frustration, feel free to use your role PM to talk or vent. We may not be allowed to give you technical advice, but we can listen or help you find a better way to process events.[/list]

      Please confirm that you have read the rules by telling the moderators (1) what a sandstorm does IN THE GAME and (2) whether you have read / watched Dune, and if so, what your favorite character is. Confirm IN PM not in the thread.


      [list][*]General
      Credits to Binomial-theorem, chaotic_iak, willwang123, and fdas, among others, as well as the Mafia Universe forum rules, for the rule template.

      The following are standard mafia game rules.


      [list][*]Do not post during the night phase.
      [*]Do not talk about this game's events outside of this thread unless you are specifically given permission to do so by the moderators. Details are in the Moderation Policies tab.
      [*]Do not talk about other ongoing games in this thread. Referring to anything that has happened in an ongoing game, even if you do not say which game it is, is OOT.
      [*]If you are dead, do not post, and do not talk about this game anywhere else. You may still spectate; access to spoiled and unspoiled spectator chats will be offered.
      [*]Do not use any formatting that obscures or conceals text. This includes [color=#FFFFFF], [color=white], and [color=transparent].
      [*]Do not edit or delete posts, even for typos: what goes in the thread stays in the thread. Instead, use EBWOP or EBWON as appropriate.
      [*]Do not quote or pretend to quote any PMs from the mods, including role PMs.
      [*]Do not impersonate the mods.
      [*]Do not lie to the mods.
      [*]Do not abuse loopholes in the rules. Intent will be considered during rule enforcement.
      [*]You may use your role PM to ask questions, such as rule clarifications.[/list]


      [*]Votes and Hangs
      This tab covers voting, unvoting, No Hangs, and hangs.

      [list][*]Votes must be in this format to be counted: Vote: [player username].
      [*]By default, votes should be made in [b] (bold) tags. However, votes made in [code] and [c] tags will also be accepted.
      [*]Usernames in votes must be spelled, but not necessarily capitalized, correctly. Do not use nicknames.
      [*]For the purposes of voting, I (capital i) and l (lowercase L) are considered identical.
      [*]For example, both Vote: mathjay and Vote: mAtHjAy are valid votes, but vote: mathjay, Vote: jay, Vote: mathjay., Vote:mathjay, Vote: mathjay, and Vote: mathjay are invalid.
      [*]Votes followed by extraneous punctuation that is similarly formatted, even with separate tags, are invalid.
      [*]Votes in hide, tip, or quote tags do not count.
      [*]Vote to hang no one by posting Vote: No Hang.
      [*]Unvote by posting Unvote. You do not have to unvote before voting again.
      [*]Votecounts will be posted periodically. Players may request a new VC in bold or in their role PM.
      [*]Invalid votes will not count under any circumstances. Consider notifying the mods in your role PM if you want to purposely fakevote.
      [*]Valid votes will always be counted unless they are clearly unintentional. There is no guarantee that an accidental vote will not be counted.
      [*]Votes will be carried over if a player is replaced.
      [*]The Not Voting section should be ignored if it contradicts another part of the votecount (VC).
      [*]If an error in the votecount is not pointed out within 2 days or by the next EOD, whichever is sooner, the incorrect VC will become official.
      [*]This game uses deadline hang: the player with the most votes at the EOD (End of Day) deadline will be hanged.
      [*]If two or more players have the same number of votes at the EOD deadline, the player who reached that number of votes first will be hanged. Details are in the Moderation Policies tab.
      [*]If no votes have been cast by the deadline, no one will be hanged.
      [*]Starting Day 2, if a player is voted by the majority of living players, then that player will be hanged immediately; and if No Hang is voted by half of living players, a No Hang will occur.
      [*]Upon reaching LYLO (Hang-or-Lose), votes will be locked, meaning that they cannot be changed.
      [*]Deadline hang is off at LYLO. If a majority hang is not reached by the deadline, the day will end without a hang, resulting in an automatic win for the mafia team.
      [*]The moment the deadline occurs, no further votes will be counted. Details are in the Moderation Policies tab.
      [*]If the deadline has passed or a hammer has occurred and the EOD has not been declared, the game will proceed into twilight. Players may still post, but no more votes or unvotes will be counted.
      [*]Once the moderators declare the EOD, the person hanged will be officially eliminated and their role revealed. Night will then immediately begin.[/list]

      [*]Activity
      This tab covers deadlines, activity rules, V/LAs, and replacements.

      [list][*]All times will be in Eastern Standard Time (EST, UTC-5) or Eastern Daylight Time (EDT, UTC-4) as applicable, unless otherwise noted.
      [*]Each day phase will be 288 hours (12 days), and each night phase will be 48 hours (2 days).
      [*]The moderators may extend deadlines at their discretion.
      [*]The current deadline can be found in the bottom of the OP (Original Post, or post #1).
      [*]If a player with an NA (Night Action) anticipates being unavailable during the night phase, they may submit any night actions to be performed in advance.
      [*]If a player with an NA has not submitted their action by 24 hours before the night deadline, a reminder will be sent.
      [*]If the moderators do not receive an NA submission from a player by the night deadline, the player will not perform an action that night.
      [*]Night results will be sent after the night deadline.
      [*]Night will end when the moderators make a post declaring the end of night (EON). You may not post in the thread until then, even if the night deadline has passed. Instead, PM the mods for updates if they miss a deadline.
      [*]Players who are temporarily unable to fulfill activity requirements can declare a V/LA (Vacation/Long Absence) by posting the V/LA dates in bold in-thread or in their role PM. Players on a V/LA will not be prodded.
      [*]V/LAs should be shorter than one week. For longer absences, contact the moderators for options.
      [*]Players who no longer wish to or are unable to play in this game can request replacement by posting Request Replacement in-thread or in their role PM.
      [*]Players who have replaced out generally will not be allowed to replace back in.
      [*]Players will receive their first PM prod if they have not made a game-advancing post for 48 hours and are not on V/LA. Details on "game-advancing post" are in the Moderation Policies tab.
      [*]Players will receive their second PM prod if they have not made a game-advancing post for 72 hours and are not on V/LA.
      [*]Players will be replaced if they have not made a game-advancing post for 96 hours and are not on V/LA, unless they post before the moderators find a replacement.
      [*]If a player receives 4 PM Prods, they will be replaced.
      [*]If a player reaches replacement status more than once, they will be replaced.
      [*]Activity Checks (ACs) will be posted periodically. Players may request a new AC in bold or in their role PM.
      [*]Activity will reset overnight. Players will not receive prods between twilight and daystart.
      [*]If you have access to a private topic, you may request that a partner be poked. The moderators will send a notification via PM to the specified player, but this will not count as an official prod.
      [*]If a player is postbanned by the AoPS Sheriff, they will be replaced. Details are in the Moderation Policies tab.[list]

      [*]Integrity and Etiquette
      This tab covers integrity recommendations, player etiquette, warning limits, and examples of inconsiderate gameplay.

      [list][*]Do not gamethrow.
      [*]Do not discuss player alignments based on V/LAs, replacements, warnings, force replacements, modkills, or other interactions with moderators.
      [*]Do not discuss rule violations, especially violations by other players in the thread. If you wish, contact the moderators privately through your role PM or Discord.
      [*]Any significant, game-related, and intentionally exclusive player-to-player communication outside of moderator-sanctioned channels is prohibited.
      [*]Do not publicly reference OGI (Out of Game Information) in reads or create situations outside the thread that players could reasonably consider alignment indicative.[/list]

      The above rules are attempts to preserve the spirit of the game and should not affect most players. For specific details and examples, click here.

      [list][*]Do not make personal attacks. You may attack a player's opinion, but do not demean the player themselves.
      [*]Do not spam.
      [*]Follow AoPS Community Guidelines and the AoPS Terms of Service.
      [*]Be mature and use common sense.
      [*]Behavior that disrupts the game for players and makes it unreasonably hard for them to read and play may result in a warning.
      Causing significant disruptions to gameplay may result in a force replacement at the moderators' discretion.
      [*]For minor rule infractions, first-timers can receive up to three warnings, while all other players can receive up to two. A player may receive multiple warnings for a single infraction.[/list]

      The above rules broadly address most etiquette issues. For specific details and examples of improper behavior, click here.


      [*]- Moderation Policies -

      [*]Moderator Information
      This tab provides technical information about this game.

      [list][*]ostriches88 and saturnrocket are the moderators of Mafia Game 288.
      [*]Credit to fdas to reviewing and improving the setup.
      [*]UIC staff have contributed to flavor, setup, OCRSTM, feedback, and management of the private chat discord system.
      [*]This game uses the Unpaid Intern Central consolidated private chat system. Participants of this game will be granted access as appropriate.
      [*]Red text is used for votecounts, warnings, and other announcements by the moderators. It is also used for mafia flavor-related text.
      [*]Blue text is used for activity checks, confirm counts, and other non-essential posts by the moderators.
      [*]Green text is used for town flavor-related text.
      [*]Purple text is used for third-party flavor-related text.
      [*]Custom shades of these colors may be used for aesthetic purposes.
      [*]Current custom shades are: Town flavor green v.2 (#2be368) and Activity Check blue (#005dff). For a full list of custom colors, click here.
      [*]The moderators may change the rules at any time. Major rule changes will be announced at the bottom of the OP. All changes will also be noted in the modlog and OCRSTM Version History.
      [*]Players will not be retroactively penalized for violating new rules.
      [*]Major changes to the OP may be made in between games. The most important changes will be noted in the OCRSTM Version History.
      [*]The moderators pledge to treat players fairly and keep moderator interventions to a minimum; however, we reserve the right to make the final judgement in the moderation of this game.[/list]

      MG277 OP is based on Overcomplicated RulesetTM (OCRSTM) 10.
      Current version: 10.0.1
      Version History

      OCRSTM 10 is available for public use. If you are interested in using OCRSTM in your own games, click here.
      [/list]
      Setup
      "He who controls the spice controls the world" - Baron Harkonnen

      This game is based on a closed setup with two or more factions.

      Game-Specific Mechanics:

      Spice Income: Each player will have an income in spice that they will receive at the end of each night. Spice is extremely important to the mechanics of the game. In addition, each player will start with 5 spice.
      Sandstorms: On the planet of Dune, sometimes sandstorms occur. A sandstorm will occur for every 50 spice spent. Sandstorms will be announced at EOD; when a sandstorm occurs, players without immunity will not receive their income that night. There cannot be a sandstorm on Night 1.

      Furthermore, there are 2 phases in this game:

      Day: At the beginning of day, the moderators will announce any night kills and also the Spice Leader (player with the most spice, in the case of a tie one of the players with the most spice will be chosen randomly) will receive a Spice Checker which they may use on any player during the day to determine how much spice that player currently has. The Spice Checker must be used on the day it is given and is a one-time-use. During the day, players will discuss who to hang.
      Night: During the night, players will perform their respective night actions, if applicable, and will receive their income (or not, in the case of a Sandstorm) at the end of the night. All players will be told the amount of spice they have at the end of the night.

      Additional Information:
      [list][*]All night actions will be resolved using Reasonable Night Action Resolution.
      [*]The game is not BM, although borderline BM elements may exist.
      [*]You may claim flavornames, however be aware that anti-town faction(s) will be provided with fakeclaims.[/list]

      VT Role PM
      [quote]Welcome, [player] to Mafia Game 288. You are Flavorname (VT).

      As a Fremen citizen, you are vaguely aware of the power struggle going on on your planet, and have agreed to join the Atreides. Each night, you may transfer up to 50% of your spice to another player.

      Income: 2 spice

      You win when one or more members of the Atreides faction are alive, and when you have eliminated all antitown. Play toward your win condition, and good luck![/quote]


      Alive (5)
      6. tigeryong
      8. Leuy452 niuaccount connorcc
      16. WisteriaV Bob_the_Bob
      18. lucaswujc
      19. Cosmosiq

      2. pandabear10 (Shaddam IV, Harkonnen JOAT)
      13. violetmx12 (Scytale, Rebel Fixer)
      15. ad333 (Gurney Halleck, Town Trainer)
      1. aayr (Stilgar, Town JOAT)
      14. scannose (Baron Harkonnen, Harkonnen JOAT)
      4. duke_of_wedgewood + blair.givenchy (Paul Atreides, Town JOAT)
      5. NoSignOfTheta (Chani, Vanilla Townie and Town Mason)
      20. DXtreme (Wellington Yueh, Harkonnen Doctor)

      12. dragonlouis (Jamis, Vanilla Townie)
      17. BluePhoenix88 (Peter De Vries, Harkonnen Rolecop)


      Significant Events

      SOD2 flip and flavor: justJen and pandabear10 died
      EOD2 flip and flavor: violetmx12 died
      SOD3 flip and flavor: aayr and ad333 died, DXtreme revealed
      EOD3 flip and flavor: scannose died
      SOD4 flip and flavor: duke_of_wedgewood and NoSignOfTheta died
      EOD4 flip and flavor: DXtreme died
      SOD5 flip and flavor: RadioActive1729 and NDMath died
      EOD5 flip and flavor: Mathisaac died
      SOD6 flips and flavor: BluePhoenix88 and dragonlouis died
      EOD6 flips and flavor: Bob_the_bob and connorcc died
      Final flips and flavor: Cosmosiq and lucaswujc died, tigeryong survived

      Automatic ISO Code - This post contains code (written by casi and improved by Mathletesv) that will automatically quote all posts by a given player within a given range of posts.

      [center]Welcome to Mafia Game 286
      UIC Invitational X

      IMAGE
      [/center]




      - Important Rules -
      This tab summarizes the most important rules for easy reference.

      For experienced players: everything you need is here, and in the setup tab.
      For new players: you may find it useful to familiarize yourself with the rest of the rules.

      Integrity
      [list][*]Do not edit or delete your posts, even for typos. Just post again.
      [*]Do not OOT (Out of Thread) and talk about this game outside this thread, your role PM, or approved private chats, even if you are dead. Access to spectator chats will be granted upon request.
      [*]Do not gamethrow or intentionally sabotage your wincondition.
      [*]Do not attach files or link to external documents concerning this game. Discussions must stay in this thread.
      [*]Do not use OGI (Out of Game Information). Publicly discussed reads should be made exclusively from information in this thread or past completed games.[/list]

      Activity
      [list][*]Each "Day" is 7 days while each "Night" is 2 day.
      [*]Do not post during night.
      [*]All times will be in Eastern Standard Time (EST, UTC-5) or Eastern Daylight Time (EDT, UTC-4) as applicable.
      [*]Activity rules are 48 hours to first PM prod, 72 hours to second PM prod, and 96 hours to replacement status.[/list]

      Voting
      [list][*]You must format your votes correctly. Capitalization does not matter, and capital i/lowercase L are not differentiated.
      [*]Both bold vote and code vote formats are accepted, although bold is preferred. Refer to the Voting tab if you do not know what these are.
      [*]Majority hang is always on.
      [*]Deadline hang is always on except for LYLO.
      [*]Votes are locked at LYLO.[/list]

      Etiquette and Warnings

      [list][*]Use common sense.
      [*]Do not use formatting that makes text hard to read.
      [*]You may attack a players opinion, but do not make personal attacks on players themselves.
      [*]Disagreements should be resolved in a way that does not affect gameplay.
      [*]Do not discuss rule violations by other players in the thread; contact the moderators privately.
      [*]First-timers can receive up to 3 warnings before their next offense results in a force replacement or modkill. All other players can receive up to 2.
      [*]Players may be replaced at the moderators' discretion for procedural difficulties.
      [*]All other rules are standard.[/list]

      Setup and Moderators

      [list][*]This game is based on the 9-2 Mountainous Setup.
      [*]Mafia have access to daychat.
      [*]All role mechanics and Night Action Resolutions are standard.
      [*]This game is moderated by Mathletesv.
      [*]This game operates optional discord spectator and mafia private chats using the Unpaid Intern Central server. Contact the mods to request access.[/list]

      Resources and Support

      [list][*]For any issues, you may contact us through your role PM or through Discord (@msv25).
      [*]For a list of basic resources, refer to the Resources tab below.
      [*]For a more extensive list of resources compiled by the UIMT, go here.
      [*]If this game is causing you significant stress or frustration, feel free to use your role PM to talk or vent. We may not be allowed to give you technical advice, but we can listen or help you find a better way to process events. You may also contact us via Discord if you prefer.[/list]


      [list][*]General
      Credits to Binomial-theorem, chaotic_iak, willwang123, and fdas, among others, as well as the Mafia Universe forum rules, for the rule template.

      The following are standard mafia game rules.


      [list][*]Do not post during the night phase.
      [*]Do not talk about this game's events outside of this thread unless you are specifically given permission to do so by the moderators. Details are in the Moderation Policies tab.
      [*]Do not talk about other ongoing games in this thread. Referring to anything that has happened in an ongoing game, even if you do not say which game it is, is OOT.
      [*]If you are dead, do not post, and do not talk about this game anywhere else. You may still spectate; access to spoiled and unspoiled spectator chats will be offered.
      [*]Do not use any formatting that obscures or conceals text. This includes [color=#FFFFFF], [color=white], and [color=transparent].
      [*]Do not edit or delete posts, even for typos: what goes in the thread stays in the thread. Instead, use EBWOP or EBWON as appropriate.
      [*]Do not quote or pretend to quote any PMs from the mods, including role PMs.
      [*]Do not impersonate the mods.
      [*]Do not lie to the mods.
      [*]Do not abuse loopholes in the rules. Intent will be considered during rule enforcement.
      [*]You may use your role PM to ask questions, such as rule clarifications.[/list]


      [*]Votes and Hangs
      This tab covers voting, unvoting, No Hangs, and hangs.


      [list][*]Votes must be in this format to be counted: Vote: [player username].
      [*]By default, votes should be made in [b] (bold) tags. However, votes made in [code] and [c] tags will also be accepted.
      [*]Usernames in votes must be spelled, but not necessarily capitalized, correctly. Do not use nicknames.
      [*]For the purposes of voting, I (capital i) and l (lowercase L) are considered identical.
      [*]For example, both Vote: mathjay and Vote: mAtHjAy are valid votes, but vote: mathjay, Vote: jay, Vote: mathjay., Vote:mathjay, Vote: mathjay, and Vote: mathjay are invalid.
      [*]Votes followed by extraneous punctuation that is similarly formatted, even with separate tags, are invalid.
      [*]Votes in hide, tip, or quote tags do not count.
      [*]Vote to hang no one by posting Vote: No Hang.
      [*]Unvote by posting Unvote. You do not have to unvote before voting again.
      [*]Votecounts will be posted periodically. Players may request a new VC in bold or in their role PM.
      [*]Invalid votes will not count under any circumstances. Consider notifying the mods in your role PM if you want to purposely fakevote.
      [*]Valid votes will always be counted unless they are clearly unintentional. There is no guarantee that an accidental vote will not be counted.
      [*]Votes will be carried over if a player is replaced.
      [*]The Not Voting section should be ignored if it contradicts another part of the votecount (VC).
      [*]If an error in the votecount is not pointed out within 2 days or by the next EOD, whichever is sooner, the incorrect VC will become official.
      [*]This game uses deadline hang: the player with the most votes at the EOD (End of Day) deadline will be hanged.
      [*]If two or more players have the same number of votes at the EOD deadline, the player who reached that number of votes first will be hanged. Details are in the Moderation Policies tab.
      [*]If no votes have been cast by the deadline, no one will be hanged.
      [*]Starting Day 1, if a player is voted by the majority of living players, then that player will be hanged immediately; and if No Hang is voted by half of living players, a No Hang will occur.
      [*]Upon reaching LYLO (Hang-or-Lose), votes will be locked, meaning that they cannot be changed.
      [*]Deadline hang is off at LYLO. If a majority hang is not reached by the deadline, the day will end without a hang, resulting in an automatic win for the mafia team.
      [*]The moment the deadline occurs, no further votes will be counted. Details are in the Moderation Policies tab.
      [*]If the deadline has passed or a hammer has occurred and the EOD has not been declared, the game will proceed into twilight. Players may still post, but no more votes or unvotes will be counted.
      [*]Once the moderators declare the EOD, the person hanged will be officially eliminated and their role revealed. Night will then immediately begin.[/list]

      [*]Activity
      This tab covers deadlines, activity rules, V/LAs, and replacements.


      [list][*]All times will be in Eastern Standard Time (EST, UTC-5) or Eastern Daylight Time (EDT, UTC-4) as applicable, unless otherwise noted.
      [*]Each day phase will be 168 hours (7 days), and each night phase will be 48 hours (2 days).
      [*]The moderators may extend deadlines at their discretion.
      [*]The current deadline can be found in the bottom of the OP (Original Post, or post #1).
      [*]If a player with an NA (Night Action) anticipates being unavailable during the night phase, they may submit any night actions to be performed in advance.
      [*]If a player with an NA has not submitted their action by 24 hours before the night deadline, a reminder will be sent.
      [*]If the moderators do not receive an NA submission from a player by the night deadline, the player will not perform an action that night.
      [*]Night results will be sent after the night deadline.
      [*]Night will end when the moderators make a post declaring the end of night (EON). You may not post in the thread until then, even if the night deadline has passed. Instead, PM the mods for updates if they miss a deadline.
      [*]Players who are temporarily unable to fulfill activity requirements can declare a V/LA (Vacation/Long Absence) by posting the V/LA dates in bold in-thread or in their role PM. Players on a V/LA will not be prodded.
      [*]V/LAs should be shorter than one week. For longer absences, contact the moderators for options.
      [*]Players who no longer wish to or are unable to play in this game can request replacement by posting Request Replacement in-thread or in their role PM.
      [*]Players who have replaced out generally will not be allowed to replace back in.
      [*]Players will receive their first PM prod if they have not made a game-advancing post for 48 hours and are not on V/LA. Details on "game-advancing post" are in the Moderation Policies tab.
      [*]Players will receive their second PM prod if they have not made a game-advancing post for 72 hours and are not on V/LA.
      [*]Players will be replaced if they have not made a game-advancing post for 96 hours and are not on V/LA, unless they post before the moderators find a replacement.
      [*]If a player receives 4 PM Prods, they will be replaced.
      [*]If a player reaches replacement status more than once, they will be replaced.
      [*]Activity Checks (ACs) will be posted periodically. Players may request a new AC in bold or in their role PM.
      [*]Activity will reset overnight. Players will not receive prods between twilight and daystart.
      [*]If you have access to a private topic, you may request that a partner be poked. The moderators will send a notification via PM to the specified player, but this will not count as an official prod.
      [*]If a player is postbanned by the AoPS Sheriff, they will be replaced. Details are in the Moderation Policies tab.[list]

      [*]Integrity and Etiquette
      This tab covers integrity recommendations, player etiquette, warning limits, and examples of inconsiderate gameplay.


      [list][*]Do not gamethrow.
      [*]Do not discuss player alignments based on V/LAs, replacements, warnings, force replacements, modkills, or other interactions with moderators.
      [*]Do not discuss rule violations, especially violations by other players in the thread. If you wish, contact the moderators privately through your role PM or Discord.
      [*]Any significant, game-related, and intentionally exclusive player-to-player communication outside of moderator-sanctioned channels is prohibited.
      [*]Do not publicly reference OGI (Out of Game Information) in reads or create situations outside the thread that players could reasonably consider alignment indicative.[/list]

      The above rules are attempts to preserve the spirit of the game and should not affect most players. For specific details and examples, click here.


      [list][*]Do not make personal attacks. You may attack a player's opinion, but do not demean the player themselves.
      [*]Do not spam.
      [*]Follow AoPS Community Guidelines and the AoPS Terms of Service.
      [*]Be mature and use common sense.
      [*]Behavior that disrupts the game for players and makes it unreasonably hard for them to read and play may result in a warning.
      Causing significant disruptions to gameplay may result in a force replacement at the moderators' discretion.
      [*]For minor rule infractions, first-timers can receive up to three warnings, while all other players can receive up to two. A player may receive multiple warnings for a single infraction.[/list]

      The above rules broadly address most etiquette issues. For specific details and examples of improper behavior, click here.


      [*]- Moderation Policies -

      [*]Moderator Information
      This tab provides technical information about this game.


      [list][*]Mathletesv is the moderator of Mafia Game 286.
      [*]Other Unpaid Interns have contributed to flavor, setup, OCRSTM, feedback, and management of the private chat discord system.
      [*]This game uses the Unpaid Intern Central consolidated private chat system. Participants of this game will be granted access as appropriate.
      [*]Red text is used for votecounts, warnings, and other announcements by the moderators. It is also used for mafia flavor-related text.
      [*]Blue text is used for activity checks, confirm counts, and other non-essential posts by the moderators.
      [*]Green text is used for town flavor-related text.
      [*]Purple text is used for third-party flavor-related text.
      [*]Custom shades of these colors may be used for aesthetic purposes.
      [*]Current custom shades are: Town flavor green v.2 (#2be368) and Activity Check blue (#005dff). For a full list of custom colors, click here.
      [*]The moderators may change the rules at any time. Major rule changes will be announced at the bottom of the OP. All changes will also be noted in the modlog and OCRSTM Version History.
      [*]Players will not be retroactively penalized for violating new rules.
      [*]Major changes to the OP may be made in between games. The most important changes will be noted in the OCRSTM Version History.
      [*]The moderators pledge to treat players fairly and keep moderator interventions to a minimum; however, we reserve the right to make the final judgement in the moderation of this game.[/list]

      MG286 OP is based on Overcomplicated RulesetTM (OCRSTM) 10.
      Current version: 10.8.7 (Minimum Deadlines Standard Non-newbie)
      Version History

      OCRSTM 10 is available for public use. If you are interested in using OCRSTM in your own games, click here.
      [/list]
      Setup
      This game is running the 9 VT + 2 MG Mountainous Setup which, according to The EV Project has a town winrate of 35.2%, which we suppose is better than the 7-2 winrate of 29.8%. Good luck I guess!!

      IMAGE

      Role PMs
      [quote=Vanilla Townie Role PM]
      IMAGE

      Hello, [player]!

      You are an Explorer (Vanilla Townie).

      Heck this stuff, I'm out, mhmm,
      Hecc this stuff, I'm out, no thanks!
      Don't mind me,
      Imma just grab my stuff and leave,
      Excuse me please...

      Your power lies in your observation skills, your voice, and your vote.

      You win when all Mafia are killed, so your goal is to find them. Play towards your win condition, and good luck.

      Click here to go to the game thread.
      [/quote]
      [quote=Mafia Goon Role PM]
      IMAGE

      Hello, [player]!

      You are a Funiculus (Mafia Goon).

      There's something growing inside of you. You knew from the moment you woke up with blood smeared all over your face that the sick, sinking feeling in your stomach was not just a feeling. The only way for you to live now is for you to find a way to get out of the garden and get to a medlab. But if the others find out...

      Your partner is [player] ([role]), and you may discuss with them in this private forum while you are alive. The two of you will be able to choose a player to kill each night, as well as decide who makes the kill.

      You win when the Mafia are the only ones left, or if nothing can prevent this, so your goal is to stay hidden and kill Town. Play towards your win condition, and good luck.

      Click here to go to the game thread.
      [/quote]

      h 
      k Mafia Game 285: Oops! All PRs! Mafia
      pandabear10   4593
      N Sunday at 10:46 PM by fdas
      Welcome to Mafia Game 285, Oops! All PRs! Mafia!

      If you are not playing in this game, you are not allowed to post in this thread.

      Credits to Binomial-theorem/chaotic_iak/willwang123/zmann27 for the basic template (many changes have been made).

      Story
      We live in an egalitarian society nowadays. No more such thing as men and woman. No such thing as white or black. No such thing as fdas, xantho, NeilOnnsu. No such things as names. Everyone is exactly the same. Cops? Don't need them; everyone is a cop. Doctors? Don't need them; everyone is a doctor.

      Everyone is the same. Except for a few people. They desired what they could not have. Individuality. And they struck.

      pandabear10 Someone has been killed. They were a Townie.


      Read ALL of the rules!
      [list]
      [*] To confirm, please type Confirm. By doing so, you acknowledge that you can and will be held responsible to the ruleset below.
      [*]General Rules
      R.1. Read the rules. All of them. Every single one. Including this one. No exceptions. Whatsoever. Read them multiple times if necessary.
      R.2. Bookmark this thread. It makes things easier for everyone. To bookmark, click the button that looks like a bookmark: B. You know that you have done this when the aforementioned button appears like this: C, D, E, or F.
      R.3. Do not post during night, as defined in A.5.
      R.4. Do not post an excessive amount of images or GIF's in your posts. This rule is subject to moderator interpretation. Pre-warnings will be given before I give a warning based on this rule.
      R.5. Do not spam or have excessive white-space in your post. This rule is subject to moderator interpretation. Pre-warnings will be given before I give a warning based on this rule.
      R.6. You may PM me through your Role PM at any time and ask me anything, such as rule clarification or role clarification. Please do not send me new PM's regarding this game. I will not guarantee a straight or truthful answer, however. Note that I cannot reveal anything about other players.
      R.7. Roleclaiming is allowed. (Not sure how this would benefit you, though.)
      R.8. While this game is ongoing, do not talk substantively about this game outside of this thread to anyone other than me (pandabear10) with the exception of any QuickTopics (or other modes of communication) I explicitly give to you. Stating that this game exists and asking someone in the game to be active is explicitly defined to not be substantive. Depending on the severity, breaking this rule is a modkill level infraction, and may be additionally subject to further punishment outside of this game.
      R.9. If you are dead, do not post anything substantive about the game anywhere, including in thread, other than the Dead QuickTopic that you will receive after death, and the Role PM, which is a suitable place to type personal commentary on the game, if you so wish. Prodding people while dead is an infraction of this rule, unlike in R.8. You may still spectate the game. Depending on the severity, breaking this rule is a modkill level infraction, and may be additionally subject to further punishment outside of this game.
      R.10. You may not use any formatting that has an effect of concealing text. This includes, but is not limited to size=1, hide=".", color=#fff, color=transparent, phantom, and color=white.
      R.11. Do not edit or delete posts you have already submitted under any circumstance. If you would like to clarify or change anything that has already been posted, you may utilize EBWOP (Edit By Way Of Post) or EBWON (Edit By Way Of Post / Edit By Way Of Ninja'd), although anything on the line of "Edit:" will be understood by most players.
      R.12. Play towards your win condition as dictated by the rules and in your Role PM.
      R.13. The only text in-thread that I can guarantee that I will read is bolded text that is not in a hide tag
       
      and is at least of font-size 100.       As such, if you want to ask me a question, either use your Role PM, or bold your question.
      R.14. Have fun. If you aren't having fun, this will most likely affect other players. Please just ask for a replacement if you are not having fun.


      [*]Etiquette
      E.1. Do not use inappropriate language. You kids know what I mean when I say this. If AoPS censors it for you, don't try to circumvent it.
      E.2. Be mature and considerate.
      E.3. Do not make any personal attacks, make sure to attack the person's role. For example, 'I believe you are scum in real life' will draw a warning, but 'You seem scummy' will not draw a warning. Since phrases like, 'I believe you are scum' are often said, a warning in this rule will only be given if it is clearly evident that this rule has been broken intentionally. This rule is subject to moderator interpretation.
      E.4. For minor rule infractions, if a newbie accumulates three warnings, (s)he will be force replaced or modkilled, and SE's or IC's will be force replaced or modkilled at two warnings. The moderator and the moderator alone makes the decision to force-replace or modkill, and the decision will be made on a case-by-case basis. However, generally speaking, if game-critical information has not been divulged, a player will be force-replaced. In addition, if a replacement cannot be found within 168 hours, the player will automatically be modkilled. Modkills will not end day as defined in A.1.


      [*] Activity
      A.1. 'Day' is the time period where players may post in this thread. A mafia-day will normally be about 14 real-life days long, depending on the moderators' availability. Once someone is hanged, it will become twilight.
      A.2. If the deadline is met and no person is hanged, no hang will automatically take place, and the day will proceed to be twilight. No votes will be processed after the deadline, even if the moderator fails to immediately end day.
      A.3. Twilight is the time period between when the a player is hanged (after Day 1) or when the deadline passes (all days), and when an end-of-day scene is posted. Once the end-of-day scene is posted, night will immediately commence.
      A.4. A night-action is an action granted by receiving a certain role in-game. The PM will say what their night-action is and how to use it. Night actions may not be submitted during the day. The Vanilla Townie role does not have a night-action.
      A.5. 'Night' is the time period where players who have a designated night-action may submit their night-action. No posts may take place in-thread during this time. Each night will be three (3) real-life days long, depending on the moderators' availability. Night may be cut short if all night-actions have been submitted. Once night has been declared over by the moderator, the next day will immediately begin.
      A.6. The moderator may extend the deadline for the day or night at their discretion, but this will be unlikely. The two main reasons I might extend the deadline is if someone (including the moderator) is V/LA at the deadline, or if a replacement occurs close to the deadline. However, never count on a deadline extension.
      A.7. When the night deadline is reached, all night-actions must have been submitted. If the moderator does not receive a night action from either a player or his/her partner(s) (if you have them) before the deadline, the player(s) will lose the chance to perform their action during that night. Mafia may submit their kill either in their role PM or in their QuickTopic or other moderator-provided method of communication. If multiple conflicting kills are submitted, the Mafia chat gets first priority, then the most recent PM containing a kill.
      A.8. If a player does not post in a 48-hour period, he/she will receive an in-game prod.
      A.9. If a player does not post in another 48-hour period after receiving an in-game prod as defined in A.8, he/she will receive a PM Prod.
      A.10. If a player does not post in another 48-hour period after receiving a PM Prod as defined in A.9, he/she will be replaced unless he/she posts before the moderator finds a replacement.
      A.11. If a player accumulates 5 PM Prods, he/she will be replaced regardless of any future activity. Continued posting will not prevent replacement.
      A.12. If a player is going to be V/LA (Vacation / Leave of Absence), the player should post in bold in-thread, containing the dates of the V/LA. For example, a V/LA declaration can look like, "V/LA from 9/1/2016 - 9/5/2016." Dates will be read by the moderator by default as "mm/dd/yyyy" or "mm/dd/yy". Alternatively, the player may PM me in your designated Role PM thread. I will not give you any prods during a V/LA, but if you request a V/LA longer than 10 days, I will just replace you instead. It is not necessary for formatting to be exact for a V/LA, however, I cannot guarantee that I will catch an in-thread declaration of a V/LA that is not bolded.
      A.13. Players should not ask for semi-V/LA's. Players must use their best judgment to decide if the partial-inactivity is worth declaring a V/LA for. Semi-V/LA's will not be acknowledged under any circumstance.
      A.14. If a player wishes to be replaced, the player must post in bold in-thread something of the form of 'Request Replacement.' I will not be picky with the formatting with this, as long as I can understand that you wish to be replaced. Alternatively, the player may PM me that the party wishes to be replaced.


      [*] Hangings & Voting
      H.1. Votes are defined as text with the format [code]Vote: <username>[/code], where <username> is a player in the game. Everything in the vote must be properly spaced, spelled, formatted, and capitalized. The only exception to this rule is upper capitalization of the first letter of a username. So, if pandabear10 were playing in this game, [code]Vote: Pandabear10[/code] would be acceptable, as well as [code]Vote: pandabear10[/code]. Examples of invalid votes include, but are not limited to, Vote: pandabear10, [code]Vote pandabear10[/code], [code]vote: pandabear10[/code], Vote: pandabear10, or [code]Vote:pandabear10[/code]. Nicknames are also unacceptable, so [code]Vote: panda[/code] is also not considered a valid vote. All invalid votes will be ignored.
      H.2. Do not intentionally fake-vote. This is for my own sanity, as I read all posts manually for votes. If I count a fake vote and that ends up with real consequences, then that's on you.
      H.3. You may vote for no one to be hanged to occur during a day. Vote for this scenario by voting: [code]Vote: No Hang[/code]. Rules H.1 - H.2 apply.
      H.4. Unvote exactly in the format [code]Unvote[/code] or [code]Vote: Unvote[/code], with the exception of capitalization of "Unvote" (ie: [code]unvote[/code] or [code]Vote: unvote[/code] is acceptable). An unvote will remove a current vote if any exists. You do not have to unvote before making a new vote.
      H.5. If at any point in a day other than Day 1 strictly more than half of the players alive are voting for a single player, that player will be hanged. It will then immediately be twilight, as defined in A.3. Votes are parsed sequentially through a post. If a hang is reached in the middle of a post, any and all subsequent votes will be ignored, even if the person unvotes said vote.
      H.6. If at any point in a day other than Day 1 at least half of the players alive are voting for the scenario of no hang, then the scenario of no hang will occur. It will then immediately be twilight, as defined in A.3.
      H.7. If the current day is Day 1, the day is never terminated early, even if H.5 or H.6 are otherwise satisfied. Once the deadline is reached, a player is hanged if H.5 is satisfied, and a no hang occurs otherwise.
      H.8. The moment the deadline passes, or if a hang or the scenario of no-hang occurs past Day 1, no more votes will be counted, even if the mod or co-mod has not made a post confirming a hang or no-hang.
      H.9. A person that is hanged may still post until the day is officially ended by a moderator.
      H.10. Once I post an end-of-day scene, the person hanged (if any) is officially dead, and may no longer post. Night, as defined in A.5, then immediately begins.
      H.11. If a person is killed during night, I will reveal this at the beginning of the next day. The said person or persons will then be officially dead, and may no longer post for the remaining duration of the game.


      [*] Moderator Information
      M.1. I (pandabear10) am the moderator of Mafia Game 285.
      M.2. Blue-colored text (#00f) is used for posts by the moderator (pandabear10). Do not use this color, or anything that looks similar.
      M.3. Red-colored text (#f00) is used for mafia flavor-related posts. However, this color is not reserved, so you may use it.
      M.4. Green-colored text (#0f0) is used for town flavor-related posts. However, this color is not reserved, so you may use it.
      M.5. Black-colored text is (#000) is used for non-moderating related posts by the moderator. Since this is the default color, you may use it.


      [*]Setup and Mechanics
      S.1. This game utilizes an open setup. There are nine (9) town and two separate mafia factions (which are called mafia and werewolves to distinguish them) with mutually exclusive win conditions.
      S.2. Mafia and werewolves have daychat.
      S.3. Town's win condition is for all mafia and werewolves to be dead.
      S.4. Mafia and werewolves' win condition is to make up a strict majority of all living players. That is, the game ends in victory for mafia (or werewolves) if there are total people alive, with of those players being mafia (or werewolves). In particular, if the game reaches a scenario where all players die, town wins and mafia and werewolves both lose.
      S.5. During each night, all alive town players may choose (but are not compelled to) perform a night action in one of three categories: investigator, protector, and blocker, as well as a target of the action. The power of a role is equal to the number of town players that attempt to perform the same category of night action during that night. Low power is strongest. The power determines exactly what type of action that the player performs.
      S.6. The possible actions that are possible to perform, sorted first by action type, then by power, is as follows:
      Investigator:
      [list]
      [*] Power <= 1: Cop (At the end of night, I will inform the player as to whether their target is innocent (town) or guilty (mafia or werewolf).
      [*] Power 2: Tracker (At the end of the night, I will inform the player as to who their target themselves targeted, if any.)
      [*] Power 3: Motion Detector (At the end of the night, I will inform the player "motion detected" if the target either targeted someone or was themselves targeted, or "no motion detected" if neither happened.
      [*] Power 4: No action (At the end of the night, I will inform the player that their action failed somehow.)
      [/list]
      Protector (self-targeting is allowed):
      [list]
      [*] Power <= 1: Doctor (Your target will survive a single night kill attempt during this night.)
      [*] Power 2: Toxic Doctor (If your target has not accumulated any toxins, your target will survive a single night kill attempt during this night. After this night, your target will have accumulated toxins and will not be eligible to be protected by any toxic doctor for the remainder of the game.)
      [*] Power 3: Bodyguard (If your target is targeted for a kill, you will die instead of the intended target. Only redirects a single kill. If you self-target, bodyguard does nothing.)
      [*] Power 4: No action (You protect no one.)
      [/list]
      Blocker (self-targeting is not allowed):
      [list]
      [*] Power <= 1: Kill Roleblocker (Your target will be blocked from submitting any killing actions this night, i.e. mafia and werewolf factional kills.)
      [*] Power 2: Roleblocker (Your target will be blocked from performing any night action this night. If the target performed an investigative role, they will be told that their action failed somehow.)
      [*] Power 3: Delayer (Your target will be blocked from performing any night action this night, however, they will automatically perform the same action, if possible, the next night. This is in addition to any action that they might attempt the following night. The delayed action is not blockable. Investigative roles will be told that their action failed somehow, but will receive a result the following night.)
      [*] Power 4: No action (You block no one.)
      [/list]
      S.7. Each anti-town team (mafia and werewolves) get six one-time-use ability charges (Power 1 and 2 investigator, Power 1 & 2 protector, Power 2 & 3 blocker) that they may use over the course of the entire game. A mafia player may only use at most one ability charge during each night (in addition to potentially the factional kill). In addition, each night, each mafia team may increase the power of one PR category by one; this effect may be cumulative across both mafia factions, and this power increase is unblockable as it is considered an action done by the mafia team, rather than being attributable to a particular player.
      S.8. Mafia are informed what power level of each PR category town achieved at the end of each night.
      S.9. If two roleblockers target each other, their roleblocks cancel and neither takes effect. This also applies to any roleblocking cycle.
      S.10. A roleblocker is said to prevent an action from initiating; thus a roleblocked target appears to a tracker to have gone nowhere; a motion detector still detects motion from the roleblocker (unless the motion detector is themselves interfered with).
      S.11. A delayed kill cannot be roleblocked, but it can be protected from a doctor or toxic doctor (assuming the target has not accumulated toxins).
      S.12. Townies whose actions are roleblocked still count towards the overall power level of an action for that particular night.
      S.13. In scenarios where a Tracker's target has submitted actions to multiple targets, which is only possible when the target is Mafia or Werewolf who submits a kill and another night action, the Tracker only receives the kill target.

      [/list]

      Role PM's
      [quote=Townie]You are a townie. You are you. Nameless, but it's for the best. You are of the same mind as everyone else, well, except for those who seek to upend this view of life. Each night, you may choose to perform an investigative, protective, or blocking action on a target. You are not required to perform an action each night. You win when all mafia and werewolves are eliminated.[/quote]

      [quote=Mafia]You are a mafia. Your teammate is <player>. You yearn for your own identity, and distinct place in society. You are convinced that uniformity in personality is wrong, but the only way to fix society is to start afresh. Each night, you or your partner may submit a factional kill. If nothing interferes, the targeted player will be dead in morning. In addition to the factional kill, you may also choose to use one of six one-time use abilities, shared with your teammate: Cop, Tracker, Doctor, Toxic Doctor, Roleblocker, Delayer. You win when the mafia compose of strictly more than half of all alive players.[/quote]

      [quote=Werewolf]You are a werewolf. Your teammate is <player>. You yearn for your own identity, and distinct place in society. You are convinced that uniformity in personality is wrong, but the only way to fix society is to start afresh. Each night, you or your partner may submit a factional kill. If nothing interferes, the targeted player will be dead in morning. In addition to the factional kill, you may also choose to use one of six one-time use abilities, shared with your teammate: Cop, Tracker, Doctor, Toxic Doctor, Roleblocker, Delayer. You win when werewolves compose of strictly more than half of all alive players.[/quote]


      Alive (2)
      The number next to the corresponding name represents the amount of PM Prods the player has received.

      [list][*] +ad333 - townie

      [/list]

      Votecount 4.1. (#4025) April 15, 2024
      Votecount 4.2. (#4216) April 17, 2024
      No Hang is voted, Night 4 commences. (#4225) April 18, 2024
      No one dies, Day 5 commences. (#4226) April 20, 2024
      Votecount 5.1. (#4447) April 22, 2024
      awesomeming327., mafia, is hanged, Night 5 commences. (#4473) April 22, 2024
      aayr, townie, and BananaBall00, townie, are killed, Day 6 commences. (#4475) April 23, 2024


      Warnings
      duke_of_wedgewood receives one warning for violating Rule R.11 by editing post #400.
      ad333 receives one warning for violating Rule A.5 by posting during night.


      Game has ended.
