      k Mafia Game 271 (Newbie Game 103)
      fdas   672
      N Dec 30, 2023 by fdas
      Welcome to Mafia Game 271

      Important Rules:
      Do not edit or delete posts
      Do not post during night
      Do not post if you are dead or if you are not in the game
      Do not talk about anything related to this game outside this thread
      Read all the rules!


      Rules
      [list][*]Rules
      [list]
      [*]1.1: Read the rules. All of them. Read them multiple times if necessary.
      [*]1.2: Do not post at night.
      [*]1.3: You may PM me at any time and ask me anything, such as rule clarification.
      [*]1.4: Do not talk about this game outside of this topic to anyone other than the mods in charge, unless I specifically allow you to do so.
      [*]1.5: You may not use any formatting that has an effect of concealing text. This includes size=1, hide="", color=#FFFFFF, and color=white, among others. This does not include adding extra spaces.
      [*]1.6: Do not edit or delete posts you have already submitted; this includes editing right after you post (what goes in the thread stays in the thread). If you for any reason find the need to change your post, use EBWOP or EBWON as necessary.
      [*]1.7: If you are not a living participant of the game, do not post anything else about the game anywhere. You may still spectate the game, but you may no longer post in this thread.
      [*]1.8: Do not advocate for breaking the rules.
      [*]1.9: Do not use the colors red (#FF0000), blue (#0000FF), green (#00FF00), or anything that appears similar, as these colors are used for modding purposes.
      [*]1.10: Confirm your participation in the game by making a post stating the important rules[/list]

      [*] Voting/Hanging
      [list]
      [*] 2.1: Post votes in code tags in the format [code][code]Vote: <insert player here>[/code][/code]
      Since AoPS does not distinguish between usernames with different capitalizations, the capitalization of the player name does not matter. A proper vote looks like [code]Vote: fdas[/code]
      [*] 2.2: Votes may not be placed in hide tags.
      [*] 2.3: Improperly made votes will not be counted under any circumstances. It does not matter if it is the end of the game hammer and everyone revealed their roles. Hint: dont reveal your roles and declare victory until I made the official end of the game post.
      [*] 2.4: You may vote for no hang to occur during a day. Vote this by including in your post [code]Vote: No Hang[/code]
      [*] 2.5: You do not have to unvote before making a new vote, though it is appreciated if you do so. Unvote in the format [code]Vote: Unvote[/code]
      An unvote will undo your previous vote, if any.
      [*] 2.6: Spell the username of the player you wish to vote for exactly. Do not use nicknames.
      [*] 2.7: If at any point in a day more than half of the votes are for a single player, that player will be hanged. It will then immediately be twilight.
      [*] 2.8: If at any point in a day at least half of the votes are for no hang, then there will be no hang. It will then be twilight.
      [*] 2.9: If the deadline is met and no person is hanged, it will be considered no hang and will proceed to be twilight.
      [*] 2.10: The moment the deadline passes, no more votes will be counted even if the mod has not made a post.
      [*] 2.11: During twilight, players may still post. However, no more votes and/or unvotes will be processed.
      [*] 2.12: Once I post a end-of-day scene, the person hanged (if any) is officially dead. Night then immediately begins. You may not post during night.[/list]

      [*] Activity
      [list]
      [*] 3.1: Each day will be 336 hours (2 weeks). The moderator may extend the deadline for the end of the day at his/her discretion. Note that this will be unlikely.
      [*] 3.2: The deadlines will follow the official time
      [*] 3.3: The deadline will occur the very second 336 hours has occurred.
      [*] 3.4: The night deadline will be 72 hours after night begins.
      [*] 3.5: When the night deadline is met, if the moderator does not receive a night action from either a player or his/her partner(s) (if you have them), the player will lose the chance to perform an action during that night.
      [*] 3.6: Any night results will be sent after the night deadline
      [*] 3.7: Night will end at some time after the night deadline when the mod makes the post announcing the end of night.
      [*] 3.8: If a player does not post in a 48-hour period and he/she is not in V/LA, you will receive an in-game prod.
      [*] 3.9: If a player does not post in another 24-hour period after receiving an in-game prod and he/she is not in V/LA, he/she will receive a PM prod.
      [*] 3.10: If a player does not post in another 48-hour period after receiving a PM prod and he/she is not in V/LA, he/she will be replaced, unless you post before the moderator finds a replacement.
      [*] 3.11: If a player receives 5 PM Prods, he/she will be replaced
      [*] 3.12: If a player is going to be V/LA, he/she must post in bold in-thread or PM me. The moderator will not prod the player unless the V/LA is too long.[list]


      [*]Etiquette
      [list]
      [*] 4.1: Do not use inappropriate language.
      [*] 4.2: Do not make any personal attacks.
      [*] 4.3: Follow all of the rules.
      [*] 4.4: Be mature.
      [*] 4.5: For a minor rule infraction, players can receive up to two warnings. If a player commits an infraction after he/she has run out of warnings, or commits a modkill level infraction, he/she will be modkilled or force replaced. Please do not make me modkill you.[/list]


      [*] Moderators/Co-Moderators
      [list]
      [*] 5.1: I fdas am the moderator of Mafia Game 271 and lovematch13 is the co mod
      [*] 5.2: Red-colored text (#FF0000) is used for official votecounts and activity checks by the moderators. It is also used for mafia flavor-related posts.
      [*] 5.3: Blue-colored text (#0000FF) is used for the moderator and co-mod's posts other than votecounts and activity checks.
      [*] 5.4: Green-colored text (#00FF00) is used for town flavor-related posts.
      [*] 5.5: The not voting section is to be ignored if it contradicts any other part of the votecount
      [*] 5.6: If an error to the votecount is not pointed out within 5 days, the incorrect votecount will become official.
      [*] 5.7: The moderator may change the rules at any time.
      [*] 5.8: The moderator has the last say in interpreting the rules. [/list]


      [*] Read all of the rules[/list]

      Setup
      This game will use the Matrix6 setup. This is a semi-open setup.

      In this setup, there are 9 players. Three of the roles will be generated randomly by picking a row or column from the matrix. Then one Mafia Goon and 5 Vanilla Townies are added to maintain a 2:7 mafia:town ratio. The six possible setups are:
      1. 5 Vanilla Townies, 1 Town Jailkeeper, 1 1-Shot Bulletproof Townie, 1 Mafia Roleblocker, 1 Mafia Goon
      2. 6 Vanilla Townies, 1 Town Cop, 2 Mafia Goons
      3. 5 Vanilla Townies, 1 Town Doctor, 1 Town Tracker, 2 Mafia Goons
      4. 6 Vanilla Townies, 1 Town Jailkeeper, 2 Mafia Goons
      5. 5 Vanilla Townies, 1 Town Cop, 1 Town Doctor, 1 Mafia Goon, 1 Mafia Roleblocker
      6. 5 Vanilla Townies, 1 1-Shot Bulletproof Townie, 1 Town Tracker, 2 Mafia Goons


      Role PMs
      [quote]You are a Vanilla Townie. You have no other power other than your vote.

      You win when all members of the Mafia are dead.[/quote]

      [quote]You are a Cop. Every night, you may target one person and determine their alignment.

      You win when all members of the Mafia are dead.[/quote]

      [quote]You are a Doctor. Every night you may heal someone, allowing them to survive if they would have otherwise died. You may not heal yourself two nights in a row.

      You win when all members of the Mafia are dead.[/quote]

      [quote]You are a Tracker. Every night you may target someone and learn who they visited.

      You win when all members of the Mafia are dead.[/quote]

      [quote]You are a Jailkeeper. Each night you may choose someone to put in jail. That person will be unable to perform any actions that night and night kills attempting to target that person will be blocked.

      You win when all members of the Mafia are dead.[/quote]

      [quote]You are a 1-Shot Bulletproof Townie. On the first time that you are attacked by the Mafia, that kill will be negated.

      You win when all members of the Mafia are dead.[/quote]

      [quote]You are a Mafia Goon. During the night you may talk with your partner () here to discuss who you want to kill.

      You win when all members of the Town are dead.[/quote]

      [quote]You are a Mafia Roleblocker. During the night you may talk with your partner () here to discuss who you want to kill. You may also target someone and that person will be unable to perform any actions that night. Your ability takes precedence over the jailkeeper.

      You win when all members of the Town are dead.[/quote]


      Alive (3)
      RAYRAY7512 ostriches88
      awesomelion7 BluePhoenix88
      Kea13


      Dead(6)
      ++NDMath (Vanilla Townie)
      Dream_123 Wesoar (Vanilla Townie)
      AlienGirl05 (Vanilla Townie)
      Socoobo (1 Shot Bulletproof)
      Awesomeness_in_a_Bun (Mafia Goon)
      +mathjay Madelyn (Tracker)


      Events
      Day 1: Wesoar hanged
      Night 1: NDMath died
      Day 2: AlienGirl05 hanged
      Night 2: No one died
      Day 3: No hang
      Night 3: Socoobo died
      Day 4: Awesomeness_in_a_Bun hanged
      Night 4: Madelyn died


      PM Prods
       


      Warnings
      Wesoar: OOT


      Do not post until this line is crossed out

      Day 1 begins at 12:00:00 EDT 9 August 2023.

      k Mafia Game 270 (UIC Invitational VIII) - Procrastination Mafia 3
      mathjay   1893
      N Dec 30, 2023 by fdas
      [center]Welcome to Mafia Game 270
      UIC Invitational VIII

      IMAGE[/center]

      For thousands of years, unseen angels guided humanity through some of their worst crises, artificial or otherwise, attempting to help them into a brighter future. Two centuries ago, however, the angelic community was crippled as one of the biggest companies in the morality consultation business succumbed to demonic sabotage and fell. (Like, literally, from the sky.) In the years since, they scattered to the four corners of the earth as financial mismanagement in both the human and angelic worlds created a devastating recession.

      Yet even in these trying and unprecedented times, some still dreamed of a return to the golden age of angelic capitalism. Quietly, they began to search for the hidden vaults where bygone corporations had stowed billions, maybe even trillions of dollars, all of them lost to time...

      - Important Rules -
      This tab summarizes the most important rules for easy reference.

      For experienced players: everything you need is here, and in the setup tab.
      For new players: you may find it useful to familiarize yourself with the rest of the rules.

      Integrity
      [list][*]Do not edit or delete your posts, even for typos. Just post again.
      [*]Do not OOT (Out of Thread) and talk about this game outside this thread, your role PM, or approved private chats, even if you are dead. Access to spectator chats will be granted upon request.
      [*]Do not gamethrow or intentionally sabotage your wincondition.
      [*]Do not attach files or link to external documents concerning this game. Discussions must stay in this thread.
      [*]Do not use OGI (Out of Game Information). Publicly discussed reads should be made exclusively from information in this thread or past completed games.[/list]

      Activity
      [list][*]Each "Day" is 10 days while each "Night" is 2 days.
      [*]There are no minimum deadlines.
      [*]Do not post during night.
      [*]All times will be in Eastern Standard Time (EST, UTC-5) or Eastern Daylight Time (EDT, UTC-4) as applicable.
      [*]Activity rules are 48 hours to first PM prod, 72 hours to second PM prod, and 96 hours to replacement status.[/list]

      Voting
      [list][*]You must format your votes correctly. Capitalization does not matter, and capital i/lowercase L are not differentiated.
      [*]Both bold vote and code vote formats are accepted, although bold is preferred. Refer to the Voting tab if you do not know what these are.
      [*]Majority hang is always on but cannot end day before the minimum deadline has elapsed.
      [*]Deadline hang is always on except for LYLO.
      [*]Votes are locked at LYLO.[/list]

      Etiquette and Warnings

      [list][*]Use common sense.
      [*]Do not use formatting that makes text hard to read.
      [*]You may attack a players opinion, but do not make personal attacks on players themselves.
      [*]Disagreements should be resolved in a way that does not affect gameplay.
      [*]Do not discuss rule violations by other players in the thread; contact the moderators privately.
      [*]First-timers can receive up to 3 warnings before their next offense results in a force replacement or modkill. All other players can receive up to 2.
      [*]Players may be replaced at the moderators' discretion for procedural difficulties.
      [*]All other rules are standard.[/list]

      Setup and Moderators

      [list][*]This game is based on the JOAT10 Setup.
      [*]Mafia have access to daychat.
      [*]All role mechanics and Night Action Resolutions are standard.
      [*]This game is moderated by lovematch13 and mathjay.
      [*]This game operates optional discord spectator and mafia private chats using the Unpaid Intern Central server. Contact the mods to request access.[/list]

      Resources and Support

      [list][*]For any issues, you may contact us through your role PM or through Discord (@butlikeactually).
      [*]For a list of basic resources, refer to the Resources tab below.
      [*]For a more extensive list of resources compiled by the UIMT, go here.
      [*]If this game is causing you significant stress or frustration, feel free to use your role PM to talk or vent. We may not be allowed to give you technical advice, but we can listen or help you find a better way to process events. You may also contact us via Discord if you prefer.[/list]


      [list][*]General
      Credits to Binomial-theorem, chaotic_iak, willwang123, and fdas, among others, as well as the Mafia Universe forum rules, for the rule template.

      The following are standard mafia game rules.


      [list][*]Do not post during the night phase.
      [*]Do not talk about this game's events outside of this thread unless you are specifically given permission to do so by the moderators. Details are in the Moderation Policies tab.
      [*]Do not talk about other ongoing games in this thread. Referring to anything that has happened in an ongoing game, even if you do not say which game it is, is OOT.
      [*]If you are dead, do not post, and do not talk about this game anywhere else. You may still spectate; access to spoiled and unspoiled spectator chats will be offered.
      [*]Do not use any formatting that obscures or conceals text. This includes [color=#FFFFFF], [color=white], and [color=transparent].
      [*]Do not edit or delete posts, even for typos: what goes in the thread stays in the thread. Instead, use EBWOP or EBWON as appropriate.
      [*]Do not quote or pretend to quote any PMs from the mods, including role PMs.
      [*]Do not impersonate the mods.
      [*]Do not lie to the mods.
      [*]Do not abuse loopholes in the rules. Intent will be considered during rule enforcement.
      [*]You may use your role PM to ask questions, such as rule clarifications.[/list]


      [*]Votes and Hangs
      This tab covers voting, unvoting, No Hangs, and hangs.


      [list][*]Votes must be in this format to be counted: Vote: [player username].
      [*]By default, votes should be made in [b] (bold) tags. However, votes made in [code] and [c] tags will also be accepted.
      [*]Usernames in votes must be spelled, but not necessarily capitalized, correctly. Do not use nicknames.
      [*]For the purposes of voting, I (capital i) and l (lowercase L) are considered identical.
      [*]For example, both Vote: mathjay and Vote: mAtHjAy are valid votes, but vote: mathjay, Vote: jay, Vote: mathjay., Vote:mathjay, Vote: mathjay, and Vote: mathjay are invalid.
      [*]Votes followed by extraneous punctuation that is similarly formatted, even with separate tags, are invalid.
      [*]Votes in hide, tip, or quote tags do not count.
      [*]Vote to hang no one by posting Vote: No Hang.
      [*]Unvote by posting Unvote. You do not have to unvote before voting again.
      [*]Votecounts will be posted periodically. Players may request a new VC in bold or in their role PM.
      [*]Invalid votes will not count under any circumstances. Consider notifying the mods in your role PM if you want to purposely fakevote.
      [*]Valid votes will always be counted unless they are clearly unintentional. There is no guarantee that an accidental vote will not be counted.
      [*]Votes will be carried over if a player is replaced.
      [*]The Not Voting section should be ignored if it contradicts another part of the votecount (VC).
      [*]If an error in the votecount is not pointed out within 2 days or by the next EOD, whichever is sooner, the incorrect VC will become official.
      [*]This game uses deadline hang: the player with the most votes at the EOD (End of Day) deadline will be hanged.
      [*]If two or more players have the same number of votes at the EOD deadline, the player who reached that number of votes first will be hanged. Details are in the Moderation Policies tab.
      [*]If no votes have been cast by the deadline, no one will be hanged.
      [*]Starting Day 1, if a player is voted by the majority of living players after the minimum deadline has elapsed, then that player will be hanged immediately; and if No Hang is voted by half of living players, a No Hang will occur.
      [*]Upon reaching LYLO (Hang-or-Lose), votes will be locked, meaning that they cannot be changed.
      [*]Deadline hang is off at LYLO. If a majority hang is not reached by the deadline, the day will end without a hang, resulting in an automatic win for the mafia team.
      [*]The moment the deadline occurs, no further votes will be counted. Details are in the Moderation Policies tab.
      [*]If the deadline has passed or a hammer has occurred and the EOD has not been declared, the game will proceed into twilight. Players may still post, but no more votes or unvotes will be counted.
      [*]Once the moderators declare the EOD, the person hanged will be officially eliminated and their role revealed. Night will then immediately begin.[/list]

      [*]Activity
      This tab covers deadlines, activity rules, V/LAs, and replacements.


      [list][*]All times will be in Eastern Standard Time (EST, UTC-5) or Eastern Daylight Time (EDT, UTC-4) as applicable, unless otherwise noted.
      [*]Each day phase will be 240 hours (10 days), and each night phase will be 48 hours (2 days).
      [*]The moderators may extend deadlines at their discretion.
      [*]The current deadline can be found in the bottom of the OP (Original Post, or post #1).
      [*]If a player with an NA (Night Action) anticipates being unavailable during the night phase, they may submit any night actions to be performed in advance.
      [*]If a player with an NA has not submitted their action by 24 hours before the night deadline, a reminder will be sent.
      [*]If the moderators do not receive an NA submission from a player by the night deadline, the player will not perform an action that night.
      [*]Night results will be sent after the night deadline.
      [*]Night will end when the moderators make a post declaring the end of night (EON). You may not post in the thread until then, even if the night deadline has passed. Instead, PM the mods for updates if they miss a deadline.
      [*]Players who are temporarily unable to fulfill activity requirements can declare a V/LA (Vacation/Long Absence) by posting the V/LA dates in bold in-thread or in their role PM. Players on a V/LA will not be prodded.
      [*]V/LAs should be shorter than one week. For longer absences, contact the moderators for options.
      [*]Players who no longer wish to or are unable to play in this game can request replacement by posting Request Replacement in-thread or in their role PM.
      [*]Players who have replaced out generally will not be allowed to replace back in.
      [*]Players will receive their first PM prod if they have not made a game-advancing post for 48 hours and are not on V/LA. Details on "game-advancing post" are in the Moderation Policies tab.
      [*]Players will receive their second PM prod if they have not made a game-advancing post for 72 hours and are not on V/LA.
      [*]Players will be replaced if they have not made a game-advancing post for 96 hours and are not on V/LA, unless they post before the moderators find a replacement.
      [*]If a player receives 4 PM Prods, they will be replaced.
      [*]If a player reaches replacement status more than once, they will be replaced.
      [*]Activity Checks (ACs) will be posted periodically. Players may request a new AC in bold or in their role PM.
      [*]Activity will reset overnight. Players will not receive prods between twilight and daystart.
      [*]If you have access to a private topic, you may request that a partner be poked. The moderators will send a notification via PM to the specified player, but this will not count as an official prod.
      [*]If a player is postbanned by the AoPS Sheriff, they will be replaced. Details are in the Moderation Policies tab.[list]

      [*]Integrity and Etiquette
      This tab covers integrity recommendations, player etiquette, warning limits, and examples of inconsiderate gameplay.


      [list][*]Do not gamethrow.
      [*]Do not discuss player alignments based on V/LAs, replacements, warnings, force replacements, modkills, or other interactions with moderators.
      [*]Do not discuss rule violations, especially violations by other players in the thread. If you wish, contact the moderators privately through your role PM or Discord.
      [*]Any significant, game-related, and intentionally exclusive player-to-player communication outside of moderator-sanctioned channels is prohibited.
      [*]Do not publicly reference OGI (Out of Game Information) in reads or create situations outside the thread that players could reasonably consider alignment indicative.[/list]

      The above rules are attempts to preserve the spirit of the game and should not affect most players. For specific details and examples, click here.


      [list][*]Do not make personal attacks. You may attack a player's opinion, but do not demean the player themselves.
      [*]Do not spam.
      [*]Follow AoPS Community Guidelines and the AoPS Terms of Service.
      [*]Be mature and use common sense.
      [*]Behavior that disrupts the game for players and makes it unreasonably hard for them to read and play may result in a warning.
      Causing significant disruptions to gameplay may result in a force replacement at the moderators' discretion.
      [*]For minor rule infractions, first-timers can receive up to three warnings, while all other players can receive up to two. A player may receive multiple warnings for a single infraction.[/list]

      The above rules broadly address most etiquette issues. For specific details and examples of improper behavior, click here.


      [*]- Moderation Policies -

      [*]Moderator Information
      This tab provides technical information about this game.


      [list][*]lovematch13 and mathjay are the moderators of Mafia Game 270.
      [*]Other Unpaid Interns have contributed to flavor, setup, OCRSTM, feedback, and management of the private chat discord system.
      [*]This game uses the Unpaid Intern Central consolidated private chat system. Participants of this game will be granted access as appropriate.
      [*]Red text is used for votecounts, warnings, and other announcements by the moderators. It is also used for mafia flavor-related text.
      [*]Blue text is used for activity checks, confirm counts, and other non-essential posts by the moderators.
      [*]Green text is used for town flavor-related text.
      [*]Purple text is used for third-party flavor-related text.
      [*]Custom shades of these colors may be used for aesthetic purposes.
      [*]Current custom shades are: Town flavor green v.2 (#2be368) and Activity Check blue (#005dff). For a full list of custom colors, click here.
      [*]The moderators may change the rules at any time. Major rule changes will be announced at the bottom of the OP. All changes will also be noted in the modlog and OCRSTM Version History.
      [*]Players will not be retroactively penalized for violating new rules.
      [*]Major changes to the OP may be made in between games. The most important changes will be noted in the OCRSTM Version History.
      [*]The moderators pledge to treat players fairly and keep moderator interventions to a minimum; however, we reserve the right to make the final judgement in the moderation of this game.[/list]

      MG266 OP is based on Overcomplicated RulesetTM (OCRSTM) 10.
      Current version: 10.8.5 (Minimum Deadlines Standard Non-newbie)
      Version History

      OCRSTM 10 is available for public use. If you are interested in using OCRSTM in your own games, click here.
      [/list]
      Setup
      This game is based on the JOAT10 setup. This is an open setup.

      In this setup, there are 10 players. The roles are as follows:

      1 Town Jack of All Trades, 7 Vanilla Townies, 2 Mafia Goons

      The Town JOAT can choose from the following abilities:
      [list][*]1-shot Cop
      [*]1-shot Doctor
      [*]1-shot Vig[/list]

      Other important setup mechanics:
      [list][*]Cop results are sane.
      [*]The Doctor ability cannot self-target.
      [*]Mafia have daychat.
      [*]Mafia factional kills (NKs) are not compulsive.
      [*]Mentors may be assigned to any Town PRs as well as the Mafia faction. Do not talk about mentors in the thread. [/list]
      Role PMs
      [quote=Vanilla Townie Role PM]
      IMAGE

      Hello, [player]!

      You are an Currently Unpaid, Will Continue to be Unpaid Angel (Vanilla Townie).

      As a blue-linen, working class angel, this recession has hit you particularly hard. You long for the simple joys of minimum wage employment like the threadbare healthcare benefits, micromanaging managers, and that promotion that youre definitely gonna get SoonTM. Although you proclaim your corporate enthusiasm, you still like your Jinnstagram memes with a side of anti-capitalism and your favorite sport is watching labor unions slug it out with HR on livestream. Most importantly, you know when capitalisms gone too far.

      Your power lies in your observation skills, your voice, and your vote.

      You win when all Mafia are killed, so your goal is to find them. Play towards your win condition, and good luck.

      Click here to go to the game thread.
      [/quote]
      [quote=Town JOAT Role PM]
      IMAGE

      Hello, [player]!

      You are the Golden Child (Town JOAT).

      The absolute, perfect, quintessential unpaid intern. On time, smart, responsible, omnipresent and omni-knowledgeable, you show up in every (attempting to be an) adults, Oh man, when I grow up, I want to be as good as [INSERT YOUR NAME HERE]. Youre skilled, youre popular, youve achieved fun-life-work balance, and everyone knows your name Actually, no, everyone knows Scipio1 was the original golden child, but um. So sorry. Ah, this is so awkward, but um. Which one are you again?

      Each night, you may choose to use one of the following three abilities:
      [list][*]Check the alignment of a player (1-shot Cop)
      [*]Protect a player from the mafia factional kill (1-shot Doctor)
      [*]Shoot a player during the night (1-shot Vigilante)[/list]
      Once you have used up all your abilities, you will no longer have access to any night actions. [/list]

      You win when all Mafia are killed, so your goal is to find them. Play towards your win condition, and good luck.

      Click here to go to the game thread.
      [/quote]
      [quote=Mafia Goon Role PM]
      IMAGE

      Hello, [player]!

      You are a Based Capitalism Enjoyer (Mafia Goon).

      IMAGE

      Your partner is [player] ([role]), and you may discuss with them in this private forum while you are alive. The two of you will be able to choose a player to kill each night, as well as decide who makes the kill.

      You win when the Mafia are the only ones left, or if nothing can prevent this, so your goal is to stay hidden and kill Town. Play towards your win condition, and good luck.

      Click here to go to the game thread.
      [/quote]

      k Mafia Game 269: Auction Mafia
      chess24   5806
      N Dec 30, 2023 by fdas
      Welcome to Mafia Game 269: Auction Mafia

      If you're not currently alive in this game, do not post.
      If you want to join a game, go to the Signups thread.
      To learn how Mafia works, see the FAQ thread.

      - Important Rules -
      This tab summarizes the most important rules for easy reference.

      For experienced players: everything you need is here, and in the setup tab.
      For new players: you may find it useful to familiarize yourself with the rest of the rules.

      Integrity
      [list][*]Do not edit or delete your posts, OOT, gamethrow, link to external documents concerning this game, or use OGI. Further information about these topics can be found in the General tab and the Integrity and Etiquette tab.
      [*]Do not quote or pretend to quote your role PM or any other private mod communication. You may claim your bids, actions, results, etc. - just don't directly quote a sentence from the mod (paraphrase instead!) or screenshot your role PM.
      [*]Do not reference or pretend to reference private communication with the mod unless it is mechanical information (e.g., night action results).
      [*]Do not discuss replacements. More specifically
      [quote=MU rules]9a. Substitutions: Noting that a player X has subbed for player Y is fine. Noting when that occurred is fine. Discussing why someone has been subbed out, announcing you will sub out, telling someone to sub out, public speculation as to someone's alignment based on the substitution itself, all forbidden. Think what you will about this person's alignment, at your own risk. But using the substitution as reasoning is disallowed. It's bad for the game.

      To be clear, you can talk about the player who was subbed out. You can say that they were subbed out. You can say when they subbed out. You can say why the player that subbed out was scummy based on what they did or didn't do while they were a player. All that's being (not) discussed here is speculation as to why they subbed out. That's all the rule forbids. If you can be careful and stick to the legal stuff, you'll be fine. It's a very limited rule. The word "sub" is not lava, you can touch it. You don't get penalized for saying that a player was subbed in or out. Just don't discuss why they were subbed out. The "why" is what is ruled out. Think what you will, speculate internally. Just remember, the part that is illegal is "why they subbed out." It's not part of the game.[/quote]

      [/list]

      Activity
      [list]
      [*]Each "Day" is 10 days. Each "Auction" is 2 days. Each "Night" is 2 days. If all players agree to end auction or night early, it will end early.
      [*]Day actions are processed as soon as possible, but no day actions will be processed in the first 48 hours of a day phase (although you may submit them early). Day actions may also not be submitted in the 48 hours preceding the EOD deadline. If you haven't submitted a day action and there is an early hammer, you're out of luck.
      [*]Players may communicate in mafia chat and any other chats that may or may not exist at any time.
      [*]Majority will be enabled day 2.
      [*]Each day there is majority, there will be a minimum deadline of 72 hours. Day cannot end by majority hang until this minimum deadline has passed.
      [*]All times will be in Eastern Standard Time (EST, UTC-5) or Eastern Daylight Time (EDT, UTC-4) as applicable.
      [*]Be active. Activity rules are 48 hours to first PM prod, 72 hours to second PM prod, and 96 hours to replacement status.
      [*]If you would like to request replacement, privately tell the mods. Do not mention it in thread.[/list]

      Voting
      [list][*]You must format your votes correctly. Capitalization does not matter, and capital i/lowercase L are not differentiated. Names must be spelled exactly with correct capitalization, or they may not be counted.
      [*]Both bold vote and code vote formats are accepted, although bold is preferred. Refer to the Voting tab if you do not know what these are.
      [*]Majority hang is off for Day 1, but it is on starting Day 2.
      [*]Deadline hang is on from Day 1 but it is off for LYLO. Ties are broken by whoever reached that number of votes first.
      [*]Votes are locked at LYLO.
      [/list]

      Etiquette
      [list][*]Use common sense.
      [*]Do not use formatting that makes text hard to read.
      [*]You may attack a players opinion, but do not make personal attacks on players themselves.
      [*]Disagreements should be resolved in a way that does not affect gameplay.
      [*]Do not discuss rule violations by other players in the thread; contact the moderators privately.
      [*]Minor rule infractions will lead to warnings. Repeated minor rule infractions will lead to replacement.
      [*]Players may be replaced at the moderators' discretion for procedural difficulties.
      [*]All other rules are standard.[/list]

      Setup and Moderators
      [list][*]The setup is auction mafia. For more information, see the Setup tab.
      [*]This game is moderated by chess24.
      [*]This game operates optional discord spectator and mafia private chats using the Unpaid Intern Central server. Contact the mods to request access.[/list]

      Resources and Support
      [list][*]For any issues, you may contact me through your role PM or through Discord (chess24#4527).
      [*]For a list of basic resources, refer to the Resources tab below.
      [*]For a more extensive list of resources compiled by the UIMT, go here.
      [*]If this game is causing you significant stress or frustration, feel free to use your role PM to talk or vent. We may not be allowed to give you technical advice, but we can listen or help you find a better way to process events. You may also contact us via Discord if you prefer.[/list]


      [list][*]General
      Credits to Binomial-theorem, chaotic_iak, willwang123, and fdas, among others, as well as the Mafia Universe forum rules, for the rule template.

      The following are standard mafia game rules.


      [list][*]Do not post during the night phase.
      [*]Do not talk about this game's events outside of this thread unless you are specifically given permission to do so by the moderators. Details are in the Moderation Policies tab.
      [*]Do not talk about other ongoing games in this thread. Referring to anything that has happened in an ongoing game, even if you do not say which game it is, is OOT.
      [*]If you are dead, do not post, and do not talk about this game anywhere else. You may still spectate; access to spoiled and unspoiled spectator chats will be offered.
      [*]Do not use any formatting that obscures or conceals text. This includes [color=#FFFFFF], [color=white], and [color=transparent].
      [*]Do not edit or delete posts, even for typos: what goes in the thread stays in the thread. Instead, use EBWOP or EBWON as appropriate.
      [*]Do not quote or pretend to quote any PMs from the mods, including role PMs.
      [*]Do not impersonate the mods.
      [*]Do not lie to the mods.
      [*]Do not abuse loopholes in the rules. Intent will be considered during rule enforcement.
      [*]You may use your role PM to ask questions, such as rule clarifications.[/list]


      [*]Votes and Hangs
      This tab covers voting, unvoting, No Hangs, and hangs.


      [list][*]Votes must be in this format to be counted: Vote: [player username].
      [*]By default, votes should be made in [b] (bold) tags. However, votes made in [code] and [c] tags will also be accepted.
      [*]Usernames in votes must be spelled, but not necessarily capitalized, correctly. Do not use nicknames.
      [*]For the purposes of voting, I (capital i) and l (lowercase L) are considered identical.
      [*]For example, both Vote: mathjay and Vote: mAtHjAy are valid votes, but vote: mathjay, Vote: jay, Vote: mathjay., Vote:mathjay, Vote: mathjay, and Vote: mathjay are invalid. Ignore this.
      [*]Votes followed by extraneous punctuation that is similarly formatted, even with separate tags, are invalid.
      [*]Votes in hide, tip, or quote tags do not count.
      [*]Vote to hang no one by posting Vote: No Hang.
      [*]Unvote by posting Unvote or Vote: Unvote. You do not have to unvote before voting again.
      [*]Votecounts will be posted periodically. Players may request a new VC in bold or in their role PM.
      [*]Invalid votes that appear real may or may not be counted.
      [*]Valid votes will always be counted unless they are clearly unintentional. There is no guarantee that an accidental vote will not be counted.
      [*]Votes will be carried over if a player is replaced.
      [*]The Not Voting section should be ignored if it contradicts another part of the votecount (VC).
      [*]If an error in the votecount is not pointed out within 2 days or by the next EOD, whichever is sooner, the incorrect VC will become official.
      [*]This game uses deadline hang: the player with the most votes at the EOD (End of Day) deadline will be hanged.
      [*]If two or more players have the same number of votes at the EOD deadline, the player who reached that number of votes first will be hanged. Details are in the Moderation Policies tab.
      [*]If no votes have been cast by the deadline, no one will be hanged.
      [*]Starting Day 2, if a player is voted by the majority of living players and the minimum deadline has passed, then that player will be hanged immediately; and if No Hang is voted by half of living players, a No Hang will occur.
      [*]Upon reaching LYLO (Hang-or-Lose), votes will be locked, meaning that they cannot be changed.
      [*]Deadline hang is off at LYLO. If a majority hang is not reached by the deadline, the day will end without a hang, resulting in an automatic win for the mafia team.
      [*]The moment the deadline passes, no further votes will be counted. For example, if the deadline is at 9:00 PM, votes timestamped 9:00 PM will be counted, but votes timestamped 9:01 PM will not. Details are in the Moderation Policies tab.
      [*]If the deadline has passed or a hammer has occurred and the EOD has not been declared, the game will proceed into twilight. Players may still post, but no more votes or unvotes will be counted.
      [*]Once the moderators declare the EOD, the person hanged will be officially eliminated and their role revealed. Night will then immediately begin.[/list]

      [*]Activity
      This tab covers deadlines, activity rules, V/LAs, and replacements.


      [list][*]All times will be in Eastern Standard Time (EST, UTC-5) or Eastern Daylight Time (EDT, UTC-4) as applicable, unless otherwise noted.
      [*]Each "Day" is 10 days.
      [*]Each "Night" is 2 days.
      [*]Each "Auction" is 2 days.
      [*]If all players agree to end night or auction phase early, it will end early.
      [*]Each day there is majority, there will be a minimum deadline of 72 hours. Day cannot end by majority hang until this minimum deadline has passed.
      [*]The moderators may extend deadlines at their discretion.
      [*]The current deadline can be found in the bottom of the OP (Original Post, or post #1).
      [*]If a player with an NA (Night Action) anticipates being unavailable during the night phase, they may submit any night actions to be performed in advance.
      [*]If the moderators do not receive an NA submission from a player by the night deadline, the player will not perform an action that night.
      [*]Night results will be sent after the night deadline.
      [*]Night will end when the moderators make a post declaring the end of night (EON). You may not post in the thread until then, even if the night deadline has passed. Instead, PM the mods for updates if they miss a deadline.
      [*]Players who are temporarily unable to fulfill activity requirements can declare a V/LA (Vacation/Long Absence) by posting the V/LA dates in bold in-thread or in their role PM. Players on a V/LA will not be prodded.
      [*]V/LAs should be shorter than one week. For longer absences, contact the moderators for options.
      [*]Players who no longer wish to or are unable to play in this game should request replacement by posting Request Replacement in their role PM.
      [*]Players who have replaced out generally will not be allowed to replace back in.
      [*]Players will receive their first PM prod if they have not made a game-advancing post for 48 hours and are not on V/LA. Details on "game-advancing post" are in the Moderation Policies tab.
      [*]Players will receive their second PM prod if they have not made a game-advancing post for 72 hours and are not on V/LA.
      [*]Players will be replaced if they have not made a game-advancing post for 96 hours and are not on V/LA, unless they post before the moderators find a replacement.
      [*]If a player receives 4 PM Prods, they will be replaced.
      [*]If a player reaches replacement status more than once, they will be replaced.
      [*]Activity Checks (ACs) will be posted periodically. Players may request a new AC in bold or in their role PM.
      [*]If you have access to a private topic, you may request that a partner be poked. The moderators will send a notification via PM to the specified player, but this will not count as an official prod.
      [*]If a player is postbanned by the AoPS Sheriff, they will be replaced. Details are in the Moderation Policies tab.[list]

      [*]Integrity and Etiquette
      This tab covers integrity recommendations, player etiquette, warning limits, and examples of inconsiderate gameplay.


      [list][*]Do not gamethrow.
      [*]Do not discuss player alignments based on V/LAs, replacements, warnings, force replacements, modkills, or other interactions with moderators.
      [*]Do not discuss rule violations, especially violations by other players in the thread. If you wish, contact the moderators privately through your role PM or Discord.
      [*]Any significant, game-related, and intentionally exclusive player-to-player communication outside of moderator-sanctioned channels is prohibited.
      [*]Do not publicly reference OGI (Out of Game Information) in reads or create situations outside the thread that players could reasonably consider alignment indicative.[/list]

      The above rules are attempts to preserve the spirit of the game and should not affect most players. For specific details and examples, click here.


      [list][*]Do not make personal attacks. You may attack a player's opinion, but do not demean the player themselves.
      [*]Do not spam.
      [*]Follow AoPS Community Guidelines and the AoPS Terms of Service.
      [*]Be mature and use common sense.
      [*]Behavior that disrupts the game for players and makes it unreasonably hard for them to read and play may result in a warning.
      Causing significant disruptions to gameplay may result in a force replacement at the moderators' discretion.
      [*]Minor rule infractions will lead to warnings. Repeated rule infractions will lead to replacement.[/list]

      The above rules broadly address most etiquette issues. For specific details and examples of improper behavior, click here.


      [*]- Moderation Policies -

      [*]Moderator Information
      This tab provides technical information about this game.


      [list][*]chess24 is the moderator of Mafia Game 269.
      [*]Credit to fdas for reviewing the setup.
      [*]Credit to mathjay, Mathletesv, HannahW, and others for OCRSTM (this ruleset) and management of the private chat discord system.
      [*]This game uses the Unpaid Intern Central consolidated private chat system. Participants of this game will be granted access as appropriate.
      [*]The moderators may change the rules at any time. Major rule changes will be announced at the bottom of the OP. All changes will also be noted in the modlog and OCRSTM Version History.
      [*]Players will not be retroactively penalized for violating new rules.
      [*]Major changes to the OP may be made in between games. The most important changes will be noted in the OCRSTM Version History.
      [*]The moderators pledge to treat players fairly and keep moderator interventions to a minimum; however, we reserve the right to make the final judgement in the moderation of this game.[/list]

      MG269 OP is based on Overcomplicated RulesetTM (OCRSTM) 10.
      Current version: 10.0.1
      Version History

      OCRSTM 10 is available for public use. If you are interested in using OCRSTM in your own games, click here.
      [/list]
      Setup
      Credit to fdas for reviewing and improving the setup.
      Credit to Amrock for the auction mechanic.

      Basic Info
      - 21er: 16 Vanilla Townies, 5 Mafia Goons. (Abilities come from auction items.)
      - Town win when all Mafia are eliminated. Mafia win upon reaching parity, or when nothing can prevent this.
      - Mafia have a mandatory, assigned factional nightkill. This may be used on the same player multiple nights in a row.

      Auction Mechanics
      - Players start with 10 coins.
      - An auction phase occurs after each day. A list of items up for auction is posted, and players may submit private bids on these items.
      - Players may bid a positive integer number of coins on any number of items, provided their total bids for an auction do not exceed their number of coins.
      - The highest bid wins each item (random if tied). Only the winners pay coins.
      - After the auction phase, the game moves into the night phase, where night actions can be used.
      - There is also an auction phase before the first day phase.
      - Thus, the game progresses as follows:
      Auction 0,
      Day 1, Auction 1, Night 1,
      Day 2, Auction 2, Night 2,
      etc.
      - Day/auction/night phase lengths: 10 days / 2 days / 2 days.
      - Auctions will end after night 5.
      - Bids, item winners, and item uses are not publicly revealed (though naturally, it will be sometimes be obvious when an item is used). Players may claim them freely and lie about them.

      Items
      - Items are generally limited shot actions, with some other things sprinkled in.
      - Unless otherwise specified, actions from items are usable during the night phase only.
      - Items that are actions do not have to be used immediately. Items, especially ones that interact with other items/actions, can often be more impactful if used later in the game. Of course, saving an item for later comes with the risk that you'll die before using it.
      - Items will generally become more powerful as the game goes on, but the number of items offered each auction will taper off.

      Bank
      - Mafia have access to a bank, which starts with a balance of 0 coins.
      - After a Mafia dies, 60% of their remaining coins (minus any they withdrew from the bank) are added to the bank balance.
      - After a Town dies, 20% of their remaining coins are subtracted from the bank balance.
      - Mafia members may withdraw an integer number of coins from the bank during auctions, provided the bank balance does not become negative.
      - The bank balance can go negative due to town deaths (which has no effect other than preventing withdrawal) or hold a non-integer number of coins.

      Other Details
      - This game is not bastard, though elements that might be considered borderline bastard may exist.
      - For example, there may be nonstandard roles (such as redirectors) that may mess with your actions - for this game's purposes, anything influenced by said roles will not be considered as lying. It is guaranteed, however, that Framers, Godfather, Millers, or other roles of that sort do not exist, nor are there alignment conversion or any borderline bastard mechanics of that sort.
      - Any investigative abilities will show their target(s) in their results.
      - Unless otherwise specified, players are by default multitasking and non self-targeting.
      - Actions will be processed in accordance with Reasonable Action Resolution.
      - When a player dies, only their role is revealed. Their bids, items, remaining coins, etc. are not.
      - Do not quote or pretend to quote your role PM or any private mod communication. You may claim your bids, actions, results, etc. - just don't directly quote a sentence from the mod, paraphrase instead.
      - Do not reference or pretend to reference private communication with the mod unless it is mechanical information (e.g., night action results).

      Role PMs
      [quote=VT]
      Hi,

      You are a Vanilla Townie. You win when all the Mafia are eliminated. You start with 10 coins.

      The game thread is HERE.
      [/quote]
      [quote=Mafia Goon]
      Hi,

      You are a Mafia Goon. You win when the Mafia reach parity with the Town, or nothing can prevent this. You start with 10 coins.

      List of Mafia (all Mafia Goons):
      NAME
      NAME
      NAME
      NAME
      NAME

      You may communicate with your partners at any time HERE. Each night, you all must submit a non-Mafia player to kill and a member of the Mafia to perform the kill. If no factional kill is submitted, the performer and target are randomized.

      The game thread is HERE.
      [/quote]

      Auction Items
      Auction items have been moved to post #2 so that this post does not hit the character limit.


      Votecounts
      Note: Colored votecounts for any post can be generated with this script. For a more general version of the VC script that does not contain this game's players, see the Resources tab.

      k Mafia Game 268 (Newbie Game 102): Happy Town Mafia
      fdas   746
      N Dec 30, 2023 by fdas
      Welcome to Mafia Game 268: Happy Town Mafia
      Rules
      [list][*]Rules
      [list]
      [*]1.1: Read the rules. All of them. Read them multiple times if necessary.
      [*]1.2: Do not post at night.
      [*]1.3: You may PM me at any time and ask me anything, such as rule clarification.
      [*]1.4: Do not talk about this game outside of this topic to anyone other than the mods in charge, unless I specifically allow you to do so.
      [*]1.5: You may not use any formatting that has an effect of concealing text. This includes size=1, hide="", color=#FFFFFF, and color=white, among others. This does not include adding extra spaces.
      [*]1.6: Do not edit or delete posts you have already submitted; this includes editing right after you post (what goes in the thread stays in the thread). If you for any reason find the need to change your post, use EBWOP or EBWON as necessary.
      [*]1.7: If you are not a living participant of the game, do not post anything else about the game anywhere. You may still spectate the game, but you may no longer post in this thread.
      [*]1.8: Do not advocate for breaking the rules.
      [*]1.9: Do not use the colors red (#FF0000), blue (#0000FF), green (#00FF00), or anything that appears similar, as these colors are used for modding purposes.
      [*]1.10: Confirm by posting Confirm[/list]

      [*] Voting/Hanging
      [list]
      [*] 2.1: Post votes in code tags in the format [code][code]Vote: <insert player here>[/code][/code]
      Since AoPS does not distinguish between usernames with different capitalizations, the capitalization of the player name does not matter. A proper vote looks like [code]Vote: fdas[/code]
      [*] 2.2: Votes may not be placed in hide tags.
      [*] 2.3: Improperly made votes will not be counted under any circumstances. It does not matter if it is the end of the game hammer and everyone revealed their roles. Hint: dont reveal your roles and declare victory until I made the official end of the game post.
      [*] 2.4: You may vote for no hang to occur during a day. Vote this by including in your post [code]Vote: No Hang[/code]
      [*] 2.5: You do not have to unvote before making a new vote, though it is appreciated if you do so. Unvote in the format [code]Vote: Unvote[/code]
      An unvote will undo your previous vote, if any.
      [*] 2.6: Spell the username of the player you wish to vote for exactly. Do not use nicknames.
      [*] 2.7: If at any point in a day more than half of the votes are for a single player, that player will be hanged. It will then immediately be twilight.
      [*] 2.8: If at any point in a day at least half of the votes are for no hang, then there will be no hang. It will then be twilight.
      [*] 2.9: If the deadline is met and no person is hanged, it will be considered no hang and will proceed to be twilight.
      [*] 2.10: The moment the deadline passes, no more votes will be counted even if the mod has not made a post.
      [*] 2.11: During twilight, players may still post. However, no more votes and/or unvotes will be processed.
      [*] 2.12: Once I post a end-of-day scene, the person hanged (if any) is officially dead. Night then immediately begins. You may not post during night.[/list]

      [*] Activity
      [list]
      [*] 3.1: Each day will be 336 hours (2 weeks). The moderator may extend the deadline for the end of the day at his/her discretion. Note that this will be unlikely.
      [*] 3.2: The deadlines will follow the official time
      [*] 3.3: The deadline will occur the very second 336 hours has occurred.
      [*] 3.4: The night deadline will be 72 hours after night begins.
      [*] 3.5: When the night deadline is met, if the moderator does not receive a night action from either a player or his/her partner(s) (if you have them), the player will lose the chance to perform an action during that night.
      [*] 3.6: Any night results will be sent after the night deadline
      [*] 3.7: Night will end at some time after the night deadline when the mod makes the post announcing the end of night.
      [*] 3.8: If a player does not post in a 48-hour period and he/she is not in V/LA, you will receive an in-game prod.
      [*] 3.9: If a player does not post in another 24-hour period after receiving an in-game prod and he/she is not in V/LA, he/she will receive a PM prod.
      [*] 3.10: If a player does not post in another 48-hour period after receiving a PM prod and he/she is not in V/LA, he/she will be replaced, unless you post before the moderator finds a replacement.
      [*] 3.11: If a player receives 5 PM Prods, he/she will be replaced
      [*] 3.12: If a player is going to be V/LA, he/she must post in bold in-thread or PM me. The moderator will not prod the player unless the V/LA is too long.[list]


      [*]Etiquette
      [list]
      [*] 4.1: Do not use inappropriate language.
      [*] 4.2: Do not make any personal attacks.
      [*] 4.3: Follow all of the rules.
      [*] 4.4: Be mature.
      [*] 4.5: For a minor rule infraction, players can receive up to two warnings. If a player commits an infraction after he/she has run out of warnings, or commits a modkill level infraction, he/she will be modkilled or force replaced. Please do not make me modkill you.[/list]


      [*] Moderators/Co-Moderators
      [list]
      [*] 5.1: I fdas am the moderator of Mafia Game 268 and scannose is the co mod
      [*] 5.2: Red-colored text (#FF0000) is used for official votecounts and activity checks by the moderators. It is also used for mafia flavor-related posts.
      [*] 5.3: Blue-colored text (#0000FF) is used for the moderator and co-mod's posts other than votecounts and activity checks.
      [*] 5.4: Green-colored text (#00FF00) is used for town flavor-related posts.
      [*] 5.5: The not voting section is to be ignored if it contradicts any other part of the votecount
      [*] 5.6: If an error to the votecount is not pointed out within 5 days, the incorrect votecount will become official.
      [*] 5.7: The moderator may change the rules at any time.
      [*] 5.8: The moderator has the last say in interpreting the rules. [/list]


      [*] Read all of the rules[/list]

      Setup
      This game will use the Matrix6 setup. This is a semi-open setup.

      In this setup, there are 9 players. Three of the roles will be generated randomly by picking a row or column from the matrix. Then one Mafia Goon and 5 Vanilla Townies are added to maintain a 2:7 mafia:town ratio. The six possible setups are:
      1. 5 Vanilla Townies, 1 Town Jailkeeper, 1 1-Shot Bulletproof Townie, 1 Mafia Roleblocker, 1 Mafia Goon
      2. 6 Vanilla Townies, 1 Town Cop, 2 Mafia Goons
      3. 5 Vanilla Townies, 1 Town Doctor, 1 Town Tracker, 2 Mafia Goons
      4. 6 Vanilla Townies, 1 Town Jailkeeper, 2 Mafia Goons
      5. 5 Vanilla Townies, 1 Town Cop, 1 Town Doctor, 1 Mafia Goon, 1 Mafia Roleblocker
      6. 5 Vanilla Townies, 1 1-Shot Bulletproof Townie, 1 Town Tracker, 2 Mafia Goons


      Role PMs
      [quote]You are a Smiley Person (Vanilla Townie), a person who must always have a smile in this town where being sad is against the law. For the entire day you must keep a smile on your face lest the happiness police catch you, even when you might not truly be happy inside. Each day you can discuss with the other people in the town about who to expel from the town.

      You when when all of the unhappy people have been removed from the town.[/quote]

      [quote]You are a Happiness Inquisitor (Cop), a person in charge of investigating the citizens of the town to determine whether they are happy or not. Each night you may investigate someone and determine whether they are an unhappy person.

      You win when all of the unhappy people have been removed from the town.[/quote]

      [quote]You are a Happiness Enforcer (Jailkeeper), a person in charge of maintaining happiness in the town. Each night you may choose to lock a person up in the happiness chamber. During the night they will not be able to take any action nor can they be targeted by any other action.

      You win when all of the unhappy people have been removed from the town.[/quote]

      [quote]You are a Happiness Advocate (Doctor), someone responsible for cheering up other people. Each night you can visit someone and cheer them up to stop them from becoming sad. You may also stay at home to cheer yourself up, though this is ineffective if you do it consecutively.

      You win when all of the unhappy people have been removed from the town.[/quote]

      [quote]You are a Creepily Happy Stalker (Tracker). Each night you can sneakily follow someone around while wearing a big smile on your face. They will not notice your presence and you will smile at them from the shadows as you see who they visit.

      You win when all of the unhappy people have been removed from the town.[/quote]

      [quote]You are an Optimistic Person (1 shot Bulletproof). You are genuinely happy to be living in this town, and it is hard to get you down. You are resistant toward efforts to make you sad, and it requires an additional night of such efforts to make you depressed.

      You win when all of the unhappy people have been removed from the town.[/quote]

      [quote]You are a Secretly Unhappy Person (Mafia Goon). You hate living in Happy Town where you are forced to hide your true feelings and pretend to be happy. You want to bring an end to this farce by forcing the true face of the people to be revealed. Each night either you or your partner may visit someone and give depressing material to them to make them sad. Once that happens, they will be unable to hide their depression during the day and they will be arrested an executed for being sad. You may talk with your partner here at any time to discuss your actions.

      You win when the unhappy people compose at least half of the people remaining.[/quote]

      [quote]You are a Negative Nancy (Mafia Roleblocker). You hate living in Happy Town where you are forced to hide your true feelings and pretend to be happy. You want to bring an end to this farce by forcing the true face of the people to be revealed. Each night you can visit someone's house and badger them with inane talking, wasting their time and preventing them from doing anything that night. In addition, each night either you or your partner may visit someone and give depressing material to them to make them sad. Once that happens, they will be unable to hide their depression during the day and they will be arrested an executed for being sad. You may talk with your partner here at any time to discuss your actions.

      You win when the unhappy people compose at least half of the people remaining.[/quote]


      Alive (5)
      +mathjay
      +Scipio1
      saturnrocket
      Aminecraftbear
      ThunderHole DXtreme


      Dead(4)
      ++NDMath (Smiley Person)
      DawnTreader ostriches88 (Happiness Advocate)
      lucaswujc (Smiley Person)
      dragonlouis (Smiley Person)


      Events
      Day 1: NDMath hanged
      Night 1: ostriches88 killed
      Day 2: lucaswjc hanged
      Night 2: dragonlouis killed


      PM Prods
       


      Warnings
      lucaswujc: Editing
      Animecraftbear: Editing


      Happy Town was a nice pleasant place where everyone was happy and wore a smile on their face. At least, according to the law everyone was happy, because any unhappy people were executed in order to ensure that their unhappiness would not spread and cause people to be sad. However, there were people in the town who sought to destroy this happy paradise. They have learned to keep their unhappiness concealed while going out and causing havoc by making other people unhappy. The good happy people of Happy Town knew they had to put an end to these evil unhappy people lest the happy lives of all who lived within the town be ruined.

      Do not post until this line is crossed out

      Day 1 begins at 11:00:00 EDT 16 May 2023.
