      Mafia Game 291: Train Mafia (Newbie Game 108)
      ad333   1033
      N Aug 4, 2024 by SiddiquiZ
      [center]Welcome to Mafia Game 291
      Newbie Game 108
      [/center]


      - Important Rules -
      This tab summarizes the most important rules for easy reference.

      For experienced players: everything you need is here, and in the setup tab.
      For new players: you may find it useful to familiarize yourself with the rest of the rules.

      Integrity
      [list][*]Do not edit or delete your posts, even for typos. Just post again.
      [*]Do not OOT (Out of Thread) and talk about this game outside this thread, your role PM, or approved private chats, even if you are dead. Access to spectator chats will be granted upon request.
      [*]Do not gamethrow or intentionally sabotage your wincondition.
      [*]Do not attach files or link to external documents concerning this game. Discussions must stay in this thread.
      [*]Do not use OGI (Out of Game Information). Publicly discussed reads should be made exclusively from information in this thread or past completed games.[/list]

      Activity
      [list][*]Each "Day" is 12 days while each "Night" is 2 days.
      [*]Do not post during night.
      [*]This game uses Dawn start: Day 1 will not start until everyone shows that they have read the rules by completing the confirm task.
      [*]All times will be in Pacific Daylight Time (PDT, UTC-7)
      [*]Activity rules are 48 hours to first PM prod, 72 hours to second PM prod, and 96 hours to replacement status.[/list]

      Voting
      [list][*]You must format your votes correctly. Capitalization does not matter, and capital i/lowercase L are not differentiated.
      [*]Both bold vote and code vote formats are accepted, although bold is preferred. Refer to the Voting tab if you do not know what these are.
      [*]Majority hang is off for Day 1, but it is on starting Day 2.
      [*]Deadline hang is on from Day 1 but it is off for LYLO.
      [*]Votes are locked at LYLO.[/list]

      Etiquette and Warnings

      [list][*]Use common sense.
      [*]Do not use formatting that makes text hard to read.
      [*]You may attack a players opinion, but do not make personal attacks on players themselves.
      [*]Disagreements should be resolved in a way that does not affect gameplay.
      [*]Do not discuss rule violations by other players in the thread; contact the moderators privately.
      [*]First-timers can receive up to 3 warnings before their next offense results in a force replacement or modkill. All other players can receive up to 2.
      [*]Players may be replaced at the moderators' discretion for procedural difficulties.
      [*]All other rules are standard.[/list]

      Setup and Moderators

      [list][*]This game uses the Matrix6 setup.
      [*]Mafia have access to daychat.
      [*]All role mechanics and Night Action Resolutions are standard.
      [*]This game is moderated by ad333.
      [*]This game operates optional discord spectator and mafia private chats using the Unpaid Intern Central server. Contacts the mods to request access.[/list]

      Resources and Support

      [list][*]For any issues, you may contacts us through your role PM or through Discord (akesi).
      [*]For a list of basic resources, refer to the Resources tab below.
      [*]For a more extensive list of resources compiled by the UIMT, go here.
      [*]If this game is causing you significant stress or frustration, feel free to use your role PM to talk or vent. I may not be allowed to give you technical advice, but we can listen or help you find a better way to process events. You may also contact me via Discord if you prefer.[/list]


      [list][*]General
      Credits to Binomial-theorem, chaotic_iak, willwang123, and fdas, among others, as well as the Mafia Universe forum rules, for the rule template.

      The following are standard mafia game rules.


      [list][*]Do not post during the night phase.
      [*]Do not talk about this game's events outside of this thread unless you are specifically given permission to do so by the moderators. Details are in the Moderation Policies tab.
      [*]Do not talk about other ongoing games in this thread. Referring to anything that has happened in an ongoing game, even if you do not say which game it is, is OOT.
      [*]If you are dead, do not post, and do not talk about this game anywhere else. You may still spectate; access to spoiled and unspoiled spectator chats will be offered.
      [*]Do not use any formatting that obscures or conceals text. This includes [color=#FFFFFF], [color=white], and [color=transparent].
      [*]Do not edit or delete posts, even for typos: what goes in the thread stays in the thread. Instead, use EBWOP or EBWON as appropriate.
      [*]Do not quote or pretend to quote any PMs from the mods, including role PMs.
      [*]Do not impersonate the mods.
      [*]Do not lie to the mods.
      [*]Do not abuse loopholes in the rules. Intent will be considered during rule enforcement.
      [*]You may use your role PM to ask questions, such as rule clarifications.[/list]


      [*]Votes and Hangs
      This tab covers voting, unvoting, No Hangs, and hangs.


      [list][*]Votes must be in this format to be counted: Vote: [player username].
      [*]By default, votes should be made in [b] (bold) tags. However, votes made in [code] and [c] tags will also be accepted.
      [*]Usernames in votes must be spelled, but not necessarily capitalized, correctly. Do not use nicknames.
      [*]For the purposes of voting, I (capital i) and l (lowercase L) are considered identical.
      [*]For example, both Vote: mathjay and Vote: mAtHjAy are valid votes, but vote: mathjay, Vote: jay, Vote: mathjay., Vote:mathjay, Vote: mathjay, and Vote: mathjay are invalid.
      [*]Votes followed by extraneous punctuation that is similarly formatted, even with separate tags, are invalid.
      [*]Votes in hide, tip, or quote tags do not count.
      [*]Vote to hang no one by posting Vote: No Hang.
      [*]Unvote by posting Unvote. You do not have to unvote before voting again.
      [*]Votecounts will be posted periodically. Players may request a new VC in bold or in their role PM.
      [*]Invalid votes will not count under any circumstances. Consider notifying the mods in your role PM if you want to purposely fakevote.
      [*]Valid votes will always be counted unless they are clearly unintentional. There is no guarantee that an accidental vote will not be counted.
      [*]Votes will be carried over if a player is replaced.
      [*]The Not Voting section should be ignored if it contradicts another part of the votecount (VC).
      [*]If an error in the votecount is not pointed out within 2 days or by the next EOD, whichever is sooner, the incorrect VC will become official.
      [*]This game uses deadline hang: the player with the most votes at the EOD (End of Day) deadline will be hanged.
      [*]If two or more players have the same number of votes at the EOD deadline, the player who reached that number of votes first will be hanged. Details are in the Moderation Policies tab.
      [*]If no votes have been cast by the deadline, no one will be hanged.
      [*]Starting Day 2, if a player is voted by the majority of living players, then that player will be hanged immediately; and if No Hang is voted by half of living players, a No Hang will occur.
      [*]Upon reaching LYLO (Hang-or-Lose), votes will be locked, meaning that they cannot be changed.
      [*]Deadline hang is off at LYLO. If a majority hang is not reached by the deadline, the day will end without a hang, resulting in an automatic win for the mafia team.
      [*]The moment the deadline occurs, no further votes will be counted. Details are in the Moderation Policies tab.
      [*]If the deadline has passed or a hammer has occurred and the EOD has not been declared, the game will proceed into twilight. Players may still post, but no more votes or unvotes will be counted.
      [*]Once the moderators declare the EOD, the person hanged will be officially eliminated and their role revealed. Night will then immediately begin.[/list]

      [*]Activity
      This tab covers deadlines, activity rules, V/LAs, and replacements.


      [list][*]All times will be in Pacific Daylight Time (PDT, UTC-7), unless otherwise noted.
      [*]Each day phase will be 288 hours (12 days), and each night phase will be 48 hours (2 days).
      [*]The moderators may extend deadlines at their discretion.
      [*]The current deadline can be found in the bottom of the OP (Original Post, or post #1).
      [*]If a player with an NA (Night Action) anticipates being unavailable during the night phase, they may submit any night actions to be performed in advance.
      [*]If a player with an NA has not submitted their action by 24 hours before the night deadline, a reminder will be sent.
      [*]If the moderators do not receive an NA submission from a player by the night deadline, the player will not perform an action that night.
      [*]Night results will be sent after the night deadline.
      [*]Night will end when the moderators make a post declaring the end of night (EON). You may not post in the thread until then, even if the night deadline has passed. Instead, contact the mods for updates if they miss a deadline.
      [*]Players who are temporarily unable to fulfill activity requirements can declare a V/LA (Vacation/Long Absence) by posting the V/LA dates in bold in-thread or in their role PM. Players on a V/LA will not be prodded.
      [*]V/LAs should be shorter than one week. For longer absences, contact the moderators for options.
      [*]Players who no longer wish to or are unable to play in this game can request replacement by posting Request Replacement in-thread or in their role PM.
      [*]Players who have replaced out generally will not be allowed to replace back in.
      [*]Players will receive their first PM prod if they have not made a game-advancing post for 48 hours and are not on V/LA. Details on "game-advancing post" are in the Moderation Policies tab.
      [*]Players will receive their second PM prod if they have not made a game-advancing post for 72 hours and are not on V/LA.
      [*]Players will be replaced if they have not made a game-advancing post for 96 hours and are not on V/LA, unless they post before the moderators find a replacement.
      [*]If a player receives 4 PM Prods, they will be replaced.
      [*]If a player reaches replacement status more than once, they will be replaced.
      [*]Activity Checks (ACs) will be posted periodically. Players may request a new AC in bold or in their role PM.
      [*]Activity will reset overnight. Players will not receive prods between twilight and daystart.
      [*]If you have access to a private topic, you may request that a partner be poked. The moderators will send a notification via PM to the specified player, but this will not count as an official prod.
      [*]If a player is postbanned by the AoPS Sheriff, they will be replaced. Details are in the Moderation Policies tab.[list]

      [*]Integrity and Etiquette
      This tab covers integrity recommendations, player etiquette, warning limits, and examples of inconsiderate gameplay.


      [list][*]Do not gamethrow.
      [*]Do not discuss player alignments based on V/LAs, replacements, warnings, force replacements, modkills, or other interactions with moderators.
      [*]Do not discuss rule violations, especially violations by other players in the thread. If you wish, contact the moderators privately through your role PM or Discord.
      [*]Any significant, game-related, and intentionally exclusive player-to-player communication outside of moderator-sanctioned channels is prohibited.
      [*]Do not publicly reference OGI (Out of Game Information) in reads or create situations outside the thread that players could reasonably consider alignment indicative.[/list]

      The above rules are attempts to preserve the spirit of the game and should not affect most players. For specific details and examples, click here.


      [list][*]Do not make personal attacks. You may attack a player's opinion, but do not demean the player themselves.
      [*]Do not spam.
      [*]Follow AoPS Community Guidelines and the AoPS Terms of Service.
      [*]Be mature and use common sense.
      [*]Behavior that disrupts the game for players and makes it unreasonably hard for them to read and play may result in a warning.
      Causing significant disruptions to gameplay may result in a force replacement at the moderators' discretion.
      [*]For minor rule infractions, first-timers can receive up to three warnings, while all other players can receive up to two. A player may receive multiple warnings for a single infraction. A moderator can receive infinite warnings.[/list]

      The above rules broadly address most etiquette issues. For specific details and examples of improper behavior, click here.


      [*]- Moderation Policies -

      [*]Moderator Information
      This tab provides technical information about this game.


      [list][*]ad333 is the moderator of Mafia Game 291.
      [*][OTHER CONTRIBUTORS/UNPAID INTERNS] have contributed to flavor, setup, OCRSTM, feedback, and management of the private chat discord system.
      [*]This game uses the Unpaid Intern Central consolidated private chat system. Participants of this game will be granted access as appropriate.
      [*]Red text is used for votecounts, warnings, and other announcements by the moderators. It is also used for mafia flavor-related text.
      [*]Blue text is used for activity checks, confirm counts, and other non-essential posts by the moderators.
      [*]Green text is used for town flavor-related text.
      [*]Custom shades of these colors may be used for aesthetic purposes.
      [*]Current custom shades are: Town flavor green v.2 (#2be368) and Activity Check blue (#005dff). For a full list of custom colors, click here.
      [*]The moderators may change the rules at any time. Major rule changes will be announced at the bottom of the OP. All changes will also be noted in the modlog and OCRSTM Version History.
      [*]Players will not be retroactively penalized for violating new rules.
      [*]Major changes to the OP may be made in between games. The most important changes will be noted in the OCRSTM Version History.
      [*]The moderators pledge to treat players fairly and keep moderator interventions to a minimum; however, we reserve the right to make the final judgement in the moderation of this game.[/list]

      MG[NUMBER] OP is based on Overcomplicated RulesetTM (OCRSTM) 10.
      Current version: 10.0.1
      Version History

      OCRSTM 10 is available for public use. If you are interested in using OCRSTM in your own games, click here.
      [/list]
      Setup
      This game is based on the Matrix6 setup. This is a semi-open setup.

      In this setup, there are 9 players. Before the game starts, the setup will be randomly chosen from 6 possible role combinations:
      [list][*]Setup 1: 1 Town Jailkeeper, 6 Vanilla Townies, 2 Mafia Goons
      [*]Setup 2: 1 Town Cop, 1 Town Doctor, 5 Vanilla Townies, 1 Mafia Roleblocker, 1 Mafia Goon
      [*]Setup 3: 1 Town Tracker, 1 1-shot Bulletproof Townie, 5 Vanilla Townies, 2 Mafia Goons
      [*]Setup 4/A: 1 Town Jailkeeper, 1 1-shot Bulletproof Townie, 5 Vanilla Townies, 1 Mafia Roleblocker, 1 Mafia Goon
      [*]Setup 5/B: 1 Town Cop, 6 Vanilla Townies, 2 Mafia Goons
      [*]Setup 6/C: 1 Town Doctor, 1 Town Tracker, 5 Vanilla Townies, 2 Mafia Goons[/list]
      Other important setup mechanics:
      [list][*]This game uses Dawn start. Once all the players confirm by completing the confirm task, Dawn will end, Day 1 will start, and the EOD deadline will be 12 days from then.
      [*]Doctors cannot protect themselves two nights in a row.
      [*]A Mafia Roleblocker's action takes precedence over a Town Jailkeeper's action.
      [*]A Mafia Roleblocker can kill and roleblock on the same night.
      [*]Cop results are sane.
      [*]Trackers can differentiate between "No movement" and "No result."
      [*]Mafia have daychat.
      [*]Mafia factional kills (NKs) are not compulsive. [/list]
      Role PMs
      Note: The Flavor of the Role PMs listed here will NOT match the role PM you receive, this is for flavor reasons (this was a terrible mistake on my part), however the abilities will remain the same.

      Hello ERROR

      You are Ella (Vanilla Townie)

      Before coming on the train you... that's odd. You can't remember. You've always been here, with your friends, and while you can still feel them here you can't see them anyways. These new people seem nice, but a couple of them remind you of your more unkind friends. But you've survived their bullying & surely you'll live through this. Though you do miss your friends. And there's been weird things going on. Your stuff got moved around. You'll keep them safe at all costs. I would wish you good luck, but it seems your Fate cannot be changed in the same way as the others.

      Your power lies in your observation skills, your voice, and your vote. You may NOT claim your flavor.

      You win when all Mafia are killed, so your goal is to find them. Play towards your win condition, and good luck.


      Hello ERROR

      You are Luke (Mafia Goon)

      God. What a bunch of weaklings. Too busy caring for each other to do anything useful. Whatever, more power for you, and after all nobody could do anything better than you. It's only a matter of time before they start disrupting your perfect system though. This train is so slow too, you desperately wish you could be in a car, though you've never been outside of this train. You once told another passenger and they looked annoyed. They're going to get you for that. I mean they're probably rifling through your belongings at this very moment looking for something incriminating. That's it. You have to get everybody who's not on your side off of the train. And you don't care if you leave while doing it because of the better future it will create, which is a good thing too since the omens have not been looking good recently.

      Your partners devised a communication system so that you can talk with your allies at any time. During the night, you also collectively eliminate one other player from the train.

      You win when all Town are killed, or nothing can prevent this outcome.

      Hello, you are The Jailkeeper

      Whenever any feuds get too intense you always break them up. It deeply pains you to do so, but you've long learned that the best strategy is to isolate one of the parties completely. After many iterations, your friends made a lock that's unbreakable from either side but you're the only one they trust to be able to use it. You've come close to unlocking it early several times, but couldn't bear the thought of breaking everyone's trust.

      Each night you can target any player and will both prevent them from taking any actions and stop them from being killed by the mafia night kill.

      You win when all Mafia are killed, so your goal is to find them. Play towards your win condition, and good luck.

      Hello, you are The 1-Shot BP

      You trust everybody else on the train as much as everyone, but you can't get over the nagging fear that somebody's going to come in to your room and kill you. That's kind of odd, since this is a train, not to mention how close everybody is, but it helps you sleep at night. With a bit of help you made a system that, once it detects somebody's trying to kill you, will raise walls around your bed. But you couldn't ever make it re-usable, but you'd always make another if you needed to. Though in the many years you've been on the train nothing's happened.

      The first time you are targeted by a mafia night kill, you will survive.

      You win when all Mafia are killed, so your goal is to find them. Play towards your win condition, and good luck.

      Hello, you are The Cop

      Whenever you're doing something with your friends you always bring along a book. Not because the conversations are boring but because the books are so interesting. You're mostly on a non-fiction kick these days. As a result you've become the go-to friend not only for any existing knowledge but for finding out anything. Especially about other people. Evil always leaves a paper trail, and you can follow it like no other.

      Each night you can target any player and will be informed of their alignment: either Town or Mafia.

      You win when all Mafia are killed, so your goal is to find them. Play towards your win condition, and good luck.

      Hello, you are The Tracker

      You've always been eerily quiet, to the point where if somebody isn't looking at you they won't know you're there. And you've gotten pretty good at hiding yourself too. Whenever the occasional new face joins the train you always watch out to see where they're going. However you do get a little bit too focused and wouldn't even notice if someone punched them in the face, so long as they didn't punch back.

      Each night you can target any player and will be informed of who, if anybody, they visit during that night.

      You win when all Mafia are killed, so your goal is to find them. Play towards your win condition, and good luck.

      Hello, you are The Doctor

      You've wanted absolutely nothing more than to be able to protect your friends, and after several years of hard training you've finally been able to do it. You've been able to help the group get through the occasional rough patch, but you can only hope that you're able to help this new group of passengers. You value nothing more than life itself, and even one more day of life extended is a miracle you could never have expected.

      Each night you can target any player and protect them from the mafia night kill.

      You win when all Mafia are killed, so your goal is to find them. Play towards your win condition, and good luck.

      Hello, you are The Mafia Roleblocker

      Luke always told you stories of a time when the train was much more quiet, and after that you've always been trying to restore that ideal. You tried just staying in your room, but not only would people keep dragging you out, it was still loud anyways. So then you tried going outside during the night, but someone always eventually went outside. So you tried to mitigate this by copying the blueprints The Jailkeeper uses for his locks, and while that helped, it was still too loud during the day. So you resolved to get everyone who wouldn't be quiet off the train.

      Your partners devised a communication system so that you can talk with your allies at any time. During the night, you also collectively eliminate one other player from the train.
      Furthermore, you can target any player and prevent them from taking any actions that night.

      You win when all Town are killed, or nothing can prevent this outcome.


      Alive (8)
      1. NDMath++
      2. Scipio1++
      3. mathjay+
      4. Ruegerbyrd

      #1VPM h  Jul 12, 2024, 7:22 PM
      Y by
      Welcome to Mafia Game 291
      Newbie Game 108


      - Important Rules -
      This tab summarizes the most important rules for easy reference.

      For experienced players: everything you need is here, and in the setup tab.
      For new players: you may find it useful to familiarize yourself with the rest of the rules.

      Integrity
      • Do not edit or delete your posts, even for typos. Just post again.
      • Do not OOT (Out of Thread) and talk about this game outside this thread, your role PM, or approved private chats, even if you are dead. Access to spectator chats will be granted upon request.
      • Do not gamethrow or intentionally sabotage your wincondition.
      • Do not attach files or link to external documents concerning this game. Discussions must stay in this thread.
      • Do not use OGI (Out of Game Information). Publicly discussed reads should be made exclusively from information in this thread or past completed games.

      Activity
      • Each "Day" is 12 days while each "Night" is 2 days.
      • Do not post during night.
      • This game uses Dawn start: Day 1 will not start until everyone shows that they have read the rules by completing the confirm task.
      • All times will be in Pacific Daylight Time (PDT, UTC-7)
      • Activity rules are 48 hours to first PM prod, 72 hours to second PM prod, and 96 hours to replacement status.

      Voting
      • You must format your votes correctly. Capitalization does not matter, and capital i/lowercase L are not differentiated.
      • Both bold vote and code vote formats are accepted, although bold is preferred. Refer to the Voting tab if you do not know what these are.
      • Majority hang is off for Day 1, but it is on starting Day 2.
      • Deadline hang is on from Day 1 but it is off for LYLO.
      • Votes are locked at LYLO.

      Etiquette and Warnings
      • Use common sense.
      • Do not use formatting that makes text hard to read.
      • You may attack a players opinion, but do not make personal attacks on players themselves.
      • Disagreements should be resolved in a way that does not affect gameplay.
      • Do not discuss rule violations by other players in the thread; contact the moderators privately.
      • First-timers can receive up to 3 warnings before their next offense results in a force replacement or modkill. All other players can receive up to 2.
      • Players may be replaced at the moderators' discretion for procedural difficulties.
      • All other rules are standard.

      Setup and Moderators
      • This game uses the Matrix6 setup.
      • Mafia have access to daychat.
      • All role mechanics and Night Action Resolutions are standard.
      • This game is moderated by ad333.
      • This game operates optional discord spectator and mafia private chats using the Unpaid Intern Central server. Contacts the mods to request access.

      Resources and Support
      • For any issues, you may contacts us through your role PM or through Discord (akesi).
      • For a list of basic resources, refer to the Resources tab below.
      • For a more extensive list of resources compiled by the UIMT, go here.
      • If this game is causing you significant stress or frustration, feel free to use your role PM to talk or vent. I may not be allowed to give you technical advice, but we can listen or help you find a better way to process events. You may also contact me via Discord if you prefer.

      • General
        Credits to Binomial-theorem, chaotic_iak, willwang123, and fdas, among others, as well as the Mafia Universe forum rules, for the rule template.

        The following are standard mafia game rules.

        • Do not post during the night phase.
        • Do not talk about this game's events outside of this thread unless you are specifically given permission to do so by the moderators. Details are in the Moderation Policies tab.
        • Do not talk about other ongoing games in this thread. Referring to anything that has happened in an ongoing game, even if you do not say which game it is, is OOT.
        • If you are dead, do not post, and do not talk about this game anywhere else. You may still spectate; access to spoiled and unspoiled spectator chats will be offered.
        • Do not use any formatting that obscures or conceals text. This includes [color=#FFFFFF], [color=white], and [color=transparent].
        • Do not edit or delete posts, even for typos: what goes in the thread stays in the thread. Instead, use EBWOP or EBWON as appropriate.
        • Do not quote or pretend to quote any PMs from the mods, including role PMs.
        • Do not impersonate the mods.
        • Do not lie to the mods.
        • Do not abuse loopholes in the rules. Intent will be considered during rule enforcement.
        • You may use your role PM to ask questions, such as rule clarifications.

      • Votes and Hangs
        This tab covers voting, unvoting, No Hangs, and hangs.

        • Votes must be in this format to be counted: Vote: [player username].
        • By default, votes should be made in [b] (bold) tags. However, votes made in [code] and [c] tags will also be accepted.
        • Usernames in votes must be spelled, but not necessarily capitalized, correctly. Do not use nicknames.
        • For the purposes of voting, I (capital i) and l (lowercase L) are considered identical.
        • For example, both Vote: mathjay and Vote: mAtHjAy are valid votes, but vote: mathjay, Vote: jay, Vote: mathjay., Vote:mathjay, Vote: mathjay, and Vote: mathjay are invalid.
        • Votes followed by extraneous punctuation that is similarly formatted, even with separate tags, are invalid.
        • Votes in hide, tip, or quote tags do not count.
        • Vote to hang no one by posting Vote: No Hang.
        • Unvote by posting Unvote. You do not have to unvote before voting again.
        • Votecounts will be posted periodically. Players may request a new VC in bold or in their role PM.
        • Invalid votes will not count under any circumstances. Consider notifying the mods in your role PM if you want to purposely fakevote.
        • Valid votes will always be counted unless they are clearly unintentional. There is no guarantee that an accidental vote will not be counted.
        • Votes will be carried over if a player is replaced.
        • The Not Voting section should be ignored if it contradicts another part of the votecount (VC).
        • If an error in the votecount is not pointed out within 2 days or by the next EOD, whichever is sooner, the incorrect VC will become official.
        • This game uses deadline hang: the player with the most votes at the EOD (End of Day) deadline will be hanged.
        • If two or more players have the same number of votes at the EOD deadline, the player who reached that number of votes first will be hanged. Details are in the Moderation Policies tab.
        • If no votes have been cast by the deadline, no one will be hanged.
        • Starting Day 2, if a player is voted by the majority of living players, then that player will be hanged immediately; and if No Hang is voted by half of living players, a No Hang will occur.
        • Upon reaching LYLO (Hang-or-Lose), votes will be locked, meaning that they cannot be changed.
        • Deadline hang is off at LYLO. If a majority hang is not reached by the deadline, the day will end without a hang, resulting in an automatic win for the mafia team.
        • The moment the deadline occurs, no further votes will be counted. Details are in the Moderation Policies tab.
        • If the deadline has passed or a hammer has occurred and the EOD has not been declared, the game will proceed into twilight. Players may still post, but no more votes or unvotes will be counted.
        • Once the moderators declare the EOD, the person hanged will be officially eliminated and their role revealed. Night will then immediately begin.
      • Activity
        This tab covers deadlines, activity rules, V/LAs, and replacements.

        • All times will be in Pacific Daylight Time (PDT, UTC-7), unless otherwise noted.
        • Each day phase will be 288 hours (12 days), and each night phase will be 48 hours (2 days).
        • The moderators may extend deadlines at their discretion.
        • The current deadline can be found in the bottom of the OP (Original Post, or post #1).
        • If a player with an NA (Night Action) anticipates being unavailable during the night phase, they may submit any night actions to be performed in advance.
        • If a player with an NA has not submitted their action by 24 hours before the night deadline, a reminder will be sent.
        • If the moderators do not receive an NA submission from a player by the night deadline, the player will not perform an action that night.
        • Night results will be sent after the night deadline.
        • Night will end when the moderators make a post declaring the end of night (EON). You may not post in the thread until then, even if the night deadline has passed. Instead, contact the mods for updates if they miss a deadline.
        • Players who are temporarily unable to fulfill activity requirements can declare a V/LA (Vacation/Long Absence) by posting the V/LA dates in bold in-thread or in their role PM. Players on a V/LA will not be prodded.
        • V/LAs should be shorter than one week. For longer absences, contact the moderators for options.
        • Players who no longer wish to or are unable to play in this game can request replacement by posting Request Replacement in-thread or in their role PM.
        • Players who have replaced out generally will not be allowed to replace back in.
        • Players will receive their first PM prod if they have not made a game-advancing post for 48 hours and are not on V/LA. Details on "game-advancing post" are in the Moderation Policies tab.
        • Players will receive their second PM prod if they have not made a game-advancing post for 72 hours and are not on V/LA.
        • Players will be replaced if they have not made a game-advancing post for 96 hours and are not on V/LA, unless they post before the moderators find a replacement.
        • If a player receives 4 PM Prods, they will be replaced.
        • If a player reaches replacement status more than once, they will be replaced.
        • Activity Checks (ACs) will be posted periodically. Players may request a new AC in bold or in their role PM.
        • Activity will reset overnight. Players will not receive prods between twilight and daystart.
        • If you have access to a private topic, you may request that a partner be poked. The moderators will send a notification via PM to the specified player, but this will not count as an official prod.
        • If a player is postbanned by the AoPS Sheriff, they will be replaced. Details are in the Moderation Policies tab.
      • Integrity and Etiquette
        This tab covers integrity recommendations, player etiquette, warning limits, and examples of inconsiderate gameplay.

        • Do not gamethrow.
        • Do not discuss player alignments based on V/LAs, replacements, warnings, force replacements, modkills, or other interactions with moderators.
        • Do not discuss rule violations, especially violations by other players in the thread. If you wish, contact the moderators privately through your role PM or Discord.
        • Any significant, game-related, and intentionally exclusive player-to-player communication outside of moderator-sanctioned channels is prohibited.
        • Do not publicly reference OGI (Out of Game Information) in reads or create situations outside the thread that players could reasonably consider alignment indicative.

        The above rules are attempts to preserve the spirit of the game and should not affect most players. For specific details and examples, click here.

        • Do not make personal attacks. You may attack a player's opinion, but do not demean the player themselves.
        • Do not spam.
        • Follow AoPS Community Guidelines and the AoPS Terms of Service.
        • Be mature and use common sense.
        • Behavior that disrupts the game for players and makes it unreasonably hard for them to read and play may result in a warning.
          Causing significant disruptions to gameplay may result in a force replacement at the moderators' discretion.
        • For minor rule infractions, first-timers can receive up to three warnings, while all other players can receive up to two. A player may receive multiple warnings for a single infraction. A moderator can receive infinite warnings.

        The above rules broadly address most etiquette issues. For specific details and examples of improper behavior, click here.

      • - Moderation Policies -
      • Moderator Information
        This tab provides technical information about this game.

        • ad333 is the moderator of Mafia Game 291.
        • [OTHER CONTRIBUTORS/UNPAID INTERNS] have contributed to flavor, setup, OCRSTM, feedback, and management of the private chat discord system.
        • This game uses the Unpaid Intern Central consolidated private chat system. Participants of this game will be granted access as appropriate.
        • Red text is used for votecounts, warnings, and other announcements by the moderators. It is also used for mafia flavor-related text.
        • Blue text is used for activity checks, confirm counts, and other non-essential posts by the moderators.
        • Green text is used for town flavor-related text.
        • Custom shades of these colors may be used for aesthetic purposes.
        • Current custom shades are: Town flavor green v.2 (#2be368) and Activity Check blue (#005dff). For a full list of custom colors, click here.
        • The moderators may change the rules at any time. Major rule changes will be announced at the bottom of the OP. All changes will also be noted in the modlog and OCRSTM Version History.
        • Players will not be retroactively penalized for violating new rules.
        • Major changes to the OP may be made in between games. The most important changes will be noted in the OCRSTM Version History.
        • The moderators pledge to treat players fairly and keep moderator interventions to a minimum; however, we reserve the right to make the final judgement in the moderation of this game.

        MG[NUMBER] OP is based on Overcomplicated RulesetTM (OCRSTM) 10.
        Current version: 10.0.1
        Version History

        OCRSTM 10 is available for public use. If you are interested in using OCRSTM in your own games, click here.
      Setup
      This game is based on the Matrix6 setup. This is a semi-open setup.

      In this setup, there are 9 players. Before the game starts, the setup will be randomly chosen from 6 possible role combinations:
      • Setup 1: 1 Town Jailkeeper, 6 Vanilla Townies, 2 Mafia Goons
      • Setup 2: 1 Town Cop, 1 Town Doctor, 5 Vanilla Townies, 1 Mafia Roleblocker, 1 Mafia Goon
      • Setup 3: 1 Town Tracker, 1 1-shot Bulletproof Townie, 5 Vanilla Townies, 2 Mafia Goons
      • Setup 4/A: 1 Town Jailkeeper, 1 1-shot Bulletproof Townie, 5 Vanilla Townies, 1 Mafia Roleblocker, 1 Mafia Goon
      • Setup 5/B: 1 Town Cop, 6 Vanilla Townies, 2 Mafia Goons
      • Setup 6/C: 1 Town Doctor, 1 Town Tracker, 5 Vanilla Townies, 2 Mafia Goons
      Other important setup mechanics:
      • This game uses Dawn start. Once all the players confirm by completing the confirm task, Dawn will end, Day 1 will start, and the EOD deadline will be 12 days from then.
      • Doctors cannot protect themselves two nights in a row.
      • A Mafia Roleblocker's action takes precedence over a Town Jailkeeper's action.
      • A Mafia Roleblocker can kill and roleblock on the same night.
      • Cop results are sane.
      • Trackers can differentiate between "No movement" and "No result."
      • Mafia have daychat.
      • Mafia factional kills (NKs) are not compulsive.
      Role PMs
      Note: The Flavor of the Role PMs listed here will NOT match the role PM you receive, this is for flavor reasons (this was a terrible mistake on my part), however the abilities will remain the same.

      Hello ERROR

      You are Ella (Vanilla Townie)

      Before coming on the train you... that's odd. You can't remember. You've always been here, with your friends, and while you can still feel them here you can't see them anyways. These new people seem nice, but a couple of them remind you of your more unkind friends. But you've survived their bullying & surely you'll live through this. Though you do miss your friends. And there's been weird things going on. Your stuff got moved around. You'll keep them safe at all costs. I would wish you good luck, but it seems your Fate cannot be changed in the same way as the others.

      Your power lies in your observation skills, your voice, and your vote. You may NOT claim your flavor.

      You win when all Mafia are killed, so your goal is to find them. Play towards your win condition, and good luck.


      Hello ERROR

      You are Luke (Mafia Goon)

      God. What a bunch of weaklings. Too busy caring for each other to do anything useful. Whatever, more power for you, and after all nobody could do anything better than you. It's only a matter of time before they start disrupting your perfect system though. This train is so slow too, you desperately wish you could be in a car, though you've never been outside of this train. You once told another passenger and they looked annoyed. They're going to get you for that. I mean they're probably rifling through your belongings at this very moment looking for something incriminating. That's it. You have to get everybody who's not on your side off of the train. And you don't care if you leave while doing it because of the better future it will create, which is a good thing too since the omens have not been looking good recently.

      Your partners devised a communication system so that you can talk with your allies at any time. During the night, you also collectively eliminate one other player from the train.

      You win when all Town are killed, or nothing can prevent this outcome.

      Hello, you are The Jailkeeper

      Whenever any feuds get too intense you always break them up. It deeply pains you to do so, but you've long learned that the best strategy is to isolate one of the parties completely. After many iterations, your friends made a lock that's unbreakable from either side but you're the only one they trust to be able to use it. You've come close to unlocking it early several times, but couldn't bear the thought of breaking everyone's trust.

      Each night you can target any player and will both prevent them from taking any actions and stop them from being killed by the mafia night kill.

      You win when all Mafia are killed, so your goal is to find them. Play towards your win condition, and good luck.

      Hello, you are The 1-Shot BP

      You trust everybody else on the train as much as everyone, but you can't get over the nagging fear that somebody's going to come in to your room and kill you. That's kind of odd, since this is a train, not to mention how close everybody is, but it helps you sleep at night. With a bit of help you made a system that, once it detects somebody's trying to kill you, will raise walls around your bed. But you couldn't ever make it re-usable, but you'd always make another if you needed to. Though in the many years you've been on the train nothing's happened.

      The first time you are targeted by a mafia night kill, you will survive.

      You win when all Mafia are killed, so your goal is to find them. Play towards your win condition, and good luck.

      Hello, you are The Cop

      Whenever you're doing something with your friends you always bring along a book. Not because the conversations are boring but because the books are so interesting. You're mostly on a non-fiction kick these days. As a result you've become the go-to friend not only for any existing knowledge but for finding out anything. Especially about other people. Evil always leaves a paper trail, and you can follow it like no other.

      Each night you can target any player and will be informed of their alignment: either Town or Mafia.

      You win when all Mafia are killed, so your goal is to find them. Play towards your win condition, and good luck.

      Hello, you are The Tracker

      You've always been eerily quiet, to the point where if somebody isn't looking at you they won't know you're there. And you've gotten pretty good at hiding yourself too. Whenever the occasional new face joins the train you always watch out to see where they're going. However you do get a little bit too focused and wouldn't even notice if someone punched them in the face, so long as they didn't punch back.

      Each night you can target any player and will be informed of who, if anybody, they visit during that night.

      You win when all Mafia are killed, so your goal is to find them. Play towards your win condition, and good luck.

      Hello, you are The Doctor

      You've wanted absolutely nothing more than to be able to protect your friends, and after several years of hard training you've finally been able to do it. You've been able to help the group get through the occasional rough patch, but you can only hope that you're able to help this new group of passengers. You value nothing more than life itself, and even one more day of life extended is a miracle you could never have expected.

      Each night you can target any player and protect them from the mafia night kill.

      You win when all Mafia are killed, so your goal is to find them. Play towards your win condition, and good luck.

      Hello, you are The Mafia Roleblocker

      Luke always told you stories of a time when the train was much more quiet, and after that you've always been trying to restore that ideal. You tried just staying in your room, but not only would people keep dragging you out, it was still loud anyways. So then you tried going outside during the night, but someone always eventually went outside. So you tried to mitigate this by copying the blueprints The Jailkeeper uses for his locks, and while that helped, it was still too loud during the day. So you resolved to get everyone who wouldn't be quiet off the train.

      Your partners devised a communication system so that you can talk with your allies at any time. During the night, you also collectively eliminate one other player from the train.
      Furthermore, you can target any player and prevent them from taking any actions that night.

      You win when all Town are killed, or nothing can prevent this outcome.

      #871VPM h  Aug 2, 2024, 5:31 PM
      Y by
      ml double check ur mech just to be sure ig


      Setup 1: 1 Town Jailkeeper, 6 Vanilla Townies, 2 Mafia Goons

      If u are JK and you jailed anyone in [K12, Siddz, rueger], claim your action immediately to win.
      If you jailed [nd, scipio, mj, ml] do not claim


      Setup 2: 1 Town Cop, 1 Town Doctor, 5 Vanilla Townies, 1 Mafia Roleblocker, 1 Mafia Goon

      Cop: if you have a red (mafia) result, claim immediately. if green result, don't claim yet.
      Doctor: never claim

      Setup 3: 1 Town Tracker, 1 1-shot Bulletproof Townie, 5 Vanilla Townies, 2 Mafia Goons

      Tracker: if you got movement, claim immediately. If not, not yet.
      1SBP: Claim immediately.


      Setup 4/A: 1 Town Jailkeeper, 1 1-shot Bulletproof Townie, 5 Vanilla Townies, 1 Mafia Roleblocker, 1 Mafia Goon

      neither should claim.


      Setup 5/B: 1 Town Cop, 6 Vanilla Townies, 2 Mafia Goons

      if red, claim. if not, dont.


      Setup 6/C: 1 Town Doctor, 1 Town Tracker, 5 Vanilla Townies, 2 Mafia Goons

      if tracker got movement, claim. if not, dont.
      doctor never claim.

      #879VPM h  Aug 2, 2024, 5:50 PM
      Y by
      idk ur tr reason for k12 in ur wall does nothing to me
      i dont meld with it

      1. thread dynamics
      k12 really, really, really fell off.
      i'm choosing to read it as them having difficulty making reads but not with any other aspect of the game. Did he even hard commit to the mathgood wagon? because

      2. sid/rug vanity push
      he seeded reads with rug specifically and only rug from way way early on, from the post where he linked like 5 different rug games and was like, "if rug posts the same as that 3p game she's probably scum" which i took to mean rug had no scumgames on record and now in hindsight, implies hindsight bias or agenda. like, it should be "rug does/does not sound similar to her town games" but it wasn't even that.

      and then while thread was pushing lhf k12 pushed sid/rug wolfteam out of nowhere with interactions. idt he mentioned sring them individually, i certainly dont remember him sring sid out of context of that w/w. sorta looks like busywork cuz i don't remember k12 really saying much about mathgood/shari at all.

      3. eod
      if w!k12 then they were paralyzed at eid because if he hard pushes mathgood, then because shari/mg cws then he looks like he's defending shari. at the same time, he can't push shari because he's hoping we'll just change our minds without him having to do something himself. so i think the rug/sid thing is just entirely for towncred specifically because he feels so disconnected from eod until the end.

      idk i can read again, but i think it was pretty clear that shari was going over instead of mg by the time k12 said "well fine ill sheep"
